loans.name: Rafia

texts.en:
Rafia is a 37-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her one child. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Rafia is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.

She needs different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc., for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories.

Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also will be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Rafia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis es sinónimo de emprender ya que las ganas de salir adelante lo han caracterizado, está estudiando en la universidad y la vez tiene una pulpería y vende comida en su casa. Su principal apoyo es su mama quien le ayuda a realizar los platillos que ofrece a su clientela. Poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante y no descansara hasta verse graduado de la carrera que está estudiando. Para incrementar el inventario de su pulpería Luis solicita un crédito para comprar granos básicos, artículos de uso personal y de limpieza, así podrá ofrecerles a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en: Luis thinks his name is synonymous with "entrepreneur." Since the desire to succeed has characterized him, he is studying at university and at the same time has a convenience store and sells food from home. His main support is his mother, who helps him make the dishes offered to his customers. Little by little he has managed to get ahead and will not rest until he can see himself graduate. To increase the inventory of his store, Luis is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, personal products, and cleaning products, so he can offer his customers a greater variety of products.

loans.use: to buy basic grains and personal/cleaning products.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 64 years old and married, with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Dolores runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like canned goods, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, shampoo, and snack foods.

Dolores has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Dolores would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, shampoo, and snack foods.

loans.name: Kumri

texts.ru: Кумри жительница города Курган-Тюбе. Она счастливая бабушка. У нее один сын, невестка и 3 внука. Кумри 57 лет. Она уроженка города. Кумри имеет земельный участок, где выращивает растение. Она больше времени проводит на земле. Ее сын занимается таксистом в городе. Кумри продвигает деятельность мужа. Она вместе мужем занимались сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Кумри решила взять кредит для мероприятия обрезания внука. Из-за нехватки денежных средств она обратилась за кредитом. Кумри заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: Kumri is a resident of the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is a happy grandmother. She has one son, a daughter-in-law and three grandchildren. Kumri is 57 years old. She is a native of the city. Kumri has a plot of land where she grows crops. She spends most of her time on the land. Her son is a taxi driver in the city. Kumri carries on her husband's business. She and her husband used to farm. Kumri has decided to take a loan for her grandson's circumcision event. She has applied for a loan due to a lack of funds. Kumri expresses her gratitude in advance.

loans.use: to pay for her grandson's circumcision event.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Remedios works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and coconut wine vending. Remedios is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Renilda

texts.en:
Renilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, candies, soft-drinks, beers, canned goods, noodles, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Renilda has been in this business for 3 years. Renilda earns more income from fish vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Renilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, candies, soft-drinks, beers, canned goods, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a 32-year-old, married woman with five children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Doris has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Doris has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nursanah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP-UMKM’s clients, Nursanah, who is a 50 year old married woman with one son and one daughter. She is a housewife and her husband is an animal breeder.

Nursanah has asked for a loan of IDR 7,200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation services at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and a water supplys but Nursanah will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation services at her home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for her family.

loans.name: Magangawa

texts.en:
Magangawa is a married mother of six children, five of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of 2 children and has been doing her business of clothes selling for past 4 years and contributes her income with her husband to manage the house hold.

Shabana needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling purpose but due to insufficient financial means she is not in the position to buy these clothes for her business purpose therefore She has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes easily, so that she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.
On this financial assistance Shehnaz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her clothing business.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol operates her dry goods business. She offers plastic ware, shoes, blouses, and short pants at their market.

She is 27 years old, married, and has two children who are still attending school. The couple has been working hard to sustain their daily necessities and send their children into a higher level of education. Carol's husband is a welder and vulcanizer within their local community.

With her determination to have a stable source for her family's income, she is asking for financial assistance amounting to PHP 50,000. This loan amount will be used to purchase additional stock of plastic ware, shoes, blouses, and pants to sell. She is looking forward to the continuous smooth flow of her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of plastic ware, shoes, blouses, and pants to sell.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Analyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business where she buys and sells gasoline in the Philippines. She earns additional income from food vending. Analyn is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional containers of gasoline to sell for her business.

Analyn has sustained her business activities through 12 prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Alicia works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending.

Alicia is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF for her motorcycle transport business, to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her realize her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 46 years old and is married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Chona has borrowed and repaid 13 prior loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns income from food vending.

Chona aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Alirio

texts.es: Alirio es un latonero por tradición que aprendió esta labor de su padre, él reside en Cogua un municipio de Cundinamarca en donde tiene su taller y  gracias a las experiencias obtenidas de sus anteriores empleos en talleres de latonería y pintura, pudo perfeccionar su arte y ofrecer trabajos de calidad.  Sus principales clientes se encuentran en esta localidad y llevan sus vehículos hasta su taller  en el horario comprendido entre 8 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m. cualquier día de la semana. Alirio está muy comprometido con su negocio, él considera que este es su generador de beneficios para su familia y que por eso desea aplicar a su primer credikiva que actualmente tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para adquirir activos fijos que le permitan ampliar la capacidad y eficiencia de su taller entre ellos un compresor y herramientas. Su meta a futuro es tener un taller más automatizado que le permita mejorar sus servicios y con ello sus ingresos para ofrecer a sus hijos una excelente educación.
texts.en:
Alirio is a panel beater by tradition. He learnt the trade from his father. He lives in Cogua, a municipality of Cundinamarca, where he has his workshop. Thanks to his experience gained from previous employment in other metalworking and painting workshops, he was able to perfect his art and offer quality service. His main clients are from the area and they bring their vehicles to his workshop during business hours, which are 8 am - 5 pm, every day of the week.

Alirio is very committed to his business. He believes it brings benefits to his family and this is why he is applying for his first Kiva loan which is being processed through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. This will be used to acquire fixed assets which will allow him to improve the capacity and efficiency of his workshop, including a compressor and tools.

Alirio's goal in the future is to have a more automatised workshop which will allow him to improve his services and with this his income in order to offer his children an excellent education.

loans.use: to buy a compressor and tools.

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en:
Jemima is a single woman. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but does not have piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes selling business. She sells clothes door-to-door to neighbors and others passing by. She faces a major challenge - the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a boutique in the future.

With the 15,000 KES loan that she is requesting, Jemima wants to purchase bales of clothes to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 46-year-old lady and a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own tires business for the past ten years.

Farzana's husband needs to purchase different types of companies' tires for his business. But, due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase these tires.

To fulfill the need of her husband, Farzana has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will help her husband to buy these tires for business purposes. That will be good for him to earn more income, and this income will support him to fulfill his family's needs.

Farzana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's tires business.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim is a 49-year-old, married father of three children.  25 years ago, he started working in the construction field (specializing in flooring) to cover the needs and expenses of his family.  He is a hard worker and sacrificing father who is trying desperately to provide his children with a decent life.  Today, he is taking a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay his children's school tuition fees.  Salim believes that education will provide the best future for his children, and he hopes to continue to be able to satisfy their needs.

loans.use: to pay his children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a hardworking female entrepreneur with four children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory, like rice, soft drinks, sugar, etc., to sell in her store.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, such as farming sugarcane.

Elena dreams that, one day, she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory, like rice, soft drinks, sugar, etc., to sell in her store.

loans.name: Era

texts.en:
Era is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She supplements this income with earnings from her food vending and motorcycle transport businesses. She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries for farm preparation and to buy rice seeds.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Era dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries for farm preparation and to buy rice seeds.

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Dulce is a 34-year-old married mother of four children who works hard to support her family. She is a policewoman. Her husband is in agriculture. Although the family works very hard, their earnings are not enough for them to support the cost of her sister's education.

This loan of $1,000 will allow Dulce to help her sister to study in university. She will use the loan to pay for tuition, textbooks, and school supplies. Dulce loves her family very much and hopes that further education will help them to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition, textbooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 60 years old and married with eight children.

Jovita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Jovita has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from food vending.

Jovita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a 32-year-old, married mother of three children who works hard to support her family. She is a cleaner, and her husband works in agriculture. Even though the family works very hard, she does not always have enough to support the cost of her sister's education.

This loan of $600 will allow Paulina to help her sister study at a university. She will use the loan to pay for tuition, textbooks, and school supplies. Paulina loves her family very much and hopes that further education will help them have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition, textbooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Jose Adan

texts.es:
José, de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica al comercio de frutas, vive con un hijo que está estudiando. 

José, se dedica al comercio de ganado desde hace 10 años, aparte de este negocio también vende madera y trabaja en su casa.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar ganado para engordarlo y luego venderlo a buen precio. 

A futuro sueña con tener su propia ganadería y que se involucre su hijo y darle una buena educación.
texts.en:
José is 46 years old and studied up to the fifth grade. He has a partner who works selling fruits. They live with one son who goes to school.

José has worked in the cattle business for 10 years. In addition to this business, he sells wood and works in his home.

He needs this loan to buy cattle, fatten it, and afterwards sell it at a good price.

In the future, he dreams of having his own livestock farm, involve his son, and give him a good education.

loans.use: to buy cattle, fatten it, and afterwards sell it at a good price.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a responsible mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 20 years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because its current condition is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. Therefore, Shabana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Shabana's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily, and he will be able to provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Shabana also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Shabana is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enable her husband to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Sherela

texts.en:
Sherela, 39, is from the province of General Trias, Cavite, Philippines. She is happily married to Harry, a businessman. She has three children, two of which attend school while the youngest is not yet of school age. The couple faces challenges in a developing economy but they strive to do their best for their children. Sherela loves pets, so she opened a pet store to meet the needs of her growing family. The earnings from her shop help Sherela meet household needs and the school needs of her two children.

In order to add more pets to sell at her shop, she would like to borrow 30,000 PHP to buy baby goldfish and other fish varieties, small birds, accessories for her aquarium, and feed for her small animals. Sherela aims to have a small van to use to deliver her goldfish. She is hoping for your positive response and your help to improve her livelihood.

As a loving mother, Sherela wants her children get a college education to allow them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for goldfish and other varieties of fish, feed, and aquarium accessories for her business.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is a responsible mother of four children who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. For 12 years, her husband has been providing transportation services by driving a taxi. He is responsible for providing for the needs of the entire family.

Her husband's taxi is in bad condition and has bad tires, which results in more maintenance charges on a daily basis. He needs to make maintenance repairs on the taxi, and he needs to replace its tires. However, due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to do this.

Thus, Shagufta has applied for a loan through Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Shagufta's husband will be able to afford the maintenance and tire replacement. As a result, he will be able to provide better transportation and to earn profitable income. Shagufta also plans to use the profit from her husband's income to create savings to meet her family's needs in the future.

Shagufta is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi and replace its tires.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina is a 39-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Augustina has business buying and selling fishing nets in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 1 year. Augustina has requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

In the future, Augustina would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines and supplements this income with earnings from her general store.

Jasmin is borrowing PHP 10,500 through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries during harvest. She dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pays for laborers' salaries during harvest.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a 29-year-old married woman with two children, who are both presently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish, sacks of salt, fish net, bamboo and other materials for her business.

Joan has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish, sacks of salt, fish net, bamboo and other materials for her business

loans.name: Lidia Marina

texts.es:
Lidia, de 48 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora, estudió hasta primer grado, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, sus hijos son adultos y aportan económicamente para los gastos del hogar.

Lidia, trabaja en un colegio a 45 minutos en bus de su comunidad, ahí labora desde hace 11 años como cocinera, trabajo que desempeña muy bien, años atrás trabajaba en una granja de pollos que existía en su comunidad.- Actualmente aparte del empleo que posee, cría cerdos y aves de corral en el patio de su casa.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar cerdos y alimentos para engordarlos y luego obtener ganancias económicas de la venta de su carne.

Lidia, sueña con seguir con su empleo para pensionarse e irse a pasar los últimos días de su vida, disfrutando de la compañía de sus nietos.
texts.en:
Lidia is 48 years old and she is a very hard-working woman. She studied up to first grade of elementary school and lives with her partner, who works in agriculture. Their two sons are adults and contribute money to the household expenses.

Lidia works in a school 45 minutes away by bus from her community. She has been working there as cook for 11 years and is very good at it. Some years ago she used to work in a chicken farm that existed in her community. Nowadays, apart from her job, she also rears pigs and poultry at the courtyard of her house.

She is requesting a loan to buy pigs and food to fatten them and then make profits from the sale of their meat.

Lidia's dream is to keep doing her job in order to retire and spend the last days of her life enjoying her grandchildren's company.

loans.use: to buy pigs and food to fatten them.

loans.name: Luy Group

texts.en:
Luy is a 39-year-old married rice farmer who resides in Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. To earn a living, he has grown rice for the past 18 years. His wife is 44 years old and a rice farmer as well. Together, the family can earn approximately $3 USD per day.

Luy is pictured 1st from the right and he is the group's leader. He would like to request a loan as part of a group of five members. He will use his portion to buy fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides for farming. This loan will help him to increase his income as well as improve his family's standard of living. In the future, he hopes to farm in both the dry and rainy seasons and harvest more than two times per year so he can save enough money to build a proper new house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides for farming.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a single woman. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Moeun's Group

texts.en:
Moeun, a 40-year-old resident of Kampong Cham province, is married and has three dependent children, one of whom attends school while the other two are not yet of school age. She earns about $17 USD per day growing rice on one hectare area of farmland and working for others for a fee. She can save about $12 USD per day for future needs. The main challenge to her farming business is when her rice crop is destroyed by pests.

Moeun is leading a group of three members to apply for a loan from VisionFund. This will be her second cycle loan. With her previous loan, she paid for her children's studies. Moeun will use the new loan to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop productivity. She hopes that she can yield more crops in order to keep her children in school and expand her agribusiness someday.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop productivity so that she can expand her agribusiness and keep her children in school.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Riskiniso

texts.ru: Рискинисо опытная рукодельница. Она 9 лет  занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она еще шьет детскую одежду на заказ. Рискинисо занимается у себя дома, ей удобна, заниматься дома, потому что она ухаживает за детьми. Рискинисо замужем и имеет детей. Ей 25 лет. Она молодая жена и мать. Рискинисо зарабатывает и помогает мужу обеспечить семью. Она хочет ускорить процесс работы и увеличить ежедневный доход. Рискинисо решила поменять швейную машинку, потому что нынешняя машинка устарела и хорошо не выполняет свои функции.
texts.en:
Riskiniso is an experienced needleworker. She has been sewing women's clothing for 9 years. She also sews children's clothing to order. Riskiniso works at her own home. It's convenient for her to work at home because she watches the children.

Riskiniso is married and has children. She is 25 years old, and she is a young wife and mother. Riskiniso is earning money and helping her husband to provide for their family.

Riskiniso wants to speed up her work process and increase her daily income. She has decided to change sewing machines, because her current sewing machine is quite old and doesn't carry out its work very well.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 3 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su madre, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young woman has had her face pixelated because she is 23 years old and lives in a high risk area. She has worked for three years in the production and sale of tortillas. Her business is located in her home and she has many clients. With the earnings from her business she is able to settle some of her household costs. This young woman lives in a private home with her mother.

She is requesting a loan to buy quintals of corn and lime to continue preparing tortillas. This way she can have a better income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy quintals of corn and lime.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Nazeeran is a responsible mother of 3 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. For many years, her husband has provided transport services by driving a taxi. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Her husband needs to replace his taxi's tires because the current condition of his tires is not good, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to do so. Therefore, Nazeeran has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Nazeeran's husband can easily afford to replace his tires. This will allow him to provide better transport services and to increase his income. With her husband's increased profits, Nazeeran plans to start a savings to meet her family's needs in future.

Nazeeran is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband replace the tires for his taxi.

loans.name: Khayrinisso

texts.ru: Эту веселую и ответственную женщину зовут Хайриниссо. Хайриниссо 33 года. Она замужем и мать четверых прекрасных детей. У нее 3 сыновей, и 1 дочка. Муж занимается торговлей деятельности на рынке. Хайриниссо занимается портнихой у себя дома. Она опытная и талантливая швея. Хайриниссо берет заказы на шитье национальной женской одежды. Она очень любить свою работу и хочет заняться еще много лет. Ей в работе нравится результаты, которых, она в процессе добивается. Хайриниссо нравится смотреть на восторженные лица своих клиентов, после того как они надевают заказанные платья. На сегодняшний день швейная машинка Хайриниссо не пригодна для использования. И она хочет на деньги от кредита купить новую машинку, чтобы поскорее приступить к работе.
texts.en:
This joyful and responsible woman is called Khayrinisso. Khayrinisso is 33 years old. She is married and the mother of 4 wonderful children. She has 3 sons and 1 daughter. Her husband works in trade at the market.

Khayrinisso works as a dressmaker from her home. She is an experienced and talented seamstress. Khayrinisso takes orders to sew traditional women's clothing. She loves her work very much, and hopes to do it for many more years. Khayrinisso likes the results that she gets from doing her work. She likes to see the overjoyed faces of her clients after they have put on the dresses they ordered.

Right now, Khayrinisso's sewing machine is not suitable for use. She wants to use a loan to purchase a new sewing machine, so that she can get back to work as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 42-year-old Palestinian refugee and married mother of two children. She lives and works in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low financial and social situation of Palestinian refugees in Lebanon, especially for those who live in a camp, she opened her own clothing shop inside the camp to help to cover her family's expenses.

Hanan is a hard worker and has a good reputation in her region. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise and offer new fashionable clothing for the upcoming winter season. Hanan hopes this loan will help her increase her monthly income and save for a better future for her beloved children.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise and offer new fashionable clothing for the upcoming winter season.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is a street sweeper living in Tuguegarao. She is married and has four children. Aside from her job as a street sweeper, she also buy dozens of sampaguita flowers and re-sells them for a profit. She has been in this business for over five years. Nida is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more sampaguita and vegetables to sell. She hopes to keep improving her work as street sweeper and as a small vendor.

loans.use: to buy more sampaguita to sell

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a vegetables-vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more vegetables to sell through her vegetables-vending business.

Amalia has been in this business for 16 years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food and coffee vending business in the Philippines.

Rosalinda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items like sugar, coffee, milk, sticky rice, coconut, etc. for her business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 13 years now.

Rosalinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items like sugar, coffee, milk, sticky rice, coconut, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with two kids, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that neither has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Jane operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of competition in her business. 


With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en:
Aged 56, Yen is a resident in Kampong Cham province and has four children, two of whom are dependent on her. To make a living, she grows rice. She also works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has been involved in farming for 38 years. This family’s daily income is about USD 10 per day; Yen can manage to save about USD 7 per day. Her rice crop is threatened by pests and is not growing well. These are the challenges to her rice-growing business.

Leading a group of four members to get a loan, Yen has been with VisionFund for a cycle loan already. Her past loan has had a huge impact to her family, as she has been able to improve their standard of living. She will use her loan to purchase organic fertilizer to improve the crop yields. She hopes that she can earn more income to support her daily living expenses and expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to improve the crop yields

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sulhati

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Sulhati, who is 25-year-old, married with one son and one daughter. Sulhati and her husband are employee in a shoe factory for three years.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation and clear water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build a toilet and water sources but Sulhati will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation and clear water for their family.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 47-year-old married father of four and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low financial and social situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, he started two years ago selling fruits and vegetables on his pickup truck to better cover the needs and expenses of his children. 
Rami is a hard worker who is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase and diversify his merchandise with new seasonal fruits and vegetables to satisfy his customers needs. 
Rami hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase and diversify his merchandise with new seasonal fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 35 years old and married, with three children, two of whom are currently in school. Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like canned goods, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, shampoo, and snack foods.

Jocelyn has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, shampoo, and snack foods.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Norma works hard to support her family.

She has a gasoline retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Norma is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase additional containers of gasoline to sell to her customers for her gasoline retailing business.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of gasoline to sell to her customers

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther lives in Hoima, Uganda, and used the previous loan to buy more rice to sell. She is forty-six years old and a single mother with the burden of taking care of four children, two of whom attend school. She deals in produce, predominantly buying and selling rice, beans, and ground nuts, a business she ventured into after the death of her husband. She hopes to expand her business through hard work despite the problem of high transport charges to the final destination where she sells her products. Esther seeks a loan to buy more rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma, supports the family through her pig fattening business in the Philippines.

The accompanying photo shows Lerma with her daughter Christine who is 17 years old, only one child in the family.

Lerma is borrowing 11,000 PHP to pay the tuition fees of Christine who is studying Bachelor of Science in Hotel and Restaurant Management. Christine is currently on her second year of this four year course. 

When she graduates, Christine plans to be a chef and help her mother to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees for a BSc. in Hotel and Restaurant Management, where she is in her second year.

loans.name: Thath's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Kampong Cham province, Thath is 45 years old and married. She has a daughter who relies on her. She and her husband are growing rice on a hectare area of farmland for main source of income. Sometimes, they work as paid workers to get more income. Having been involved in rice growing business for 27 years, Thath earns about USD10 per day. Challenge to rice growing business is to get lower output from rice crop which is destroyed by insect pests.

She has been with VisionFund for four cycle loans and they have enabled her to improve living condition. In a group of four members, Thath is the leader and she will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticide to boost crop yields. She hopefully wants to get more yields so as to uplift the lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticide to boost crop yields to uplift lifestyle.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Famous Three Group

texts.en:
Nyarai is a member of Famous 3 group, a group that was made famous during training due to their respect for time-keeping and all the ground rules. Nyarai is an energetic lady who is always busy, who never allows the morning sun to set on the roof while she is still in bed. She is 34 years, and is in the cross-border trading business.

Nyarai started her business 5 years ago. She buys items like bedcovers and seat covers and sells them in Mozambique. Nyarai confessed to have mastered the vocation in different Southern African Development Community (SADC) countries and she found a better market in Mozambique. She sometimes go for week or two weeks depending on her stock movement, she sounds more dedicated, a clear sign that ladies are risk takers when it comes to stand for their families.

Nyarai in 2014 she was not crossing, she was on maternity leave and her business activity was very low to the extent that she had no capital to resume operations. Nyarai like all the ladies who call business by its rightful name, wants a loan from Thrive to resume the once strong business that she had, she hopes to go as far as Angola, as she saw some opportunities for growth in that far country.

loans.use: to recommence her cross-border trading business.

loans.name: Be You, Be Bright - N23P5Đsơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Liên is 49 years old and she is married. She has been operating a food stall selling fruit for 8 years. Liên lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
The main hardship that Liên faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh fruit to resell.

In 2010, Liên joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She used the loan buy more kind of fruits and expand her business. Since then, her income has been increased significantly. Liên has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

She is the leader of "Be you, be bright - N23P5ĐSơn", which consists of four members.
In the future, Liên hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, to travel for vacation within the country, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fruit to resell.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: 32 летняя мастерица швеи это Фируза. Она просто обожает шить и кроить. 4 года Фируза идет по стопам матерью. Ее мама раньше тоже занималась этой сфере деятельности. Она замужем и имеет детей. Ее старший сын женат. Ее муж дехканин. Он занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Фирузе в работе помогает дети. Фируза хочет ускорить процесс работы и путем увеличить доход. Для ускорения процесс работы, ей необходимо приобрести новую многофункциональную машинку. Но для купли средств у нее нет денежных средств, и она решила обратиться за кредитом. Фируза надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
This is Firuza, a 32-year-old master seamstress. She simply adores sewing and cutting out patterns. For 4 years, Firuza has been following in her mother's footsteps. Firuza's mother has also previously worked in this sphere of business.

Firuza is married and has children. Her oldest son is married. Firuza's husband is a "dehkan" farmer. He does agricultural work. Firuza's children help her with her work.

Firuza wants to speed up her work process and thereby increase her income. In order to speed up her work process, she absolutely must buy a new, multi-function sewing machine. However, she does not have the funds for the purchase, and she has decided to apply for a loan. Firuza relies on your support.

loans.use: to buy a multi-function sewing machine.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 31 years old, married with three children.

Lina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Lina has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Lina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 39 years old and married with four children.

Rosalia earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosalia has been in pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Christina

texts.en:
Maria Christina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maria Christina is 32 years old and has two children are still in school.

Maria Christina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Maria Christina requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, additional utensil and other materials for her food production business.

Maria Christina has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, additional utensil and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Kudura

texts.en:
Kudura is the married mother of five children, three of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en:
Rafia is 33 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is responsible mother of 2 children and has been running a crockery shop for past 2 years.

She wants to purchase different a types of crockery e.g jugs, glasses, dinner sets to fulfill the demands of his customers, but due to financial constraints she is not in the position to buy this merchandises. To fulfill his business needs she has applied for Kiva Loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to buy all these things to fulfill his business needs. This will also helpful for her to increase her daily sales and earn a more profitable income to manage the business and family's needs
Rafia is very happy and thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: she wanted to increase her crockery selling business.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en: Jacinto is 29 years old, married and the father of one child. He works hard to support his family. He is one of the staff in a hospital. Although the family works very hard, it can be cumbersome for him to afford the cost of his sister's education. This loan of $1000 will allow Jacinto to help his sister study and will be utilizized in the university. He will use the loan to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies. Jacinto hopes that in the future they will be happy in the family.

loans.use: to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Set Group

texts.en:
Set is a 37-year-old married rice farmer with four children in her care who resides in Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. One of her children is a factory worker and another three children attend school. Set is pictured first from the right and has cultivated rice since 1998. Her husband is a 39-year-old construction worker. Together, they can make approximately USD 5 per day.

Set, the group leader, would like to request a loan for the group with four members. She is now requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for rice farming. With this loan, she will be able to gain better rice crops to sell, thereby improving the family’s finances. In the future, she is going to save money to buy pigs and cows, renovate her house and support her children to earn high diplomas.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for rice farming

loans.name: Animal Farm - N02T2Qlĩnh Group

texts.en:
Mrs Lai is 52 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture raising livestock for more than 10 years. Lai lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. And the income from this business is unstable because when some disease on livestock happens, they could die which left her nothing to sell. And she will be in financial trouble.

The main hardship that Lai faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This is Lai first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could improve her living standard.

She is the group leader of "Animal Farm - N02T2QLĩnh", which consists of four members.
In the future, Lai hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Karoti Group

texts.en:
Fransiscar who is in her early 30's is married with three kids, one of them is still small and others are in school. She has been running two projects a grow and sell chickens and a beauty salon for four years now. She works from 08am to 09pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Fransiscar's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her business and has manged to pay back all her loans successfully. She is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees, repay a loan, reinvest in business, and covered house hold expenses. She will use this loan to buy chicks, chicken feed and to buy up to date salon products to meet her customer's requirement. She dreams of expanding her business and building her own house.

Fransiscar will share this loan with her loan group Karoti which has three members who will hold each accountable for paying back the loan

loans.use: to increase her businesses of chicken production and a beauty salon

loans.name: Ma. Nenita

texts.en:
Ma. Nenita is 37 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Ma. Nenita works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Nenita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Ma. Nenita has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, canned goods, coffee, detergent soap, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Ma. Nenita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rocilyn

texts.en:
Rocilyn is 50 years old and married with six children, two of whom in school.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Rocilyn is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rocilyn has been farming sugarcane for 7 years and also earns additional income from buy and sell rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jovelyn is 44 years old and has five children are currently in school.

Jovelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jovelyn requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices additional utensil and other materials for her food production business.

Jovelyn has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices additional utensil and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilou is 45 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Marilou has a general store business in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Marilou has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 46 years old and has four children. She is widowed and has one child still in school.

Mila is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mila has been in this business for three years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mila would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Metal Women - N08Tsơn1Psơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hằng is 55 years old and married. She has had a service business repairing and producing mechanical equipment for more than 10 years. Hằng lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her business created jobs for many workers in the region, but this is a really hard job. It requires clever and skillful workers. The main hardship that Hằng faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase machines and tools for expanding her business.

In 2012, Hằng joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hằng has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of "Metal Women - N08TSơn1PSơn", which consists of three members.

In the future, Hằng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase machines and tools for expanding her business.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 47 years old, married, and has five children.

She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Jenny has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional sacks of feed.

Jenny has been in the business for ten years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jenny would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed.

loans.name: Natilyn

texts.en:
Natilyn is widowed, with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  She is 57 years old and has one child still in school.

Natilyn has a business making and selling dried fish in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish, salt, bamboo, fish net, and other materials for her business.

Natilyn has been in this business for 25 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish, salt, bamboo, fish net, and other materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma  is a married woman with four children, all of whom attends school. She owns a house that  neither has electricity nor  piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Nato

texts.en:
Nato is 38 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and child in Senaki district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have 4 cows and a pig. In addition they own 0.5 hectare agricultural land.

Nato decided to start a trading business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 5000 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase a stock of nuts in order to begin trading business. She will resell nuts at a higher price and will generate income. Nato hopes that the business will be profitable and awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading in nuts in order to increase her family income.

loans.name: Mawunyo

texts.fr: Agée de 53 ans, Mawunyo est une femme mariée qui habite à Adidogomé. Avec trois enfants à charge, Mawunyo est une revendeuse des objets en plastiques. Mawunyo s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Mawunyo sollicite ce prêt pour commander des douzaines de bassines  et sceaux en plastiques en vue de mieux revendre et satisfaire parfaitement les attentes de ses clients puis réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin d’aider son mari à subvenir aux charges et besoins quotidiens de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mawunyo is a 53-year-old married woman who lives in Adidogomé. With three children in her care, Mawunya is a retailer of plastic goods. She gets her supplies twice per month at the market and reselles them from her home and in the surrounding neighborhoods.

Mawunyo is seeking this loan in order to purchase dozens of plastic bowls and pitchers with the goal of selling more and perfectly satisfying the expectations of her customers. [She also aims to] have a good profit margin in order to help her husband meet the day-to-day needs and expenses of her children.

loans.use: purchase one dozen plastic bowls and one dozen plastic pitchers.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
The region of Mindanao in the Philippines has fertile lands and favorable weather which is conducive for farming. Fruits and vegetables grow well because typhoons seldom visit the area. 

Mary Ann, 35, is selling fruits in one of the public markets Butuan City, Agusan Del Norte. As of now she offers various fruits such as mangoes, apples, soursops, watermelons, bananas, and others. The profits derived from her business helps provide for the basic needs of her family. However, the risk that she faces is the possibility of fruit rotting if these are not sold on time. Somehow, Mary Ann has learned the trade tips from her six years of experience in fruit vending. 

Now she desires to buy additional volume of fruits to display in her stall in order to attract more buyers. She implores your kind support to make this possible. A loan worth PhP 30,000 will surely go a long way.

Mary Ann is married to Rey, a driver. They work together towards their goal to uplift their lives, complete their children’s education, and construct a house.
 
She is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional volume of fruits to display in her stall

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Elvie works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tricycle transportation. Elvie is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to buy more fish, sacks of salt, bamboo, fish net and other materials for her business.

Elvie has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish, sacks of salt, bamboo, fish net and other materials for her business

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Imelda has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish, sacks of salt, fish net, bamboo and other materials for her business.

Imelda has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish, sacks of salt, fish net, bamboo and other materials for her business

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 30 years old and married with two children, one child still in school, Mary Grace works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Grace runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, shampoo, snack foods and etc.

Mary Grace has been in this business for 1 year. 

In the future Mary Grace would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, shampoo, snack foods and etc

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito works hard to support her family. Charito is married and has a buy and sell herbal medicine business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of herbal medicine.

Charito has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Charito would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of herbal medicine

loans.name: Anavel

texts.en:
Anavel is 41 years old and has two children. Anavel is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Anavel is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Anavel has been farming vegetables for 12 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Anavel would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 28 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Jenelyn has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish, sacks of salt, fish net, bamboo and other materials for her business.

Jenelyn has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish, sacks of salt, fish net, bamboo and other materials for her business

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en: Geofrey is a cattle trader who is aged 36 married with 6 children living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. He also supplements this business with riding motorcycle for transport in his area for additional income. He dreams of exploring all the available markets for cattle and having an agent in the city that offers more attractive prices. He is a hardworking client whose efforts are hindered by the long distances and high prices for cattle and transportation costs in long distances.  These will be solved by acquiring a motor vehicle in the near future is his dream. Geoffrey is requesting the loan to buy cattle to fatten and sell.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Narisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Narisa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell drinks business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Narisa is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more drinks to sell in her store.

Narisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell in her store

loans.name: Renerose

texts.en:
Renerose is married, with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  She is 44 years old and has one child still in school.

Renerose has a business making and selling dried fish in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish, salt, bamboo, fish net, and other materials for her business.

Renerose has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish, salt, bamboo, fish net, and other materials for her business

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina lives in Liquisa and her business is selling office supplies. She lives near as many people, so she has one idea to prepare office supplies for everybody so they want need to buy should not be far away. She had opened her business a few year ago, but she earning a good income every day because many people come to buy in her place so she is very happy with her business.

And now she is applying for a loan of $ 1000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business because she wants to open a bigger business in the future. She started to open rental in 2014 with her own working capital of $ 1000.00. She is taking this loan because she wants used to buy notebooks, envelopes, tipex, glue paper, pens, wrapping paper, manila paper, brown envelopes and other things to sell.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, envelopes, Tipex, glue paper, pens, wrapping paper, manila paper, brown envelopes and other things to sell.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Mère de deux enfants, Akouvi est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomé. Agée de 61 ans, Akouvi est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui travaille activement pour gagner sa vie en vue de subvenir à ses besoins. Akouvi s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché et demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois; ce qui lui permettra de vite libéré le stock et d’avoir plus de recettes et pouvoir faire face aux charges de la famille et préparer la scolarité de ses enfants dès cette rentrée scolaire.
texts.en:
Akouvi is the mother of two children and a married woman who lives in Adidogomé. She is 61 years old and is a retailer of charcoal who works hard to earn a living in order to meet her needs.

Akouvi gets her supplies five times per month at the market and is requesting this loan in order to purchase sacks of charcoal, which will allow her to quickly discharge her stock and have more money to be able to cope with the family expenses and be ready [to pay] her children's school fees when school is back in session.

loans.use: purchase 21 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Rubi

texts.en:
Rubi is 30 years old woman, she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her 4 children. Rubi is providing sewing services and earn the income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.

She is needs different kinds of goods e.g needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil etc for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.
Rubi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Kenga

texts.en:
Kenga is 37-year-old food stall owner in Kongowea, Kenya. He is a father of two whose spouse provides additional income. For the last five years, Kenga has been in this business and is doing well.

This is his first borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the money to purchase milk, sugar, and loaves of bread for his stall. The anticipated profit will be used to repay his loan. He hopes to own a successful business in future.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, and loaves of bread.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan has owned and managed his vegetable garden for almost six years. This business is his main source of living. He is planning to engage in some other activities for the expansion of his business. He has decided to borrow funds to be used to buy fertilizer such as manure so that he is able to produce good quality vegetables to his customers.

Allan’s plan for the future is to save more money for the educational plan of his children when they go to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his vegetable garden.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is married, with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  She is 48 years old and has two children are currently in school.

Roselyn has a auto repair shop in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount NWTF to buy additional spare parts for her business.

Roselyn has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts for her business

loans.name: Rubelinda

texts.en:
As the married mother of six children, Rubelinda works hard to support her family.

She has a butcher shop in the Philippines, and she also earns income from fattening pigs.  Rubelinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more chicken meat, frozen foods, eggs, and spices to sell in her stall.

Rubelinda has sustained her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more chicken meat, frozen foods, eggs, and spices to sell in her stall

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. Evelyn is married and has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Virgita

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Virgita works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a buy and sell fruits and vegetables business. Virgita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her local market.

Virgita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her local market

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 57 years old and married with nine children. One of her children is still in school. Vivian works very hard to provide for her children.

Vivian runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, shampoo, snack foods, etc.

Vivian has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Vivian would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, shampoo, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Oun is 53 years old and married, with two dependent children.  She lives in Kampong Cham province.

She has been growing rice as her main source of income for 33 years. Sometimes,Oun works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She earns about USD 19 per day and can save about USD 13 each day. Insect pests are the main challenges to her rice growing business.

Oun decided to form a group of seven members to apply for loans from VisionFund.  It will her second cycle loan.  Her past loan, which was fully repaid, helped her lift up her lifestyle and renovate her house. 

As the group leader, Oun will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to improve her farmland. She hopes she can increase her yields so as to buy more farmland and improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer to improve her farmland so as to buy another plot of farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Mawussi

texts.fr: Mawussi est une femme mariée âgée de 33 ans qui vit à Adidogomé. Ayant trois enfants à charge, Mawussi est une marchande de riz non préparé et des sachets en plastique. Mawussi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et en circulant les quartiers environnant. Pour commander des sacs de riz et des paquets de sachets en plastique, Mawussi nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement en vue de bien revendre et de réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et mieux couvrir les frais scolaire de ses enfants dès cette rentrée scolaire.
texts.en:
Mawussi is a 33-year-old married woman who lives in Adidogomé. With three children in her care, Mawussi sells uncooked rice and small plastic bags. She gets her supplies twice per month at the market and sells them from her home and throughout the surrounding neighborhoods.

In order to purchase bags of rice and packages of small plastic bags, Mawussi needs this loan to pay for her supplies, with the goal of selling well and having a good profit margin with which to be able to meet her family's needs and better cover her children's school fees when school begins again.

loans.use: purchase three sacks of rice and 15 packages of small plastic bags.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 44 years old and married with nine children, five of whom are in school. Arlene works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell like milk, noodles, egg, soap, shampoo, etc.

Arlene has been in this business for 25 years.

In the future, Arlene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell like milk, noodles, egg, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Humorous Ladies - N02Nđụnghlong Group

texts.en:
Đào is 41 years old and she is married. She is an ethnic minority. She has been working in agriculture, growing pineapple for 10 years. She is the group leader of "Humorous ladies - N02NĐụngHLong", which consists of six members.

Đào lives in Ha Trung district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village and the market need is low in this region. The income from her business is unstable because the output of pineapple is affected by the weather conditions.

The main hardship that Đào faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more seeds and fertilizer for increasing her productivity.

This is Đào's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan will improve her living standard.

In the future, Đào hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds and fertilizer for increasing productivity.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 57 years old. She is married and a mother of 4 children. To earn a living, she owns and manages her vegetable farm, planting and harvesting crops in order to support the needs of her family. Her husband is a driver, rendering transportation services to their local community members. She wants to expand her business. Recently, she took a loan from GDMPC to buy fertilizer for her crops. She hopes to improve their general living condition.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Best Sellers - N23Vnamđvăn Group

texts.en:
