Nga is 29 years old and she is married with 2 children. Nga is the group leader of "Best sellers - N23VNamĐVăn", which consists of six members.

Nga has had a retail business selling rice cake for four years. She lives in Dong Son district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low income household in the village and the market need is low in this region. The income from this business is not high enough for Nga to save money.

The main hardship that Nga faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice cakes to resell.

This is Nga's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan will improve her living standard.

In the future, Nga hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more rice cakes to resell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Teresa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell animal feeds business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell charcoal. Teresa is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more sacks of animal feeds to sell in her stall.

Teresa has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of animal feeds to sell in her stall

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is widowed, 66 years old, with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jovita has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Jovita has requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell.

Jovita has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 52 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school. Dolores works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell.

Dolores has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Dolores would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie operates a grocery store that sells assorted goods. She works hard every day in order to provide income for her family and improve their living situation. 

Elvie is requesting a loan to purchase more groceries to sell in her store. This will allow her to increase her sales. 

Elvie's goal is to develop her business and increase her profits so she can repair her house and ensure a higher quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

location.town: P. BOUGINVILLA, SAPANG DALAGA, MISAMIS OCCIDENTAL

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en: Nelita is juggling managing her business and supervising the renovation of her home. Nelita hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing supported by her loan. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. This is a matter to which Nelita has given priority as a microfinance member of PMPC. She is thankful for all of PMPC's past support of her financing needs for her retail business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house renovation

loans.name: Luis Ernesto

texts.es:
Luis, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, está casado, su pareja se dedica a criar cerdos y gallinas, tiene una hija y está pequeña. 

Luis, se dedica a criar cerdos y gallinas y también trabaja de seguridad en una empresa eléctrica, viaja a pie y está a 30 minutos de su casa. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar cerdos y para mejorar el techo de su casa, para mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Su sueño es para comprar un carro para hacer viajes y negociar.
texts.en:
Luis, age 29, went to school through the eighth grade.  He is married, and his wife works raising pigs and chickens.  He has a daughter who is little.

Luis works raising pigs and chickens, and also works in security at an electric company.  He commutes on foot for about 30 minutes.

He needs this loan to buy pigs and to improve the roof of his house, in order to improve his quality of life.

His dream is to buy a car for going on trips and doing business.

loans.use: to buy pigs and to improve the roof of his house.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 31 years old, married and has three children, all in school.

Juvy is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Juvy has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Juvy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Sanna

texts.en:
Sanna(59) is a divorced mother of 5 children. Most of her children are grown up and self sufficient but she still has 2 young children she is taking care of and another 2 relatives dependent on her. Consequently, she has to work hard even at her old age to sustain her family. 
She is part of a self-help group that has secured greenhouses (with the help of the local council) and are planting crops for sale. She has been allocated a greenhouse and is requesting for a Kiva loan to buy organic seedlings as well as fertilizer.
Once grown, the vegetables will be sold to vendors and households hence create income for Sanna and improve her family's standards of living.

loans.use: to buy organic seedlings and fertiliser

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette  is married and has two adult children.

Jeanette owns and operates a farm, cultivating fruit trees to earn a living. For many years in farming, she has been provide the needs of the family and was able to send her children in school. 

She joined and gained access from GDMPC.  Recently, she took out a loan to purchase organic fertilizer and to pay for mangosten replanting costs. (Mangosten is a tropical fruit tree).  

Improving the farm is her plan because it is her main source of income and she wants to ensure a better living in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her fruit trees

loans.name: Harimalala Sylvie

texts.fr:
36 ans, Sylvie est mariée et son mari est un boucher. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Elle dirige un magasin général il y a maintenant deux ans. A part cette activité de commerce, elle exploite aussi d'autres  activités: élevage et agriculture. Le magasin général a encore besoin d'investissement, elle voudrait le développer et l'améliorer et le prêt va lui permettre de renforcer un peu le fonds de roulement.
Sylvie est une femme travailleuse ayant de la conviction de lutter contre la pauvreté, elle souhaite avancer et offrir à ses enfants une meilleure condition de vie.
texts.en:
Sylvie is 36 years old and married to a butcher. They have two children, both in school. Sylvie has been running a general store for two years. In addition to her store, she also raises livestock and grows farm produce. Sylvie's general store still needs investments; she would like to develop and improve her business.

This loan will allow her to bolster her working capital. Sylvie is a hard-working person determined to fight poverty. She would like to get ahead and provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, soap, salt, pasta, matches, candles etc

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married, with four children . She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest expense is monthly school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated  business selling coconuts, selling to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding to improve her living standards. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Virtud

texts.es:
Virtud, de 43 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañada, su pareja es negociante de ganado y también se dedica a la agricultura, tiene dos hijos, uno de ellos trabaja y el otro está estudiando. 

Virtud, se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, también brinda servicio con un molino, el negocio lo tiene en su casa y trabaja de 5:00 a.m. hasta las 6:00 p.m. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar dos novillos y para surtir más la tienda, con ello mejorara su vida ya que tendrá más ingresos. 

Su sueño es comprar un molino más, para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Virtud, 43 years old, studied up to 6th grade. She is in a relationship and her partner works in cattle trading and agriculture. She has two children. One of them works and the other one is studying. 

Virtud sells essential goods and provides a mill as a service. She runs the business out of her house and she works from 5:00am to 6:00pm.

She needs the loan to buy two young cows and to stock the store more. This way, she will improve her life as she will have more income.

Her dream is to buy another mill to provide a better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy two young cows and to stock her store.

loans.name: Bendicion De Dios Group

texts.es:
Jirleya tiene 39 años de edad, estado civil soltero, madre de 3 hijos, de los cuales solo 2 estudian por no contar con el dinero necesario para brindarles a todos una educación. Actualmente vive con  2 de ellos.
Segundo de 19 años, Estiven de 15 años y sus dos nietos Taira de 3 añitos de edad  y Emanuel de 1 añito 6 meces. Para Jirleya  es muy difícil tener para los gastos de la casa y el estudio de los niños, pero sin embargo madruga todos los días a su pequeño negocio donde vende coco, verde y pescado seco, esto permite pagar los gastos de la casa y dar educación a sus 2 hijos .con el dinero del préstamo comprara más productos para aumentar su negocio teniendo como resultada más ventas, y de esta manera podrá ahorrar para la universidad de sus hijos que tanto le preocupa
texts.en:
Jirleya is 39 years old.  She is single and is the mother of three children.  Only two of her children are in school because she doesn’t have the money necessary to give them all an education.  She currently lives with two of them.

Segundo is 19 years old and Estiven is 15 years old; her two grandchildren are Taira, just 3 years old, and Emanuel, who is 1 year and 6 months.  Having the household and children’s school expenses is really difficult for Jirleya, but she nonetheless gets up early every day to go to her business where she sells green coconuts and dried fish.  This allows her to pay for her household expenses and the education of two of her children.

With the money from this loan she will buy more products to expand her business.  As a result, she will have more sales, and in this way she will be able to save up for her children’s university education, something that worries her a lot.

loans.use: to buy products in order to increase sales

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 24-year-old single ambitious man, the sole breadwinner of five other members of his family. Seven years ago, Anwar started working with his father in asphalting roads, in addition to making necessary maintenance and opening new roads. He is developing his father's business properly, and working hard to establish his own business in the future.

Currently, Anwar is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy requested gravel, and diesel oil for a new project he is going to work on.

His acquired experience will help him develop smoothly in his domain.

loans.use: to buy requested gravel and diesel oil for a new project he is going to work on.

loans.name: Ray

texts.en:
Ray is a 41-year-old, married man with three children. Eight years ago, he started operating a chainsaw service. In addition to that, he also sold lumber to the neighbors and local settlers in his community. He resides in the town of Carmen, Bohol, together with his wife and children. His oldest child is 19 and the youngest is 12.

Ray has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI), to buy gasoline and a device to carry the machine. These will help enhance his earnings and continue to provide quality services to his clients.

With these, he could provide nutritious meals to the whole family and be able to send his children to school. He is grateful for accessing the funds and he is doing his best to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and a device to carry the machine.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Arlene works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Arlene is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bananas to sell in her banana business. Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.en:
'Nueva Esperanza' or 'New Hope' is the name of a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank group made up of 13 Maya K’iche women who range in age from 22 to 50. They live in San Cristóbal, Totonicapan in the Western Highlands of Guatemala.

Trust Bank member Nicolasa, who is single and 22 years old, was able to attend school only until the fourth grade. Nicolasa has been a weaver since she was little and learned a great deal from her parents. She learned to weave traditional wrap-around skirts or 'cortes', as well as the beautiful and colorful trims.

Nicolasa is requesting a loan to buy supplies, like thread, for her textile business. One of her exciting, long-term goals is to buy her very own loom!

Friendship Bridge understands that microcredit alone does not eliminate poverty. The 'Microcredit Plus Program', that includes both loans and education, makes a real impact in the lives of the women. Combined, the products and services of the organization create a dependable cash flow and empower the women.

Thank you, Kiva investors, for your kindness and generosity in funding these much-needed loans. Nicolasa and her friends in the Nueva Esperanza Trust Bank group are full of new hope as they face a brighter future as empowered women!

loans.use: to buy supplies, like thread, for her textile business.

loans.name: Jhoiss Elena

texts.es: Jhoiss de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta y elaboracion de antojitos como: papas fritas, yuca frita, empanadas, etc. desde hace 15 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de us ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de aceite, papas,plátanos y todos los ingredientes para su elaboración y así poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Jhoiss is 37 years old and lives in her own house with her life's companion and their two children. She has been preparing and selling snacks such as fried potatoes, fried yucca, buns stuffed with meat, etc., for some 15 years.

Her business is located in her place of residence and she has many customers. This is how she earns her income and manages to cover some of their household expenses.

Jhoiss is requesting a loan for the purchase of cooking oil, potatoes, plantains, and all the ingredients required for preparing her snacks. In this manner, she hopes to earn a better income.

loans.use: buy cooking oil, potatoes, plantains, and all the necessary ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. Gloria is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Gloria requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Gloria has been in this business for 10 years now.

Gloria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 56 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Thelma has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Thelma requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 53 years old, married and has three children.

She is in the agricultural business farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Lucia requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lucia has been farming sugarcane for 5 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lucia would like to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Sokunthea's Group

texts.en:
Sokunthea, aged 20, is single and lives in Sangke district of Battambang province, where she is working as a tailor and selling soybean juice to earn a living. Lack of working capital is the main challenge to her.

This is the first time for her to apply for a loan from VisionFund. As the leader of a four-member group, she will use her loan to buy soybeans and ingredients to support her soybean juice selling business.

She hopes that she can expand her business and upgrade her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy soybeans and ingredients to support her soybean juice selling business so as to upgrade her standard of living and expand her business.

loans.name: Mwashasha

texts.en:
Mwashasha is a married mother of four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a 44-year-old married mother of two children; she has been working in a hospital's call center for fifteen years.

Samira is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees.

Her limited monthly income, combined with her husband's, is invested in their family's daily living needs.

She is working hard to provide her children with a better education so that they can benefit from a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica’s desire to enrich her family’s life is tremendous. She combines all income generating ventures that she knows to help her husband earn a living. She runs this store filled with varied items for sale. There are frozen foods, snack items such as bread, cookies, coffee, different types of beverages, and many others. She pays one helper-vendor because she has two stalls - one is located inside a school canteen and the other one is stationed near a Baptist Church.

Veronica and her family are living in Butuan City, the capital city of Agusan Del Norte. It’s a prolific city for many businesses since many schools, offices, and entertainment places flourish in the area. This is why Veronica was encouraged to run this kind of enterprise. She still longs to improve her business by availing of additional capital worth PHP 50,000 which she can use to buy more supplies for her store and as seed money for her envisioned burger machine business. She’s pretty sure that this would be very saleable.

She is working towards her planned house renovation. She consistently meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her store and as seed money for a burger machine business

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She supplements this income with earnings from food vending and buying and selling rice. She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pigs.

Emily dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 47 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Agnes has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. Agnes requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

In the future, Agnes would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a married woman, 28 years old with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lourdes has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish to sell to her customers.

Lourdes has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Lorna dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 34 years old, married and has three children. Two of them are enrolled in school.

Maricel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Maricel has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is married. She deals in new clothing and charcoal as well. She is a very  hard working  woman, though challenged by competition. However she has thought on how to deal with that challenge. She wants to include second hand clothes, in her shop because are easily bought compared to new clothes.However she lacks capital to do so.But if given a chance  to be borrowed money, she can restock, her shop, and pay back the loan without an problem. She is now requesting for money to buy second hand clothes for selling and improving her income levels.

loans.use: to buy clothes for selling.

loans.name: Von

texts.en:
Von, 58, is a resident in Siem Reap province and is married with three children, one of whom is dependent on her. Growing rice and cassava is the main business to Von’s family and she has been doing this for 40 years. To make more income, she is raising three cows.  Both of her businesses earn her about USD10 per day and she can save approximately about USD3 each day. Von faces some challenges as following: rice andn cassava crop are sometimes threatened by flood, lack of water and weeds and cows get ill. 
This is the second cycle for her and past loan has helped her support family’s living and buy household supplies. Von is asking for a loan from VisionFund to buy organic fertilizer for her cassava. She hopes that she can generate more income to improve her living condition and timely meet family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for her cassava to improve crop yields so that she can timely meet family’s needs. 	.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with five kids, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Saumu operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of seasonality in her business.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to resell.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with four kids, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Amina operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of seasonality in her place of operation. 


With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman and has been blessed with four children all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a fish selling business for over three years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Greda Traders Group

texts.en:
This group is one of the group that started with the Teshie branch and they have very unionized and organized group. They are into the sale of refine woods, vegetables, millet, maize, soya beans, sugar, flour and cooking oil.
The lady standing far from left in the photo is Josephine. She is 42 years old and is living with her husband and children.

Josephine is selling  millet, maize, soya beans, sugar, flour and cooking oil. Josephine herself started this enterprise nine years ago on a small scale and has been working hard to grow her business. Her family earns a good monthly income but not enough to manage the family educational, domestic and business expenses. 
So Josephine is planning to expand her business. From the present loan she will purchase millet, maize, soya beans, sugar, flour and cooking oil which she will sell to her customers. Josephine dreams of giving a better education to her children and expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase millet, maize, soya beans, sugar, flour and cooking oil which she will sell to her customers.

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en:
Hameeda is 45 years old woman, she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her 4 children. Hameeda is also providing sewing services and earn the income to contribute with her husband to manage the house hold.


She is needs different kinds of goods e.g needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.
Hameeda is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Jenab

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP-UMKM’s clients, Jenab, who is a 47 year old married with three sons and two daughters. Jenab is a housewife and her husband sells fruit.

Jenab has asked for a loan of IDR 7,200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation services at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and a water supply but Jenab will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation services at her home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for her family.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a 24-year-old married lady. She has been working as a nurse for three years ever since directly after graduating. She is a hard working, caring nurse well known in field of work and in her region.

Hilda is expecting a baby and her limited monthly salary, combined with her husband's are assigned for certain daily living needs. Thus, a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua will be invested in getting ready to pay for her hospital expenses for her baby's delivery, home wall and ceiling maintenance for leak prevention and for her car's necessary maintenance needs.

Hilda is very excited to hold her baby in her arms soon.

loans.use: to pay for hospital expenses for her baby's delivery, home wall and ceiling maintenance against leaks and for her car's necessary maintenance needs.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.fr:
Pascal est un brave père de famille de 49 ans. Il est très simple mais travailleur. Il est mariée et sa femme  dirige un magasin général pour l'aider à entretenir la famille. Le couple a trois enfants dont l'ainé est déjà marié, le second étudie à l'université et le dernier est encore collégien.
A part l'élevage et l'agriculture que le couple exploite ensemble, Pascal exerce aussi une autre activité, il dirige une petite gargote. C'est une activité pratiquée par ses parents lors qu'il vivait avec eux, donc il maîtrise bien.
texts.en:
Pascal is a good family man, 49 years of age. He is a simple hard-working person. He is married, and his wife runs a general store in order to help provide for the family. They have three children: the eldest is already married, the middle one studies at the university, and the youngest is still in high school.

In addition to raising livestock and growing farm produce together with his wife, Pascal also operates a small food stall. His parents used to have this type of business when he lives with them, and such he knows this work well.

loans.use: to buy supplies (pots, covers), vegetables, flour, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past four years, she has operated a mat weaving business, selling the mats from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding and establishing a poultry business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase paints and sewing materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase paints and sewing materials

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 22-year-old single man from Khan Younis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support.

Ahmad has a stall for selling fruits and vegetables in the city. It is a good business and it provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict.

Ahmad took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of fruits and vegetables to sell at his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales and customers, and he hopes to eventually save enough income to get married.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of fruits and vegetables to sell at his stall.

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene is a hardworking married man who has four children who are 3-16 years old.

He earns a living by selling snack foods like fish crackers, ampaw (pop-rice), and chicharon (dish generally consisting of fried pork belly or fried pork rinds).

His income will mainly go for food and school expenses.

For the past 15 years, he has sold snack foods using his motorcycle, serving neighbors and town dwellers. He faces a major problem, which is the liquidity of capital to expand his business.

Rene decided to access loans and boost his business. With the 22,000 PHP, he could be able to acquire funds to buy more supplies of pop-rice, chicharon, and fish crackers. Slowly, his income will improve and enable him to settle his finances.

loans.use: to acquire funds to buy more supplies of pop-rice, chicharron, and fish crackers.

loans.name: E'tedal

texts.en:
E'tedal is a married women and a mother of seven children. She Lives in Beit Leqia, a village near Ramallah.

She started to help her husband eight years ago by selling dairy products in the village, and now she's willing to expand. So, she's requesting a loan from Kiva partner Alibdaa to buy more goats and produce more dairy products to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more goats for her farm.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 31-year-old married man from Khan Younis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support.

Imad has a stall for selling fruits and vegetables in the city. It is a good business and it provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict.

Imad took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of fruits and vegetables to sell at his stall.

He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales and customers, and he hopes to eventually save enough income to cover school fees for his child.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of fruits and vegetables to sell at his stall.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 23-year-old man from Khan Younis City, in the Gaza Strip, which is a difficult place to live due to the Israeli economic blockade, in place since 2007. He is single, and lives with his family in a small house. Ali works as an employee in the public sector, where he earns a small income.

He wants to improve himself and be an entrepreneur. His business idea is to sell cosmetics and accessories for ladies. Ali took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy cosmetic products and accessories to start his own business.

He hopes that by taking this loan, he will be able to improve his family's conditions. Ali appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and accessories to start his own business.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 54-year-old married woman from Hebron city. She lives with her family in a simple house.

Because the economic situation in Hebron is not good, a few years ago, Hanan started her own business. She manages a store for selling clothes. This is the only source of income for the family.

Hanan took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help her to buy a collection of men's and women's clothes for her store. This will increase her sales and also her income.

Hanan appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a collection of men's and women's clothes for her store.

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en:
Walaa is a 26-year-old, married woman from Nablus City. She lives with her family in a simple house.

Because the economic situation in Nablus is not good, Walaa started her own business a few months ago. She manages a store selling clothes. This is the only source of income for the family.

Walaa took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help her to buy collections of men's and women's clothes for her store. This will increase her sales and also her income.

Walaa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy collections of men's and women's clothes for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a collection of men's and women's shoes for his stall.

loans.name: Othman

texts.en:
Othman is a 26-year-old, single man from Dier Al-Balah city. He lives with his family in a simple house.

Because the economic situation in Gaza is not good, Othman started his own business, one year ago. He manages a stall, selling shoes. This is the only source of income for the family.

Othman took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy a collection of men's and women's shoes for his stall. This will increase his sales and also his income.

Othman appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a collection of men's and women's shoes for his stall.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old, single man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Because the economic situation in Gaza is not good, A few years ago, Mohammad started his own business. He manages a stall for selling cold and hot drinks

This is the only source of income for the family. Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy coffee and tea and some other drinks for his stall. This will increase his sales and also his income. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy coffee and tea and some other drinks for his stall.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is a 44-year-old married mother of three children, all still attending school. She is a housewife dedicated to her home and family. Her husband is a retired soldier and he owns a van for transportation.

Rima's husband is the main income provider but his income is barely sufficient. That’s why she is asking to borrow from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She will use the loan to pay her children’s educational fees. She said that this loan will help insure her children's continued education which makes her very happy.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.name: Jefa

texts.en:
Jefa is a 22 year quarry worker at Kilifi Kenya, he is a single man who has been in this business for the last two years doing very well.

This is his third borrowing to finance his business, he will use the money to pay for transport service of his products from quarry and the anticipated profit to repay his loan. He hopes to own his lorry for transporting stone and blocks from quarry in future.

loans.use: to pay for transport service

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is in her mid 40s is married with three children who are still in school.  She has been running a genge businmess since 2010.  She works from 06am to 09pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Zuhura's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase on the genge stock and has managed to pay back her loan successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in the genge store.  She dreams of taking her children to good schools.

Zuhura will make sure she paying back her loan according to loan schedule.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in the genge store.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married mother of six children, one in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanatumu operates a stall where she sells groceries and vegetables She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high transportation costs to get to her place of operation.

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married mother of one  child, who attend school. She owns a house that neither  has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Philibus Yayo

texts.en:
Philibus is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Philibus is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Philibus would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Philibus will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season, when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Philibus now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 23-year-old single woman. She lives with her parents and six siblings who are still attending school. Her father is the main income provider for the family.

Nada opened a beauty salon in her house in 2011 to help her father financially. She is a very talented person and she provides her clients with her skilled hair dressing and beauty services.

Nada is asking to borrow from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l, to buy hair dressing tools such as scissors and hair brushes for her business.

She is well-known in her region and neighboring towns and enjoys a good reputation. She states that she is very sure that this loan will help her to develop her business and earn extra income.

loans.use: to buy hair dressing tools such as scissors and hair brushes for her business.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is married with three school-going children. The family lives in their own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a business selling khangas ( women's wrap cloth). She sells from home and door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan Mwanasha is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas for resale.

loans.name: Yesu Tsui Krong Group

texts.en:
The members of this group are part of the Yesu Tsui Krong Group from Chorkor, Accra, Ghana. The group is composed of five members who earn their living by selling drinks, snacks, groceries, and clothing, and they provide services like tailoring, sewing, and hairdressing.

They need additional capital to maintain, enhance, or expand their businesses, and they decided to apply for a loan from ID Ghana. They are excited and full of hope to begin this new loan with solid goals and dreams.

Vera is a 51-year-old single woman who has one dependent child. In the picture, she is standing first from the right. She completed six years of formal education, but due to the poor economic condition of her family she had to leave her education behind.

Vera is engaged in the selling of drinks and snacks. She is applying for her third loan from ID Ghana to purchase drinks and pastries to sell to her customers.

On behalf of her colleagues, Vera expresses gratitude and appreciation for the support from Kiva investors throughout the world who lend such necessary funds to people in Ghana. The requested funds will be used for vital support.

loans.use: to purchase drinks and pastries to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 47 years old. She is married to Njoroge, who is a businessman, and they are blessed with three children, aged between 19 to 27 years. She has had a mixed farming business for 25 years, currently earning a monthly income of KES. 25,000.

She has borrowed KES. 30,000 from Vision fund Kenya as her second loan, after paying the previous loan successful.And she will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs. Therefore she hopes that the anticipated profit will help her buy food for the family, pay school fees for her, cater for medical care expand livestock and crop farming as current business and repay her loan too.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a well-established farming business enjoy a better live with her family."

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is in his early 30s is single with two children. One of them is in school and the other one is still small. He has been selling mobile telephone spares for seven years now. He works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the mobile spare parts and has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loans, reinvest in business and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to increase on the telephone spares. He dreams becoming in international business man.

Godfrey will be accountable for paying back his loan..

loans.use: to increase on the telephone spares.

loans.name: Rodes

texts.en:
Rodes is a 26-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and three children. Her husband is the main income provider in the family, working as an electrician.

In 2012, to supplement the family’s income and to help her husband, Rodes decided to start her own business and opened a grocery store. She is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase more merchandise.

She states that the loan will surely help her increase her business productivity by a fair percentage which will return higher profits to her.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for the grocery store.

loans.name: Ma. Lyn

texts.en:
Ma. Lyn is 46 years old and has eleven children. Ma. Lyn is married and has three children who are still in school.

Ma. Lyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Lyn requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ma. Lyn has been in this business for 10 years, and she has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Lyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Jenefaith

texts.en:
Jenefaith is 31 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Jenefaith is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Jenefaith has been raising livestock for 5 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 63 years old and widowed with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, candies, milk, can goods, soft drinks, etc. .

Elizabeth has been in this business for 9 years. 

In the future Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, candies, milk, can goods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither  has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with five kids, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Rehema operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 


With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Baker

texts.en:
Baker is a 27-year-old, single man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Because the economic situation in Gaza is not good, one year ago, Baker started his own business. He manages a stall for selling daily needs items.

This is the only source of income for the family. Baker took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy collection inventory for his stall. This will increase his sales and also his income. Baker appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy everyday items for selling on his stall. .

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 34 year old married Lebanese woman living with her husband, and two children attending school. Due to the bad financial conditions, she cooperates with her husband who is their main income provider to develop their lifestyle. She opened a clothing shop in 2012, where she offers a great variety of clothes for women and kids at good prices.

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase a new collection of clothes so that she can improve her business operations and follow up on the new fashion. In this way she will be able to increase her sales and therefore her revenues.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes

loans.name: Asrar

texts.en:
Asrar is a 38-year-old married woman living with her husband. She has three daughters attending school. Her husband is the main income provider. He works as a mechanic, and he is a hard worker in order to collect enough money to be able to pay their many expenses.

Today, Asrar is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l, to pay her daughters' registration fees at school. She said that she is very happy and willing to always benefit from Kiva’s loans to continue her children's education suitably.

loans.use: to pay her daughters' registration fees at school.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 50-year-old married woman. She lives in the rural area of Batuan, Bohol.  She has  three children. Her oldest child is  24 while her youngest is 13.
She sold clothing. In addition to that, she also  operates a lumber business. 
Her husband has an income that could help defray the family's daily expenses.

She decided to increase his current business but the main issue is insufficient amounts of products. Therefore Elizabeth  is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner CEVI,  because she has to buy variety of clothing  and supply for lumber.   In this way she would be able to cope with demands. She can use the profit amount as savings to fulfill the future needs as well. 
 
Elizabeth is thankful for your support.

loans.use: to buy variety of clothing  and supply for lumber

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma has been running her general store for many years. She is earning well from this activity. She was able to support the educational needs of her children and able to provide their daily household expenses. She want to expand her business. Recently, she took a new loan to buy more grocery goods for the additional inventory of her stock and in order to increase her sales. She wants to improve the quality of life they have now.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a 28-year-old livestock trader in Kilifi, Kenya. She is a mother of three whose spouse provides additional income and has been doing well in this business for the last ten years.

This is her third loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business after repaying the previous ones successfully. She will use the loan to purchase livestock, and she will use the anticipated profit to educate her children. In the future, she hopes to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Chege

texts.en:
Chege is 55 years old. He is married and they are blessed with five children, aged between 10 years- 25 years old.

He has had a farming business for seven years, currently earning a monthly income of KES. 30,000. He has borrowed KES. 20,000 from Visionfund Kenya as his sixth loan, after paying the previous loan successful.

He will be using the loan to purchase animal feeds and farm inputs. Therefore he hopes that the anticipated profit will help him to buy food for his family, pay school fees for his kids, cater for medical care, expanding his current business and repay his loan too. His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a successful dairy business and enjoy a better life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase animal feeds and farm inputs

loans.name: Maria Gracia

texts.en:
Maria Gracia is 41 years old, married with four children.

Maria Gracia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, shampoo, snack foods, etc.

Maria Gracia has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from buy and sell dried fish.

Maria Gracia aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, shampoo, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Maternidad

texts.en:
Maternidad is a married woman, 61 years old with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Maternidad has a buy and sell peanut butter business in the Philippines. Maternidad requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more bottles of peanut butter to sell to her customers.

Maternidad has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bottles of peanut butter to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 53 years old and has ten children. Helen is widowed and has three children are still in school.

Helen is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Helen has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Ana Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel, de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja como seguridad, tiene tres hijos que están estudiando.

Maribel, se dedica vender productos de primera necesidad en su tienda desde hace 5 años, también se dedica a la venta de comida típica, la tienda la tiene en su casa y vende de 6:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m. 

El crédito lo necesita para surtir la tienda y para mejorar su vivienda y el piso, con ello mejorara su condición de vida, porque tendrá mayores ingresos. 

Su sueño es que su tienda crezca y poder vender más productos diferentes.
texts.en:
Maribel is 41 years old and has an 8th grade education.  She lives with her partner who works as a security guard.  They have three children who are in school.  

Maribel has made a living selling basic necessities in her store for 5 years.  She also sells local cuisine.  She runs the store from her home and it is open from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.

She needs the loan to stock her store and to improve her home and the floor.  She will use it to improve her living conditions, because she will have a better income.  

Her dream is for her store to grow so that she can sell a larger variety of products.

loans.use: to stock her store and improve her home and the floor.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanaidi operates a grocery and vegetables-selling stall. She sells at the market to town-dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Argelia Del Carmen

texts.es: Argelia es una mujer trabajadora de 42 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de platos de comida y refrescos, actividad que realiza en su vivienda desde hace varios años, por lo que ya cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos. Argelia habita en casa de su propiedad desde hace 10 años, junto a sus dos hijos de 20 y 18 años de edad a los que ha logrado sacar adelante con el apoyo de su esposo, por lo que se siente muy orgullosa de ellos. Argelia desea invertir en su negocio, ya que cada día cuenta con más clientes que solicitan sus productos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollo, carne, verduras, pescado, arroz, entre otros productos para su venta de comida y refrescos.
texts.en:
Argelia is a hard-working 42-year-old woman who makes a living selling food and refreshments.  She has run the business from her home for many years.  She has a lot of customers who ask for her products.  

Argelia has lived in her own home for 10 years with her children who are 20 and 18 years old.  She has been able to get them ahead with the support of her husband, and she is very proud of them.  

Argelia wants to invest in her business since has more and more customers every day, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy chicken, meat, vegetables, fish, and rice, among other ingredients, for her business selling food and refreshments.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, vegetables, fish, and rice, among other ingredients, for her business selling food and refreshments.

loans.name: Wissal

texts.en:
Wissal is a 39-year-old married woman living with her husband. She is the mother of three children and a housewife dedicated only to her family. Her husband works as a driver and is the main income provider in order to fulfill their family's needs.

However, because of the difficult living conditions, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children's education installment fees. This is the first time that she is requesting Kiva’s support to pay their school fees, and she is very happy because she will be able to register her children in the coming school year.

loans.use: to pay her children's education installment fees.

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past year, selling goat meat at the market. She faces the major challenges of seasonality and transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of goats to slaughter and obtain meat to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of goats to slaughter and obtain meat to resell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Mwanaulu

texts.en:
Mwanaulu is a married woman who has no children. She lives in her own house that has electricity but no piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a thirty two year old woman. She is single and has no child. Monica a sells sachet water and has done this business for eleven years. She has employed two people who take her water to bus terminals and schools to sell for a daily wage. 

With this loan, Monica will expand her business buy buying more bags of sachet water and boxes of bottled water to sell.She is hopeful that this will grow her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy bottled and sachet water to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is maize farmer from Umbo village. As a member of Babban Gona, Elizabeth is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support she has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. Before joining Babban Gona, Elizabeth would have had to sell her maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet her immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Elizabeth can store her maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Elizabeth is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use her increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Daw El Kamar Group

texts.en:
Douaa is the featured borrower of Daw El Kamar group. She allied with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been close friends and they work hard to develop their living.

Douaa is a 24-year-old married mother of one child. She works from her house in selling children, women and men clothes to support her family's increasing living needs. Her husband is employed in a pesticide company with a limited monthly salary.

Douaa also provides special occasions' chocolate designs, as an additional income business.
Her acquired YOUTH loan will be invested in purchasing special Children, women and men Autumn and winter newly released collection.
Douaa is the first lady at the far right side of the picture. As for the other group members, Zahraa is the lady at the center of the picture, while Maya is the first lady at the far left side of the picture with turquoise veil.

loans.use: to purchase special children, women and men autumn and winter newly released collections.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 59 years old and married with six children.

Marcelina is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Marcelina requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marcelina has been raising livestock for 3 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Marcelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Cherry Mae

texts.en:
Cherry Mae is 33 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Cherry Mae is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Cherry Mae has been raising livestock for 4 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Moon Group

texts.en:
Kabuyu is in her late 30s is a divorcee with four children. Three of them are grown up and one is still in school. She has been running a retail shop for four years now. She works from 6am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase on the retail shop stock and has paid back his loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy the fast moving items in the retail shop. She dreams of expanding his business.

Kabuyu will share this loan with her loan group MOON which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast moving items in the retail shop.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Armed with her dream to push her children’s studies until completion and eventually enjoy a better living condition someday, Flordeliza, 50, is working really hard to improve her business. She’s into buy and sell of frozen foods in their community in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. It’s a saleable product and sometimes she runs out of stock. As much as she wanted to distribute more items, but her capital is limited and she has a small freezer. Also the climate and electric interruption greatly affect her income. 

Flordeliza aims to buy volume of frozen foods and invest for a large freezer and generator. This is to prepare for the coming peak season or Christmas season. She also aspires to expand her delivery area outside Bacolod in order to gain more customers. These are the reasons why she needs some help from you in the amount of PHP 30,000. She is positive that she can pay it back because of the anticipated increase in demand for her products.

She is married to Enrico, a pensioner, who is always supportive of her and her business. Both of them exert best effort to have a sufficient living condition for the whole family.

Flordeliza draws inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories of their life and business and to draw strength the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy volume of frozen foods and invest for a large freezer and generator

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily works hard to support her family. Emily is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional gallon of gasoline, a fishing net, etc.

Emily has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Emily would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional gallon of gasoline, a fishing net, etc.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 52 years old and married with one child. Ninfa works very hard to provide for them.

Ninfa has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ninfa has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Ninfa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is a married mother of two children, one of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over four years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is married with two school going children. They live at their own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a khanga ( women wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khanga’s for resale.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Tamar is 45 years old. She is married and lives in Lanchkhuti district with her child and husband. Tamar works as a nurse and gets a small monthly income. She decided to start an additional activity in order to increase her family income.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $1300 USD. With the received credit she will start trading fruits and vegetables. This will increase her family income and Tamar will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to begin trading fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Hj. Ka'iah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Ka’iah, who is a 45-year-old married with one son and one daughter. Ka’iah is a housewife and her husband is fish farmers. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah.

This loan will be used to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and clear water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Ka’iah will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation and clear water for their family.

loans.name: Paos' Group

texts.en:
A local farmer residing in Kampong Cham province, Paos is a 43-year-old mother of three children, one of whom is dependent and still in school. This widowed woman supports her family’s living through growing cassava and soybeans. She has been doing this for years. Earning around USD11 per day, Paos can save around USD6 each day. Drop of cassava’s price is the main challenge to her.

She decided to form a group of two members to apply for loans from VisionFund. Past loan has helped her improve family’s living condition. In her second cycle loan, Paos, the group leader, will use some of her loan to buy organic fertilizer to support farming business and some to send her children to school. She hopefully wants to improve the crop yields in order to send children to university and upgrade the standard of living.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to support agribusiness and support her children’s studying. .

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba is a Babban Gona farmer.  Habiba is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing her dreams of gaining wealth someday. Traditionally, Habiba would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan Habiba can store her maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Habiba has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Habiba is thankful that she no longer has to worry about having money to pay for her children's school fees and looks forward to using her additional earnings to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia, aged 47, reached her fifth year of elementary school. She is single and lives alone. Cynthia is responsible for her own expenses; therefore, she is working hard to achieve success. For 11 years, Cynthia has been involved in her business selling smoked fish, as it was the best way to earn an income. She also does the housework. Cynthia goes out to different places to sell the smoked fish to her customers. Cynthia is happy to offer her customers excellent service. The loan she needs is to buy 3,500 GHS worth of fish and firewood, which she will use to make smoked fish to sell to customers.

loans.use: to buy 3,500 GHS worth of fish and firewood, which she will use to make smoked fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en: Najah is a 47 year’s old married woman living with her husband and three children, one of them is still attending school. Her husband represents the main income source in the family in order to satisfy the family needs. And she works as a housekeeping to help him. Today, in order to pay her child educational fees, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to register him with the coming school year. Her only target is to see him pursuing his education suitably.

loans.use: to register his child with the coming school year

loans.name: Rabeccah

texts.en: Rabeccah is maize farmer from Umbo village. As a member of Babban Gona, Rabeccah is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support she has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. Before joining Babban Gona, Rabeccah would have had to sell her maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rabeccah can store her maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Rabeccah is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use her increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Angel Maria

texts.es:
María, de 69 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, porque sus padres no tenían los recursos económicos para mandarla, está viuda y tiene tres hijos pero ninguno viven con ella y es su padre quien vive nada más con ella. 

María, tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa desde hace 45 años y antes la tenía más grande, pero por la situación sociales ha disminuido el potencial de ventas pero se mantiene, pero además de eso siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz a 15 minutos de su hogar.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar productos para la tienda y para comprar insumos agrícolas para sus cultivos.

Los sueños de María, son seguir trabajando para darle lo necesario a su padre y que la milpa crezca y de una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
María, 69, didn't have the opportunity to go to school because her parents didn't have the financial means to send her. She's widowed. She has 3 children who don't live with her; she lives with only her father.
