For 45 years, María's been running a small grocery store from her house. It was a bigger store before, but the social situation has diminished the potential for sales; but still, it endures. She also sows corn and has a 7000 square meter crop, 15 minutes from her house.

She is requesting a loan to buy products for her store and agricultural supplies for her crops.

María's dreams include continuing her work so she can give her father everything he needs and growing her maize field so she can have a good harvest.

loans.use: buy products for the store and agricultural supplies for her crops.

loans.name: Berta Rosa

texts.es:
Hace 14 años que Berta se dedica a la venta de comida está casada y su esposo fue quien le brindo el capital para comenzar con una pequeña fritanga, con el tiempo comenzó a vender almuerzos y nacatamales. Poco a poco ha ido surtiendo su negocio con mesas y sillas para atender a los clientes. 
Para seguir incrementando su negocio y su clientela Berta solicita un crédito para comprar nuevas mesas y materia prima para la elaboración de las comidas, de esta manera podrá ofrecer mayor presentación y obtener mayor clientela. Dentro de sus planes futuros esta establecer un restaurante.
texts.en:
Berta has been selling food for 14 years.  She is married, and her husband was the one who provided her the capital to start up a small fast food business.  Over time, she started selling lunches and nacatamales (stuffed corncakes).  She gradually equipped her business with tables and chairs to serve her customers.  

In order to continue to grow her business, Berta is requesting a loan to buy new tables and to buy raw materials to make her dishes.  This way, she can increase her offerings and attract more customers.  She has a number of plans for the future, including starting up a new restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables and supplies for her business

loans.name: Sevak

texts.en:
Sevak is 22-years-old man from Noyemberyan town of Tavush region, living with his mother.
Sevak's primary income comes from the sale of milk and other dairy products, while he also buys and sells cattle on occasion.

He currently keeps livestock of three cows, three calves and 10 hens. Sevak has now requested this loan to purchase forage for feeding the livestock. The ongoing conflict occurring in the border of Tavush region, is the main challenge he Sevak and other farmers living there face.
Sevak hopes to receive the loan and develop his farm, so it will permit him to provide his mother a better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock and develop his family's farming business

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
This is Marissa, aged 39, from the city of Davao in Mindanao region. She is married to Allan, an electrician, with whom she has three children, one of them is in college and two are still in elementary level. 

As her husband's salary is barely enough to raise a family of four, Marissa decided to run a small general store to help her husband make a living. She’s also an on-call beautician because she knows the basics of hair styling and make-up. Now she plans to venture into buy and sell of LPG as additional source of income. 

With her drive to enhance her businesses, she applied for PHP 40,000 loan which she will use to pay for dry goods, grocery items, and beverages for her store plus initial stock of LPGs for resale. She trusts your good heart to support her with your financial assistance. 

Marissa hopes to sustain and grow her businesses so she could send all her children to college. For her, education is the best inheritance that cannot be stolen from her children. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week; there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for dry goods, grocery items, and beverages for her store plus initial stock of LPGs for sale

loans.name: Mujeres Al Progreso Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “MUJERES AL PROGRESO” conformada por 05 socias con deseos trabajar honradamente. Ella es Malena una de las socias de 60 años de edad soltera con 1 hijo. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas como arroz con pollo  y pollo broster y muchas variedades más Desde hace más de 2 años que tiene dicho negocio. Su mayor deseo es de poder ampliar su negocio. Solicito el crédito para la compra de pollo arroz y menestras. El grupo “mujeres al progreso” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite seguir mejorando. Malena es la primera del lado derecho viste polo color ROSADO.
texts.en:
This is the new communal bank "Mujeres al Progreso," which has 5 members who want to have honest work.  Malena, one of the members, is 60 years old and is single and has a son.  She has a business selling food such as chicken with rice, roasted chicken, and other dishes.  She's had this business for more than 2 years.  

Malena's greatest wish is to expand her business.  She is requesting a loan to buy chicken, rice, and dried beans.  The communal bank "Mujeres al Progreso" is grateful to the Kiva lenders who are making this loan possible, as it is enabling them to continue to improve.  Malena is the first from the right, seen wearing a pink top.

loans.use: to buy rice, chicken, and dried beans

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 43-year-old married woman who has two children to provide for. She owns and manages her farm, planting and harvesting a variety of crops to sell to the market. With the help of her husband, who also does farming, they were able to send her children to school.

She wants to improve their living condition and engage in other business activities. She joined and gained access to GDMPC. Recently she took a loan to buy a variety of seedlings and fertilizer for her garden.

Evelyn's plan for the future is to save more money and to sustain their living condition.

loans.use: to buy a variety of seedlings and fertilizer for her garden.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.en:
Hermelinda is 51 years old and married with seven children, five of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

Hermelinda has borrowed and repaid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married mother of six children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Imee

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Imee works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from cooking.

Imee is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy fishing net and other materials that she needs for her fishing business.

Imee has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream - to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other materials that she needs for fishing.

loans.name: Sulma Esperanza

texts.es:
Sulma, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, actualmente está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, vive con tres hijos y sus dos padres; sus hijos mayores van a la escuela y su papá realiza labores agrícolas y su madre se encarga de los oficios domésticos en su vivienda. 

Sulma, se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos en su caserío, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres, ella se encarga de comprar cerdos pequeños, luego los desarrolla a basa de concentrados de buena calidad para un buen crecimiento y luego los vende, así como también realiza compra de medicamentos para mantenerlos libres de cualquier enfermedad a sus animales.- Sulma, tiene que recorrer una distancia corta para lograr vender sus animales, ya que a las personas que se los vende viven en su mismo caserío.

Ella, necesita el préstamo para comprar alimentos, vitaminas, desparasitantes, inyecciones, etc. todo esto para aplicarlo a sus animales.

Sulma, sueña con dar a su familia todo lo necesario para vivir bien y que en su casa no falte nada para su bienestar.-
texts.en:
Sulma, 33, studied up to grade 9. She has a partner who works in agriculture. She lives with her 3 children and parents. Her older children go to school. Her father is a farmer and her mother takes care of domestic chores in the home.

Sulma is a pig breeder and seller in her hamlet. She learned this trade from her parents. She is in charge of buying piglets, raising them on quality pig feed so they grow well and then selling them. She also buys medications to keep her animals free from all diseases. Sulma goes a short distance to sell her pigs as the buyers live in her same hamlet.

She is requesting a loan to buy everything she needs for her animals, like food, vitamins, parasite remover, injections, etc.

Sulma dreams of giving her family everything necessary to live well and that nothing is lacking in her house for their well-being.

loans.use: buy everything she needs for her animals, like food, vitamins, parasite remover, injections, etc.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman who has three children, two of whom attend school. She lives at her own house, which has electricity but no piped water.

She has operated a retail shop for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock including sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Germano

texts.en: Germano lives in Liquisa, and his business is coffee production.  And now he is applying for a loan of $ 1,000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin, to improve his business. He wants to make his business bigger in the future. He first opened his business in 2014, with his own working capital of $ 1,000. He lives near many people, so he has one idea to open his coffee production for everybody, so that he can help them.  He earns a good income every day, because many people come to buy his coffee production, so he is very happy with his business. He is taking this loan because he wants to use it to buy coffee, backup tools for machining, and other materials to use.

loans.use: to buy coffee, backup tools for machining, and other materials to use in coffee production.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 32 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom are in school. Riza works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more items to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, eggs, canned goods, etcetera.

Riza has been in this business for 4 years. In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, eggs, canned goods, etcetera.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in ampoules, shampoo, chemicals, keratin, a hair iron and other products to provide her customers with better service.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 52 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to purchase more stock, to sell in her general store. She sells a variety of items, such as candies, soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, etcetera.

Nenita has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock, to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Melody works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from food vending.

Melody is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use it to buy additional fishing net, gasoline, and other supplies for her fishing business.

Melody has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net, gasoline, and other supplies for fishing.

loans.name: María Reina

texts.es:
María, de 38 años de edad, es madre de un hijo que estudia quinto grado, se caso hace once años, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura sembrando maíz y frijoles y en la carpintería elaborando muebles y otros productos, a la vez es fontanero de la comunidad.- 

María, se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, además trabaja de lunes a viernes con su esposo en los trabajos agrícolas por las tardes, actualmente han sembrado 17,500 metros cuadrados de maíz y 7,000 metros cuadrados de frijoles en las colinas de la comunidad y necesitan estar pendientes del cuido y manejo de los cultivos.- Para llegar hasta donde tiene sus cultivos tiene que caminar media hora por caminos entre los cerros, para llegar a los cultivos y estar pendientes de ellos. 

María, solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para sus cultivos de maíz y frijoles y para pagar el alquiler de la tierra.

María, sueña que su hijo se prepare profesionalmente y que el pueda obtener un titulo donde pueda trabajar.
texts.en: Maria is 38 years old. She is the mother of a son who is in fifth grade. She married eleven years ago. Her husband works in agriculture, growing corn and beans, and in carpentry, making furniture and other products. Also, he is a plumber in his community. Maria works in household chores. Also, she works with her husband in agriculture work from Monday to Friday in the afternoons. Currently, they have grown 17,500 square meters of corn and 7,000 square meters of beans in the hills of the community; and they need to be attentive to the care and management of their crops. In order to get where they have their crops, she has to walk half an hour through paths between the hills to get to the crops and take care of them. Maria is requesting the loan to buy agricultural inputs for her corn and bean crops, and to pay to rent the land. Maria dreams that her son can get professionally prepared, and that he is able to get a certification where he can work.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her corn and bean crops, and to pay to rent the land.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a direct-selling business, selling Avon and Personal Collection products, in the Philippines.

Leonida requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy more products from Avon and Personal Collection to sell to her customers.

Leonida has been in this business for 11 years. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan, to further build her business. She would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more products from Avon and Personal Collection to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria is 42 years old and married with three children. Two children are still in school. Ana Maria works very hard to provide for them.

Ana Maria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, shampoo, snack foods, etc.

Ana Maria has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future Ana Maria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, shampoo, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Ishaka Group

texts.fr:
Céline  fait partie du groupe  Ishaka III  et  habite à  Ngozi. Elle a 32 ans et est mariée à  Félix, un commerçant. 

Elle fait  de banane depuis 3 ans. 

Elle  est  à son  sixième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande de bananes  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en: Céline belongs to the Ishaka III group and lives in Ngozi. She is 32 years old and married to Félix, a trader. She has been selling bananas for the past three years and is on her sixth loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan she is granted she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas to resell, so she can earn more money.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas to resell so she can make more  money.

loans.name: Nuru Group

texts.fr:
Sicaire  fait partie du groupe  Nuru  et  habite à  Ngozi. Il a 32 ans et est marié à Zawadi, une cultivatrice. 

Il fait  le commerce du riz, haricot, du sel,… depuis 3 ans. 

Il  est s à son  deuxième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de riz et de haricot à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en: Sicaire belongs to the Nuru group and lives in Ngozi. He is 32 years old and married to Zawadi, who is a farmer. He has been buying and selling rice, beans, salt,...for the past three years and is on his second loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan he is granted, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of rice and beans to resell, so he can earn more money.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of rice and beans to resell, so he can earn more.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a woman in her early 30s. She has been living with her partner under the marital state of Free Union. With him, she started a small family. They have two young kids who rely on them.

Her partner is the main economical provider for the family, but Maribel likes to contribute to the household income. To achieve this, she started a grocery store. She may count this grocery store among the biggest achievements of her life, because that store moved her family ahead in harder times. Among her greater achievements also are her children whom she is raising.

With her store, she has managed to make a fair profit, but lately she has been struggling to meet the client demand. Maribel has had more important expenses that she needed to cover and wasn't able to stock her inventory. Because of the lack of products she started to lose clients; therefore, she is applying for a 10,000 MXN loan with Kiva through Kubo, who is a field partner.

Maribel also had other loans at different places and paid for those well and on time, but she had problems with the huge taxes. She hopes to make a bigger profit with this loan.

loans.use: to restock her store

loans.name: Odette

texts.fr: Odette est une femme célibataire âgée de 26 ans qui habite à Baguida. Sans enfant, Odette est une marchande d’articles scolaire qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend dans sa boutique qu’elle a louée pour gagner ses revenus. Pour commander des paquets de cahiers de deux-cent pages et de cent pages, Odette nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de relancer son activité et pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens.
texts.en:
Odette is a single woman of 26 who lives in Baguida. She has no children and she sells school supplies. She stocks up once a month at the market and sells her goods in the little store she has rented so she can earn a living.

So as to order some packs of notebooks of 200 pages and 100 pages, Odette needs this loan to pay for her restocking and make a good profit margin so she can start her business again and meet her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy 20 packs of notebooks with 200 pages each and 12 packs of notebooks with 100 pages each.

loans.name: Bouchiratou

texts.fr: Célibataire et mère d’un enfant, Bouchiratou est une femme âgée de 50 ans résidant à Tokoin. Bouchiratou est une marchande  de produits d’alimentations générales et de boissons alcoolisée qui s’approvisionne de ses marchandises deux fois par mois au marché et le revend dans sa boutique à domicile. Bouchiratou sollicite ce prêt pour commander des cartons de milo, de lait peak et des casiers de bières en vue d’avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin d’aider son enfant en payant ses frais scolaire et à subvenir aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées par sa famille.
texts.en:
Single and the mother of one child, Bouchiratou is 50 years old and lives Tokoin. She sells groceries and alcoholic beverages. She buys her supplies twice a month at the market and resells them out of her home.

Bouchiratou is asking for a loan in order to buy boxes of Milo (cocoa drink powder), Peak brand milk, and beer. She wants to buy these goods in large quantities in order to maximize her profit and help her husband with their child’s education. She wants to contribute to their schooling fees and help with the daily household expenses.

loans.use: buy four racks of beer, two boxes of Milo (cocoa drink powder), and two boxes of Peak brand milk.

loans.name: Kloupe

texts.fr: Kloupé est une femme mariée âgée de 36 ans résidant à Adidogomé avec deux enfants à charge. Kloupé est une revendeuse de tomates fraîches qui s’approvisionne deux fois  par mois au marché et le revend en circulant les quartiers environnant. Kloupé désire commander des paniers de tomates fraîches avec le prêt qu’elle demande. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Kloupé pourra soutenir son mari dans les charges  de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kloupé is a 36-year old married woman living in Adidogomé with two dependent children. She resells fresh tomatoes she buys at the market twice a month and resells in nearby neighborhoods as an itinerant vendor. 

Kloupé would like to use this loan to buy baskets of fresh tomatoes. Thanks to her profit margin, Kloupé will be able to help her husband provide for the household and provide a good education for their children.

loans.use: to buy eight baskets of fresh tomatoes.

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr: Mère de trois enfants, Mama est une femme mariée âgée de 32 ans. Mama réside à Adidogomé et est une marchande de produits alimentaire. Mama achète ses marchandises deux fois par mois au marché et les revendent à domicile. Mama sollicite ce crédit pour commander des paniers de petits poissons fumés. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Mama va pouvoir aider son mari dans l’éducation de ses enfants et dans les charges quotidiennes éprouvées par sa famille.
texts.en:
Mama is thirty-two years old, married and mother to three children. She lives in Adidogomé and sells food products. She buys her stock twice a month from the market and sells it from her home.

Mama has requested this loan to buy baskets of little smoked fish. Her earnings will help her husband provide for the education of their children and the day-to-day expenses of their family.

loans.use: to buy 2 baskets of little smoked fish

loans.name: Rui

texts.en: Rui is a 57-year-old, married father of six children. He works hard to support his family. He is a security guard in a hospital, and his wife is a housewife. Although the family works very hard, it can be not enough for them to afford the cost of their daughter's education. This loan of $ 600 will allow Rui to help his daughter to continue her study in University. He will use the loan to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies, and also his daughter being far from them. In the future, Rui hopes that his children are all well-educated and knowledgeable.

loans.use: to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies for his daughter at University.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 37-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has three children, and her children are studying. Her husband has been running his own business of selling clothing for 10 years. Her husband is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Her husband needs to purchase different types of garments, in bulk, for reselling. But due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase these garments. Therefore, Nusrat is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. The loan will enable her to assist her husband to purchase these garments in bulk, for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit, with the help of this loan amount. Nusrat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to assist her husband to increase his clothing sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her working capital so she can expand her business.

loans.name: Kokoe

texts.fr: Kokoe est une femme mariée et âgée de 44 ans résidant à Adidogomé avec trois enfants à charge. Kokoe est une revendeuse de charbon de bois et des chaussures qui s’approvisionne deux  fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile puis au marché. Pour financer son achat, Kokoe nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois et des unités de chaussures afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices et soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille puis permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kokoe is a 44 year old married woman living in Adidogomé, raising three children. Kokoe sells charcoal and shoes and she renews her stock twice a month at the market. She sells her goods from home and at the market.

To finance her purchase, Kokoe needs this loan so she can order sacks of charcoal and pairs of shoes. She wants to make more profit and help her husband with family expenses so they can permit their children to get a good education.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of charcoal and 35 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Davi

texts.fr: Mère de deux enfants, Davi est une femme mariée qui vit à Agoè. Agée de 20 ans, Davi  fait le commerce du riz en sacs ; qu’elle achète auprès des paysans des villages environnant. Davi vend à domicile. Davi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois. Davi demande ce prêt pour l’achat des sacs de riz. Ce crédit permet à Davi d’acheter au comptant et de tirer le prix au plus bas ; ce qui lui permet de gagner plus de bénéfice et pouvoir participer aux charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: Davi is a 20-year-old married woman who lives in Agoè with her two children. She buys bags of uncooked rice in nearby villages and sells them door to door to her clients. Davi buys her supplies twice a month from these villages. Davi is requesting this loan to buy bags of rice so that she can earn a higher income and afford her family's various daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy two bags of rice.

loans.name: Siyoni Group

texts.fr:
Gertrude  fait partie du groupe  Siyoni et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 53 ans et est mariée à Raphael, un menuisier. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 18 à 23 ans, dont  2 étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge 3 enfants dont 1 étudie. 

Elle fait le commerce de farine de bouillie  depuis 17 ans. 

Elle est à son  quinzième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de farine de bouillie  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Gertrude is part of the Siyoni Group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 53 years old and is married to Raphael, a carpenter. Together, they have three children between the ages of 18 and 23, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of three children, 1 of whom is in school.

She has sold flour porridge for 17 years.

This will be her fifth loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan that she receives, she will increase her capital and buy a large amount of flour to make corn porridge, which she will sell in order to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to see her children go to school.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large amount of flour to make corn porridge, which she will sell to earn more

loans.name: Nshigikira Group

texts.fr:
Concilie fait partie du groupe  Nshigikira et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 43 ans et est mariée à Moise ,un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 7 à 19 ans, tous étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de bière industrielle "primus"  depuis  7 ans. 

C’ est  à son premier   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une beaucoup de caisse de bière  industrielle  "primus"  à revendre pour gagner plus
texts.en:
Concilie is part of the Nshigikira group and lives in Gitega. She is 43 years old and is married to Moise, who is a shopkeeper. Together they havev 5 children between the ages of 7 and 19, all of whom are in school.

She has sold Primus industrial beer for 7 years. 

This is her first loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan that she receives, she will increase her capital and buy a large amount of Primus industrial beer to sell so that she may earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to increase her capital.

loans.use: to increase her capital and to buy a large amount of Primus industrial beer, which she will sell to earn more.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a 43-year-old married  woman. She lives in the rural area of Clarin, Bohol. She has a 19-year old son. She has been running a purified drinking water refill for two years now.
Her current business is running well and increasing day by day. 
Therefore she decided to increase her current business .

Therefore Eva  is applying for a Kiva loan to buy additional gallons and items for the sari-sari (variety)-for start-up. In this way she would be able to cope with demands. Slowly, she could able to pay her obligations and manage her finances wisely.
 
In the future, she is looking forward to have a successful start-up for her sari-sari(variety) store to augment the family's living  condition.

loans.use: to buy additional gallons of drinking water and items for her sari-sari for start-up.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is in her early 50s is married with five children. Two of the are still in school and three of them are grown up.  She has been a food vendor for six years now.  She works from 08am to 06pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Rukia's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase on the food stock and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan, bought a plot of land and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in the food store.  She dreams of building her own house.

Rukia will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in the food store.

loans.name: Ruweida

texts.en:
Ruweida is a 41 year old married woman living with her husband and mother of three children. Her husband is the main income source in the family, he is a retired soldier and works also in the agriculture field as for her, and she produces homemade food in order to help him financially.

Due to the hard financial circumstances and with the aim to help her children with their education, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to be able to pay their school educational fees. Her only dream is to ensure them a heavy life and helped them to achieve high educational levels and being always able to satisfy their needs.

loans.use: to pay her children school educational fees

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
You will be pleased to meet Laila, 47 years old, married to Arnaldo, a tricycle driver, and they have children who are studying. They live in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental in the Visayas region. Laila raises hogs in her backyard for seven years now. Hog raising, according to her is quite tiring but she focuses on its sustainability and its contribution to food production for the community.

Aside from hog raising, Laila also ventured into variety store business where she sells usual commodities that are essential to everyday living of the people. Somehow it gives her a regular daily income compared to hog raising which takes several months before she receives the return of her investment. 

Laila’s husband does his part by driving their tricycle for income. Large chunk of his income goes to the monthly installment for the tricycle. This is why he is very eager to fully pay its last monthly installment so his family can enjoy its full benefits. He will just set aside some amount for its maintenance.
 
Now Laila is requesting for PhP 20,000 supplementary capital to buy feeds for her hogs and additional supplies for her variety store. She will also allot some amount to pay the last installment for their tricycle. In the next few weeks she can already sell a fattened hog and she can recover her expenses. She aims to steadily improve her hog raising venture to attain her dream of owning a big piggery someday. 
	
She shares her aspirations to her co-fellowship* members at CCT. She’s a dedicated member of the organization where she continually gains inspiration from Bible reflections and sharing of life experiences.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her hogs and additional supplies for her variety store

loans.name: Pamela Rose

texts.en:
Pamela Rose is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a food vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like general store.

Pamela Rose dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Sinat, the farmer from a rural area of Kampong Cham province, is 33 years old. She is married with five dependent children, two of whom are in school.  Having been growing cassava and rice for years, Sinat earns about USD20 per day and can save approximately about USD13 per day after daily expenses. Her cassava crop grows unhealthily and its price is low sometimes; these are the challenge to cassava farming business. 
This former client has ever been with VisionFund for second times already. Past loans which were fully paid back have helped her buy sufficient school supplies for her school-aged children. Sinat, who is the group leader of two members, will use her loan portion to buy cassava seedlings and pay for labor fees. She hopes to generate more income so as to fulfill her dream of buy two-hectare area of land to grow cassava and rubber trees. Especially, she wants to support her children’s studying until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy cassava seedlings and pay for labor fees so that she can buy an additional plot of farmland and support her children’s studying. .

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is maize farmer from Umbo village. As a member of Babban Gona, Rhoda is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support she has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Rhoda would have had to sell her maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rhoda can store her maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Rhoda is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use her increased earnings to move into a better home with her family.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her farm yields.

loans.name: Mariga

texts.en:
Mariga is married with three school going children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a khanga ( women wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khanga’s for resale.

loans.name: Jose Geremias

texts.es: Jose de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, el posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, elabora puertas,balcones, rejas entre otros, tiene 15 años de dedicarse a este negocio y tiene mucha experiencia que le ayuda a mejorar cada día su labor, ya tiene mucha clientela pues lo buscan por la calidad de su trabajo, por los precios accesibles pero sobre todo porque siempre realiza el trabajo al gusto del cliente; el solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar hierro, metal, herramientas y un compresor y así poder tener seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose is 31 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner and their two children.  He owns a metal workshop.  He makes doors, balconies, and vents, among other things.  He has been in the business for 15 years and he has a lot of experience that allows him to improve his work every day.  He has many customers who seek him out for quality work, accessible prices, and above all because he always customizes his work to the client's wishes.  

He is requesting a loan from Integral to buy iron, metal, tools, and a compressor so that he can continue with his work in order to bring in more income.

loans.use: to buy iron, metal, tools, and a compressor.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Augustine is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Augustine would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Augustine will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Augustine now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday is a Babban Gona farmer.  Sunday is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. Traditionally, Sunday would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan Sunday can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Sunday has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Sunday is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to feed his family and children and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Hannatu

texts.en:
Hannatu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Hannatu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hannatu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Hannatu can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Hannatu will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Hannatu is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chips, candies, candles, canned sardines, corned beef, seasoning, condiments, noodles and eggs

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina who is in her late 30s is married with four children who are still at school. She has been selling charcoal for five years now. She works from 07am to 08pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Penina's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on the sacks of charcoal and has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. She used the profit to buy goats, cows, a TV set, a radio, sofa sets, to repay loan, to pay school fees an d covered household expenses. She will use this to buy sacks of charcoal to resale. She dreams of her children go to university.

Penina will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie works hard to support her family. Tessie is married and has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Tessie has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Tessie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ledesma

texts.en:
Ledesma is 55 years old and has ten children. Ledesma is married and has three children are still in school.

Ledesma is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ledesma requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ledesma has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ledesma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married mother of six children, five  of whom attend school. She owns a house that  neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en: Hajara is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Hajara has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Hajara would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Hajara can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Hajara will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Hajara is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with one kid, who attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity but no  piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanaidi operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 
With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Mwanamtiti

texts.en:
Mwanamtiti is a married woman with one child who attends school.She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a plastics selling items like tea mugs ,basins and plastic chairs for the past two years selling at the market .With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase a stock of plastics items for resale.She decided to join yehu to access loans and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of plastics items for resale.

loans.name: Nai On's Group

texts.en:
A 43-year-old married womanm, Nai On, resides in Kampong Cham province and supports her family by growing rice which she has been doing for 25 years. She sometimes uses her spare time to work for others for a fee to supplement income. The challenge rice growing business is to get lower-than-expected outputs, which is caused by drought.
In a group which consists of two members, Nai On is the leader. It is the first time for her to apply for loan from VisionFund. She will use her loan to purchase rice seeds and organic fertilizer for rice-growing business. With this loan, she hopes to earn a larger income to make a better living and buy an additional plot of farmland.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and organic fertilizer to boost crop yields so that she can buy an additional plot of farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Saratu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona,

Saratu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Saratu can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Saratu will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Saratu is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Edmondine Vola Tantely

texts.fr: Edmondine a 36 ans, elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Ces derniers sont tous scolarisés. Son époux est magasinier salarié dans une entreprise de distribution alimentaire. Quant à Edmondine, elle est pâtissière d'une part et vend des articles de bébé de l'autre. Elle démarrait la pâtissière en 2010 et elle a l'intention de le développer et l'étendre. Actuellement, elle fait des livraisons chez des revendeurs et souhaite ouvrir son propre petit salon de thé. Donc, elle a besoin d'investir, c'est pourquoi, elle s'est approchée de CEFOR pour demander du crédit.
texts.en: Edmondine is 36 years old.  She is married and the mother of two children who both attend school.  Her husband works as a salaried storekeeper for a food distributor.  Edmondine herself is as confectioner and she also sells infants' products.  She began working as a confectioner in 2010 and she intends to develop and expand her activity.  She currently makes deliveries to resellers and she would like to open her own small tearoom.  To reach her goals, Edmondine needs to invest, which is the reason why she has turned to CEFOR and requested a loan.

loans.use: to buy some flour, cooking oil, cheese, eggs, butter, yeast etc....

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es: Don Narciso de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica desde hace 47 años a la agricultura siembra maíz, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Narciso, 62 years old, lives in his own house with his spouse. For 47 years, he has worked in agriculture cultivating corn. He sells his products in different markets that can be found around his home. The client is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest controls, etc., and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph, so that he can continue with his work and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest controls, etc., and to improve the land.

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is a 24-year-old, single man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Because the economic situation in Gaza is not good, A few years ago, Bassam started his own business.  He manages  a stall for selling clothes
This is the only source of income for the family. Bassam took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy collection of men's and women's clothes for his stall. This will increase his sales and also his income. Bassam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy collection of men's and women's clothes for his stall.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Sometimes it’s the husband-and-wife’s partnership that makes a business successful. Emily of Davao City, finds it true. She acquired this vehicle some time ago and her husband, Peladelfo, drives it for income. Similarly she ventured into direct selling business of personal and home care products. They toil hard to supply their family’s daily needs and support their children education. They also dream of renovating their house someday.

At present, the vehicle needs to undergo maintenance procedure like overhauling and replacement of some parts. While her direct selling business suffers from delayed payments of customers. Emily needs to obtain supplementary capital to continue the operation of their businesses. A loan worth PHP 29,000 would be of great help to pay for the vehicle maintenance and more supplies of personal and home care products that Emily can sell. Your kind generosity would be highly appreciated with prayers that more blessings would come your way.

Emily is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the vehicle maintenance and buy more supplies of personal and home care products

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 51 years old and has six children. Susan is married and has one child still in school.

Susan is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Susan has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Susan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille is 41 years old and married with two children, two children are presently in school, Lucille works very hard to provide for them.

Lucille runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and etc .

Lucille has been in this business for 4 years. 

In the future Lucille would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and etc

loans.name: Wanjala

texts.en:
Wanjala is a married and has seven children three of whom attend school. They own a house that neither  has electricity nor  piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Wanjala has operated a business of selling paraffin for use in cooking as retail to neighbours. She faces a challenge of seasonality and transportation in her business.
With the loan that she is requesting she wants to  purchase a stock of paraffin for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to  purchase a stock of paraffin for resale

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en:
Isiyaku is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Isiyaku has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, which is 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Isiyaku would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when market prices for maize are at their lowest, in order to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Isiyaku can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Isiyaku is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman, and together with her husband, they have one child. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past year Saumu has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high costs of transportation.

With the KES 30,000 Saumu wants to purchase bundles of charcoal to resell. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some sugar, coffee and salt.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 3 años, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar más frutas y verduras por mayor, para tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This young woman's face is pixelated in the photo because she is 22 years old and lives in a high risk area. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for three years. Her business is located in the city market. With the money she gets from her sales, she is able to pay for some of her household expenses. She lives in her own house with her husband and two children. She is requesting a loan to be able to buy more fruits and vegetables in bulk, in order to have better income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Ana Yancy

texts.es:
Las ganas de salir adelante es lo que caracteriza a Ana Yancy es por esta razón que instalo en su casa una pequeña pulpería hace siete años, su mama es su principal apoyo. Poco a poco ha ido incrementando su negocio con mayor inventario. 
Ana esta vez solicita un crédito para comprar granos básicos, productos de uso personal, jugos entre otros para satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes y así podrá obtener mayores ingresos con las ventas. En un futuro desea optar por un crédito mayor para abastecer en grande su pulpería.
texts.en:
The will to get ahead is what characterizes Ana Yancy. It is for this reason that seven years ago she set up a little grocery store in her house. Her mother is her principal support. Little by little she has been increasing her business with a larger inventory.

This time Ana is applying for a loan to buy basic grains, products for personal use, and juices, among other items, in order to satisfy the needs of her customers, and thus she will be able to obtain more income with the sales. In the future she wants to aim for a bigger loan to stock her store more extensively.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, products for personal use, and juices, among other items.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 21 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de flores desde hace 4 años su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal y ya posee muchos clientes, la joven vive en casa propia con su madre, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas variedad de flores por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
The face of this young woman is blurred because she is 21 years old and lives in a high risk area.

For the past four years, she has made a living selling flowers. Her business is located in the city market, and by now, she has a lot of customers. She lives with her mother in a house they own.

She is requesting a loan to purchase a greater variety of flowers wholesale, in order to continue her sales and therefore have better economic income.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of flowers wholesale

loans.name: Nidia Arely

texts.es:
Arely, de 23 años de edad, es madre soltera de un niño de 5 años de edad, ella creció al lado de sus padres trabajando en la agricultura y apoyando a su mamá en los quehaceres del hogar; solo estudio hasta séptimo grado, no pudo seguir por problemas económicos y la falta de apoyo; ella ahora vive con sus abuelos paternos donde está con su niño.

Arely, se dedica desde hace 6 años a la comercialización de tortillas, las cuales elabora a base de maíz en la comunidad y las vende en el pueblo de donde es originaria, allí tiene sus clientes a quienes va a entregarlas todos los días; ella se levanta temprano y comienza a hacer las tortillas desde las 5:30 de la mañana y vende de lunes a domingo. 

Arely, necesita el préstamo para comprar cuatro quintales de maíz, comprar leña y cal, para hacer las tortillas, quiere comprar un comal artesanal para hacer las tortillas; porque el que tiene ya está bastante desgastado. 

Arely, su sueño es comprar una plancha industrial, para hacer más tortillas para vender más en la comunidad, porque la demanda es mayor.
texts.en:
Arely, 23, is a single mother of a five-year-old boy. She grew up alongside her parents working in agriculture and helping her mother in the household chores. She only went to school until seventh grade. She could not go on due to financial problems and lack of support. Now she lives with her paternal grandparents and her son.

Arely has been selling tortillas for six years. She makes them from corn in the community and sells them in her home town, where she delivers tortillas to her regular customers every day. She gets up early and starts making tortillas at 5:30 a.m. and sells them Monday through Sunday.

Arely needs this loan to buy four hundred pounds of corn, and to buy firewood and lime, to make tortillas. She wants to buy a traditional comal to make tortillas, because the one she has is quite worn out now.

Arely's dream is to buy an industrial griddle to make more tortillas and sell more in the community, because the demand is high.

loans.use: to buy 400 pounds of corn and to buy firewood and lime, to make tortillas. She wants to buy a traditional comal.

loans.name: Liliana Elizabeth

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Del Nuevo Milenio se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Liliana, tiene 29 años de edad,  mantiene una relación de unión libre,  pero aun no ha tenido hijos. Es Ing. Civil. Recién graduada y esta a la espera de trabajos para poner en práctica sus conocimientos.
Doña Liliana es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado sentirse independiente,  ella  se dedica al comercio, vende ropa carteras y zapatos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y  también vende en su casa, ella recibe la mercadería desde los Estados Unidos, razón por lo cual sus clientes siempre la visitan, deja su mercadería a crédito y cobra cada 15 días, lleva 2 años en esta actividad la cual le permite ganarse lo suyo. 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son ejercer su profesión.
texts.en:
The Credit Group "Mujeres del Nuevo Milenio" (Women of the New Millennium) meets every 15 days in Cantón Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts that are recognized both nationally and internationally. It is the place of the famous straw hats.

Liliana lives here, she is 29 years old, and is in a common law marriage but does not have children. She is a recent civil engineer graduate and is waiting for a job to put her skills into practice.

Liliana is a woman who has always enjoyed feeling independent. She works in trade, selling clothing, wallets, and shoes. Her method of sale is door to door and also sells out of her home. She receives merchandise from the United States, that's why her clients always visit her. She lends her merchandise on credit and collects every 15 days. She has spent 2 years in this occupation, which has allowed her to earn her own.

This loan is to buy clothing of all types. She has spent 2 years in the Credit Group and likes it because the loans are quick. Her dream is to practice her profession.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Sabina Colombia

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Del Nuevo Milenio se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Sabina, tiene 71 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene seis hijos mayores  de edad  e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Sabina es una muy buena esposa que  realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su esposo a salir adelante en su negocio que es la fuente de ingresos para el hogar, el  se dedica al comercio, vende artesanía y productos de plástico, el sale a otras  ciudades a vender sus productos los mismos que tienen mucha demanda en esos lugares, esta es la razón por lo cual todas las semanas viaja. 
Este crédito es para comprar cerámicas y productos de plástico. Lleva más de 12 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda para salir adelante. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y gozando de buena salud para ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
The loan group Mujeres del Nuevo Milenio (Women of the New Millenium) meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are recognized at a national and an international level. This is the home of the famous toquilla straw hats [Panama hats].

Señora Sabina lives in this place. She is 71 years old. She is married and from this relationship she has six adult, independent children. Her husband is a businessman.

Doña Sabina is a very good wife who is taking out the loan in order to help her husband get ahead in his business, which is the source of income for the household. He works in commerce. He sells handicrafts and plastic products. He goes to other cities to sell his products, which have a lot of demand in these places. This is the reason why he travels every week.

This loan is to buy ceramics and plastic products. She has been in the loan group for more than 12 years, and she likes it because the loans are a big help to her to get ahead. Her dreams are to continue on and to enjoy good health for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy ceramics and plastic products.

loans.name: Jose Javier

texts.es:
Javier, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y elaboración de petates, vive con su suegra la cual también se dedica a la elaboración de petates y crianza de pollos en su mismo cantón.

Javier, se dedica a la crianza de peces por medio de dos estanques que ha construido recientemente, también realiza labores agrícolas y tiene varios cerdos los cuales engorda y después los vende dependiendo el precio que le ofrezcan.- La actividad principal de Javier, es la crianza de peces, ya que asegura que en el cantón donde vive no hay nadie que tenga estanques de peces, es por eso que considera que le traerá buenos beneficios; la crianza de peces la aprendió de otro trabajo que realizaba en otra zona, en la cual el percibió que lo podía poner en practica por la experiencia que adquirió en su trabajo anterior.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar peces, alimento y suministros para sus estanques, lo cual espera que en el corto plazo, le genere buenos beneficios para su negocio.

Javier, sueña con darle a su familia todo lo necesario para vivir bien y que en su casa no falte nada para su bienestar.-
texts.en:
34-year-old Javier went to school until ninth grade. He is in a relationship, and his partner works raising pigs and making bed mats. He lives with his mother-in-law, who also works making bed mats and raising chickens in the same area.

Javier makes a living by raising fish in two ponds that he has constructed recently. He also does farm work and has several hogs that he fattens and later sells, depending on the price that is offered.

Javier's main occupation is raising fish, and he says that in the area where he lives, no one has fish ponds. For this reason, he thought it would bring him a good profit. He learned how to raise fish from another job that he had in a different region. He realized he could put it into practice from the experience that he gained in his previous job.

He needs the loan to buy fish, food, and supplies for his ponds. In the short term, he hopes that it will generate good profit for his business.

Javier dreams of giving his family everything needed to live well, and that in his home, nothing for their well-being will be lacking.

loans.use: to buy fish, food, and supplies for his ponds

loans.name: Maria Reina

texts.es:
Reina, de 47 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, no pudo seguir debido al conflicto armado en el país y porque vivía muy lejos de la escuela, es madre de cinco hijos, solo estudia la menor, porque los otros hijos ya están mayores y tienen sus propios hogares, ella está casada y su esposo trabaja en la agricultura.

Reina, tiene una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad desde hace más de 15 años, porque donde vive no hay muchas tiendas y para ir a comprar tenían que caminar bastante, pero además de eso tiene un molino nixtamal.- Pero además se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y de especies menores en pequeña escala.

Reina, necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para su tienda como frijoles, huevos, aceite, azúcar, jabón, arroz, café y otros productos de la canasta básica.- Con ello pretende obtener más ganancias y obtener más ingresos para su hogar.

Reina, sueña con ir creciendo en su tienda y brindarle más productos a los clientes y apoyar a su hija en los estudios para que sigan adelante y logre superarse.
texts.en:
Reina is 47 years old and studied up to grade 2. She couldn't continue because of the armed conflict in her country and she also lived very far from the school. She is the mother of five children. Only the youngest one studies as the others are all adults and have their own homes. She is married and her husband works in agriculture.

Reina has had a store where she sells basic food products for more than 15 years. Where she lives there are not many stores and you have to walk a long ways to go to buy something. She also has a corn mill. Besides this she works raising pigs and small animals on a small scale.

Reina needs the loan to buy merchandise for her store like beans, eggs, oil, sugar, soap, rice, coffee and other basic food products. Doing this she hopes to obtain more profit and have more income for her household.

Reina dreams of continuing to expand her store and provide more products for her clients to support her daughter in her studies, so that she continues forward and manages to better herself.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store like beans, eggs, oil, sugar, soap, rice, coffee and other products.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de maiz almacena sus productos en los graneros que muestra la fotografia y tambien  la compra y venta de ganado desde hace 18 años, gracias a su trabajo y la ayuda de su esposo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas maiz para continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Catalina, 40 years old, lives in her own house with her husband. She works in trade and sells corn. She stores her products in the silos that are shown in the photograph. She also buys and sells livestock since 18 years ago. Thanks to her work and the help of her husband, she has managed to cover some household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy more corn so that she can continue her sales and thus can have a better economic income.

loans.use: to buy more corn.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: Don Salvador de 66 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, el se dedica a la venta de madera desde hace 20 años, tambien se dedica al cultivo de granos basicos, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas madera por mayor para seguir con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
66-year-old Salvador lives with his three children in a house he owns.

He has worked selling wood for the past 20 years. He also makes a living growing basic grains. With what he earns from his work, he has been able cover his household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to purchase more wood wholesale, in order to continue with his work and have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy more wood wholesale

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Musa has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Musa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Musa can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Musa will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Musa is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a better house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a single mother with two school-age children. They live in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a business selling khangas (women's wrap cloth), selling from home and door-to-door to neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas for resale.

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es:
Fidelina, de 60 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, actualmente está casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y atiende un molino en su vivienda, tienen dos hijos los cuales viven con sus respectivas parejas, ya que son personas adultas y que tienen sus propios ingresos.

Fidelina, es dueña de una tienda que está ubicada en su casa, ella tiene a la venta productos de primera necesidad como bebidas, granos básicos, golosinas, etc. el cual la inicio por iniciativa propia porque su casa se encuentra ubicada en calle principal de su cantón y en una zona céntrica.- Su esposo se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como maíz y frijol; ademas atiende un molino en su misma vivienda. El horario de trabajo de la tienda es de lunes a domingo de 08:00 a.m hasta las 05:00 p.m

El crédito será para comprar más productos para su tienda como por ejemplo: bebidas, golosinas, granos básicos, etc.

Fidelina, sueña con tener una vivienda digan, cómoda y segura.
texts.en:
Fidelina, who is 60 years old, went to school through third grade. She is now married. Her husband works in agriculture and tends a mill in their house. They have two children who live with their respective partners, since they are adults and have their own income.

Fidelina is the owner of a store that is located in her house. She has products of basic necessity for sale, such as beverages, basic grains, candies, etc. She set up the store on her own initiative because her house is located on the principal street of her canton and is in a central zone.

Her husband raises basic grains such as corn and beans. In addition, he tends a mill in their own house. The working hours for the store are from Monday to Sunday, from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm.

The loan will be used to buy more products for her store, such as beverages, candies, basic grains, etc.

Fidelina dreams of having a dignified, comfortable, and secure home.

loans.use: to buy more products for her store, such as beverages, candies, basic grains, etc.

loans.name: Habila

texts.en:
Habila is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Habila has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/ha, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Habila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Habila can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Habila will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha. Habila is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jaga Group

texts.en:
This Group was formed in the year 2015 at Balpadar village, in the Bolangir district of Odisha, India. There are 10 active independent women with an objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihood. All the members of the concerned group have their own professions and businesses. Padmabati is one of them who has taken a great role in her development and in the group members' source of revenue improvement.

She is standing as the third person from the left side with her hand raised in the photo. She is about 47 years old and living with her small family consisting of her husband and only one son. Her family has been engaged in a grocery shop for the last six years. The complete family together promoting their business. But through the concerned business, they earn a monthly income of 6,500 INR. Padmabati plans to improve her business over the course of the loan, which resulted in taking the loan. She will purchase rice, wheat, sugar, oil, tea, soap, detergent, shampoo, biscuits, snacks, potato, onions, salt, etc. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for the purchase of a house.
