The other nine members of her group are also smart at their professions and actively engaged in different businesses like vegetable vending, general store, animal trading, tent house, and furniture making and selling. With this loan, they hope to heighten their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase rice, wheat, sugar, oil, tea, soap, detergent, shampoo, biscuits, snacks, potato, onions, salt, etc.

loans.name: Herbert Enrique

texts.es: Herbert de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la venta de calcetines para niños y niñas vende de manera ambulante por los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 15 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas mercaderia por mayor para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Herbert is 49 years old and lives in his own home with his extended family.  He has made a living selling socks for boys and girls for 15 years.  He is a traveling salesman, and he travels through the different markets that are located close to his home.  He uses his profits to pay for some of the household expenses.  

He is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise wholesale in order to bring in more income.

loans.use: to buy boys' and girls' socks wholesale

loans.name: Sara Ismenia

texts.es:
Sara, de 34 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos niños que estudian, ella creció con sus padres trabajando en la agricultura (siembra de maíz y frijoles) ahora en día vive solo con sus hijos por quienes se esfuerza trabajando para darle lo necesario; ella estudio hasta noveno grado y no pudo seguir debido a la falta de apoyo.

Sara, se dedica a la crianza de pollos indios y de cerdos en pequeña escala, los cuales engorda y vende a buen precio en el tiangue.- Pero además trabaja en casa cuando las buscan a cuidar y en comedores de la comunidad para hacer sus ingresos y darles a sus hijos el estudio y la alimentación. 

Sara, necesita el crédito para comprar cinco cerdos y para comprar concentrado para la alimentación de los cerdos y de los pollos.

Sara, sueña con mejorar su vivienda y hacerla de adobe, porque actualmente es de bahareque.
texts.en:
Sara is a 34-year-old single mother.  She has two children who are in school.  She grew up doing farm work with her parents (growing corn and beans).  Now she just lives with her children, and she works hard to give them what they need.  She studied until the 9th grade, but wasn't able to continue her studies because of the lack of support.  

Sara makes a living through her small-scale operation raising large chickens and pigs, which she fattens and sells at a good price from her booth.  She also works in in community dining rooms and homes when she is sought for childcare so that she can bring in income and give her children food and education.

Sara needs a loan to buy five pigs and feed for the pigs and chickens.  

Sara's dream is to improve her home and make it out of adobe, since presently it is made of mud.

loans.use: to buy five pigs and feed for the pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Berta Noemi

texts.es:
Berta, de 44 años de edad, no pudo estudiar debido a que sus padres no tenían la capacidad económica para darle estudio, está casada y su esposo es agricultor, juntos tienen 4 hijos de los cuales la primera ya está casada y vive en otro lugar, la segunda que tiene 23 años, está estudiando tercer año de bachillerato contador, la tercera tiene 17 años y estudia 8° grado y el ultimo tiene 11 años y está estudiando 3° grado. 

Berta, se dedica a los oficios del hogar desde que era una niña, ya que al no poder estudiar tuvo que aprender varios oficios para poder desempeñarse día a día, ella realiza los quehaceres de la casa durante la mañana e inicia su jornada a las 5:00 a.m. cuando ella ha terminado todo se traslada al campo a trabajar la agricultura junto a su esposo para regresar a las 11:00 a.m. a preparar el alimento para cuando lleguen sus hijos de estudiar.

Berta, necesita el préstamo para comprar abono, pesticidas y fertilizantes, teniendo estos productos en su casa ella los podrá aplicar en el tiempo justo para asegurar una buena cosecha de granos y tener el alimento para su familia.

Ella desea que sus hijas e hijo puedan sacar una carrera universitaria, para que se puedan desempeñar como gente de bien en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Berta, who is 44 years old, did not go to school because her parents didn't have the economic capacity to give her an education. She is married and her husband is a farmer. Together they have four children, of whom the oldest daughter is already married and lives in another place; the second daughter is 23 and is in the third year of study to be an accountant; the third daughter is 17 and is in eighth grade; and the youngest, a son, is 11 years old and is in third grade.

Berta has done household tasks since she was a little girl. Since she wasn't able to go to school, she had to learn various skills in order to be able to work day after day. She does the household tasks during the morning, and she begins her work day at 5:00 am. When she has finished everything, she goes to the field to work in agriculture along with her husband in order to return at 11:00 am to prepare the food for when their children arrive from school.

Berta needs the loan to buy compost, pesticides, and fertilizers. By having these products at her house, she will be able to apply them at the right time to assure a good harvest of grains and have food for her family.

She wants her daughters and son to be able to get university degrees so that they can work as good people in the community.

loans.use: to buy compost, pesticides, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jaylaxmi Group

texts.en:
This Group was formed in the year 2015 at Bagpada village, Bolangir district, Odisha, India. There are 11 active independent women, with an objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihood. All the members of the concerned group have their own professions and businesses. Bhujeswari is one of them who has taken a great role in her development and the group members' source of revenue improvement. She is standing on the extreme right with her hand raised in the photo. She is about 21 years old and living with her husband.

Her family has been engaged in a grocery shop for the last four years. Complete family together promoting their business. But through the concerned business they earn a monthly income of 6,400 INR. Bhujeswari plans to improve her business over the course of the loan, which resulted in taking the loan and she will purchase rice, wheat, sugar, oil, tea, soap, detergent, shampoo, biscuits, snacks, potato, onions, salt, etc. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for her future need.

The other 10 members of her group are also smart at their professions and actively engaged in different business like vegetable vending, general store, animal trading, betel shop, tailoring and dairy. With this loan, they hope to heighten their livelihoods.

loans.use: will purchase Rice, wheat, sugar, oil, tea, soap, detergent, shampoo, biscuits, snacks, potato, onion, salt, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to be able to pay for the ACE cook stove, which will improve her life in terms of health, cost of fuel, and time spent collecting firewood.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en: Ayuba is a maize farmer from Dutse village. As a Babban Gona member, Ayuba is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 MT/ha, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Ayuba will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ayuba no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/ha, Ayuba hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mangala Group

texts.en:
This Group was formed in the year 2013 at Luthurbandh village in Bolangir district, Odisha, India. There are 10 active independent women with an objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihoods. All the members of the concerned group have their own professions and busineswss. Padmini is one of them who has taken a great role in her development and the group members' source of revenue improvement. She is seated on the extreme right with her hand raised in the photo. She is about 45 years old and living with her small family consisting of her husband and two sons.

Her family has been engaged in a dairy business for the last eight years. Complete family together promoting their business. But through the concerned business, they earn a monthly income of 6,000 INR. Padmini planned to improve her business over the course of loan. It will be the second loan for the group. With the loan, Padmini will purchase another two cows. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for her future needs.

The other nine members of her group are also smart at their professions and are actively engaged in different businesses like vegetable vending, grocery shop, tailoring, cosmetics and fancy store, seasonal business and cloth store. With this loan, they hope to increase their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase two cows.

loans.name: Dandela

texts.en:
Dandela is a maize farmer from Dutse village. As a Babban Gona member, Dandela is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 MT/Ha, which is 5.5 times that of an average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Dandela would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Dandela can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Dandela no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Dandela hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

Riziki has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan Riziki is requesting, she will purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Mesalim

texts.en:
Mesalim is a single mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past year, Mesalim has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that Mesalim is requesting of KES 10,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Usaini

texts.en:
Usaini is a maize farmer from Dutse village. As a Babban Gona member, he is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs which will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tons per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Usaini would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this 18,842 NGN loan and Babban Gona’s support, he will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season when he can obtain 37% more in profit than the harvest price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Usaini no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to 2000 USD per hectare, Usaini hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: store his maize harvest and delay its sale until a later date in order to make a bigger profit.

loans.name: Helson Bruno

texts.fr:
Helson est un cordonnier expérimenté. Il l'est depuis 1988. Pour commencer, il travaillait dans une entreprise  de fabrication de chaussures très célèbre pendant 5 ans. La crise politique de 1991 qui entrainait la rentrée massive des produits et fabrications chinois entraine ainsi la fermeture de cette entreprise, par conséquent, il devait trouver une activité source de revenu pour pouvoir continuer à entretenir sa famille. Et il a eu l'idée d'ouvrir son petit atelier. Il effectue des réparations et crée aussi des nouveaux modèles.
Helson est marié et sa femme est machiniste dans une entreprise de zone franche. Le couple a trois enfants et ils sont tous scolarisés. 
L'objectif d4elson est de bâtir une petite entreprise de fabrication de chaussures un jour  et d'employer quelques personnes.
texts.en:
Helson is an experienced cobbler, having worked in his trade in 1988. He used to work for a well-known shoe manufacturing company for five years. The political crisis of 1991, which caused a significant drop in customer demand, as well as an increase of imports from China eventually led to the company's closure. Helson was forced to find another source of income for supporting his family. He has decided to open his own small workshop. He does shoe repairs and also manufacturers new shoes.

Helso is married, and his wife works as an equipment operator in the tax-free zone. They have three children, all attending school. Nelson's goal is to  open a small shoe factory one day and be able to hire some employees.

loans.use: to buy soles, glue, imitation and real leather, fasteners, eyelets etc

loans.name: Nike Air Group

texts.en:
Sporah who is in her late 30's is single with three children,two of them are in school and other is grown up. She has been selling cosmetics for seven years now. She works from 08am to 08pm daily and is able to earn a small profit per monthly.

This will be Sporah's 8th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stock of cosmetics and has paid back all her loan successfully. She is so happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to repay a loan,reinvest in business, pay school fees and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to sell cosmetics wholesale price and as well as retail price to meet her customer requirements. She dreams of owning a cosmetics big business.

Sporah will share this loan with her loan group Nike Air which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: sell cosmetics at wholesale prices and as well as retail prices to meet her customer requirements.

loans.name: Jennymay

texts.en:
Jennymay is 27 years old and married with two children, one child still in school, Jennymay works very hard to provide for them.

Jennymay runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods etc.

Jennymay has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Jennymay would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods etc .

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married, and has seven  children. She has owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a fruit and coconuts selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenges  of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the Ksh 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for resale . She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for resale

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia  is a married mother of five children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over one year, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a married  mother of four children, three of whom attend school. She lives at her own  house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Sofia operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her villages. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding to increase her monthly income.

With the loan of Kes 40,000, she wants to purchase 25 sacks of charcoal for resale and pay for transport. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase 25 sacks of charcoal for resale and pay for transport

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en:
Lawal is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Lawal is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. Traditionally, Lawal would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Lawal will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Lawal now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is thirty nine years old. He is single and has no child. He is a laundry operator at La in the Greater Accra Region of Ghana and has been in the laundry business for twelve years. He usually buys water for the laundry services because there is no piped water in his house.

With this loan, Anthony will be able to connect a piped water system into his house for his laundry work. He is hopeful that his laundry business will expand and he will employ more helping hands in the next five years.

loans.use: to connect piped water to his house for his laundry business.

loans.name: Glenda Cecibel

texts.es:
Glenda, de 32 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios del hogar, con mucho esfuerzo pudo estudiar hasta 7° grado ya que sus padres no tenian los recursos económicos para poder darle mas estudios, actualmente esta casada su esposo se dedica a trabajar como agricultor, con el han procreado dos hijos quienes viven junto a ellos el primero tiene 13 años y estudia sexto grado el otro tiene 10 años y estudia 4° grado todos son una familia muy unida y trabajadora.

Glenda, se dedica a los oficios del hogar desde que era una niña aprendió este oficio de su madre, ya que cuando ella dejo los estudios se dedico a trabajar como domesticas y tomo mucha experiencia, actualmente tiene 3 años de tener a su cargo el cafetin del centro escolar de su comunidad, ella se levanta muy temprano para preparar todos los alimentos a vender en dicho lugar, tiene que estar lista a las 7:00 am cuando lleguen los alumnos y maestros para ofrecer su producto, en el negocio le ayudan sus hijos en el tiempo libre que ellos tienen.

Ella, necesita el crédito para comprar más mercadería para su negocio, ya que la demanda estudiantil es grande y ella no puede suplir todo lo que los niños y niñas están demandando día a día, teniendo el dinero en mano ella podrá comprar a un precio mas bajo el producto ya que lo ara al malloreo y tendrá mejores ingresos ya que habrá mas para ofrecer a los alumnos y maestros.

Ella desea poder tener otro cafetin fuera de la escuela donde vende para así tener mas ingresos de dinero y mejorar las ganancias con las cuales ella pretende darles el estudio a sus hijos para que puedan sacar una carrera universitaria, desea en un futuro poder hacer mas grande su vivienda para darles a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Glenda, 32, works as a homemaker. With a lot of effort, she was able to complete up until the 7th grade. Her parents did not have the financial resources to provide her with more education.

Currently, she is married. Her husband works as a farmer. They have two children who live with them. The first is 13 years old, and is in the 6th grade. The other is 10 years old, and is in the 4th grade. The entire family is very united and hardworking.

Glenda has been working on household duties since she was a child. She learned these skills from her mother. Since she left school, she worked as a domestic worker and gained a lot of experience.

For the past 3 years, she has been running the snack bar in the community school. She wakes up very early to prepare all of the food to sell there. She has to be ready at 7:00 am to offer her products when the students and teachers arrive. With this business, she can help her children during their free time.

She needs the loan to buy more merchandise for her business, since the demand among the students is large, and she cannot supply all that the boys and girls are requesting each day. With the money in hand, she can buy wholesale products at a lower price. She will have better earnings, since she will be have more to offer the students and teachers.

She would like to have another snack bar outside of the school, where she can sell and earn more. With the increased revenue, she will support her children's schooling so that they can earn a college degree. In the future, she would like to make her home larger, to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her business, such as sweets, beverages, and candy.

loans.name: Matiyu

texts.en:
Matiyu is a maize farmer from Dutse village. As a Babban Gona member, Matiyu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 MT/Ha, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Matiyu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs.

Matiyu will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Matiyu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Matiyu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a Babban Gona farmer.  Musa is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. Traditionally, Musa would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan Musa can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Musa has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha. Musa is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to increase his farmland and looks forward to using his additional earnings to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer from Dutse village. As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 MT/Ha, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs.

Ibrahim will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ibrahim no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Ibrahim hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Abdullahi

texts.en:
Abdullahi is a maize farmer from Dutse village. As a Babban Gona member, Abdullahi is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 MT/Ha, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Abdullahi would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs.

Abdullahi will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Abdullahi no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Abdullahi hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Sarita Emely

texts.es:
Sarita, es una joven madre soltera  de 2 hijos de 11 y 7 años edad, que actualmente se encuentran estudiando en la escuela, ella es una persona muy trabajadora tiene que trabajar mucho para darles lo necesario a sus dos hijos debido a que el padre de sus hijos la abandono por esta razón ella tiene que desempeñar los dos roles de padre y madre a la vez. Su nivel estudio es hasta sexto, grado debido a que como ella es una de los hermanas mayores tenía que ayudarles a trabajar en la elaboración de matates y hamacas junto a su s padres. Y también porque sus padres no contaban con los recursos económicos necesarios para que pudiera estudiar. Luego de eso optó por acompañarse y producto de esa relación tuvo sus dos hijos que viven con ella.
		 
Sarita, empieza su día muy temprano a las 5 de la mañana a preparar sus hijos para que puedan ir a la escuela y también a hacer algunos oficios domésticos en la casa luego de eso en el transcurso del día ella realiza su principal actividad que es trabajar en la artesanía en la elaboración de matates y hamacas de hilo; desde pequeña ella se ha dedicado a este trabajo  pues es una actividad de familia, sus padres se han dedicado  a este oficio desde hace muchos años atrás. 

Gracias al financiamiento anterior Sarita, logro superar sus expectativas gracias a que compro la materia prima para su negocio de elaboración de mátates y hamacas, sus ventas mejoraron  y también tuvo más cliente y hoy con este nuevo financiamiento   pretende invertirlo en la agricultura, ella necesita este préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como insecticidas, fertilizantes, y podrá pagar la mano de obra.

Sus sueños son muchos pero una de ellas poder ampliar más su negocio y colocar un local donde pueda emplear a personas que le ayuden a realizar los trabajos.
texts.en:
Sarita is a young single mother with two children, ages 11 and 17, who are currently going to school. She is a very hardworking person who needs to work a lot to give her children what they need. This is because the children's father abandoned her, and for this reason she must fulfill the roles of both father and mother at the same time.

She studied up to sixth grade because as one of the older sisters, she had to help her parents make grinding stones and hammocks. Also, her parents did not have the necessary financial resources for her to study. Afterwards, she entered a relationship from which she has her two sons who live with her.

Sarita begins her day very early, at 5 a.m., to prepare her children for school and to do some household chores. Throughout the day, she works on her business which is making handicrafts by producing grinding stones and thread hammocks. She has done this work since she was little because this is a family business. Her parents have worked in this business for many years.

Thanks to a previous loan, Sarita was able to exceed her expectations because she bought raw materials for her business to make grinding stones and hammocks. Her sales improved and she also had more clients.

With this new loan, she hopes to invest in agriculture. She needs this loan to buy agricultural inputs like insecticide, fertilizer, and to pay for labor.

She has many dreams, but one of them is to expand her business and get a shop where she can employ people to help her complete her tasks.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like insecticide, fertilizers, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Alh. Ado

texts.en:
Alhaji Ado is maize farmer from Aba Malam village. As a member of Kiva's field partner Babban Gona, he is excited about the opportunity to become a better and more profitable farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tons per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Ado would have had to sell his maize at harvest time, when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this 24,082 NGN loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Alhaji Ado is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

loans.name: Nety

texts.fr:
Nety est une femme énergique de 41 ans. Elle vit à la campagne avec son mari et ses 4 enfants. Elle exerce des activités de culture et d’élevage depuis 15 ans. Elle tient aussi une petite épicerie.
Elle est emprunteuse chez Vahatra depuis 3 ans. Les prêts précédents lui ont permis d’augmenter et de diversifier les produits à vendre dans l’épicerie, tandis que les bénéfices lui ont permis de cultiver toutes les terres et d’assurer les dépenses au quotidienne ainsi que la scolarisation des enfants. Ce prêt va lui permettre d’acheter 4 porcs et de la farine alimentaire. Elle connait déjà des bouchers prêts à acheter les porcs quand ils seront engraissés. 
Nety  a comme objectif d’avoir une grande ferme afin d'assurer une meilleure condition de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Nety is an energetic woman, 41 years old, and living in the countryside with her husband and four children. She has been working at farming and raising livestock for fifteen years. She also has a small grocery store.

She has been a borrower at Vahatra for three years. The previous loans have enabled her to increase and diversify the products she sells in the store, while the profits have enabled her to farm any land and to ensure her children’s day-to-day, as well as schooling, expenses are covered.

This loan will allow her to purchase 4 pigs and some feed. She already knew some butchers prepared to buy the pigs when the pigs are fattened. Nety’s goal is to have a big farm in order to ensure better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase 4 pigs to fatten and sell to butchers

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married with one child who is still too young to go to school. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past year Amina has operated a cosmetics shop from which she sells her wares, particularly to the women of her neighborhood and town. With a plan to boost her income, she joined Kiva's field partner Yehu to take advantage of the loans it offers.

Amina is now applying for a 20,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner Yehu to buy perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions. She dreams of seeing her business grow so as to meet more of her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions for her cosmetics shop.

loans.name: Chantale

texts.fr:
Chantale est une très jeune femme paysanne. Âgée de 22 ans, elle vit avec son mari et son enfant. Elle a hérité des terrains de ses parents et exerce toute sorte de culture et d’élevage.
Chantale a déjà eu quelques prêts successifs chez Vahatra avec lesquels elle a pu augmenter les surfaces à cultiver et le nombre de bétail à élever. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter un zébu qu’elle va engraisser et vendre au boucher. 
Elle espère gagner des bénéfices pour pouvoir constituer de l’épargne en vue de construire une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Chantale is a very young peasant woman, 22 years old, living with her husband and child. She inherited land from her parents and farms any sort of crops and raises any sort of livestock.

Chantale has already had a few successive loan at Vahatra with which she was able to increase her arable land and the number of animals to raise. With this loan, she intends to purchase a zébu, which she will fatten and sell to the butcher.

She hopes to earn profits in terms of save up money with the aim of building a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a zébu to fatten and sell to the butcher

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 6 pigs and some feed for them

loans.name: Vinton

texts.en:
Vinton founded Valhdla Entertainment in 2005. He has always had a love for music and entertainment. Through his business, Vinton aims to develop and expose unknown, talented musicians to larger audiences, and strives to increase a public interest in Miami’s music culture.

Vinton was born and raised in Miami, Florida, and his parents are natives of Haiti. His business currently staffs a team of three employees. His greatest success thus far has been the reputation he has built for his company. His business has been described as professional and consistent. Without proper funding, however, it has been difficult for Vinton to bring Valhdla Entertainment to the next level.

Vinton is seeking a loan to provide marketing and promotion tools needed to expose artists. He hopes to expand his company’s artistic output, as well as the quantity and quality of his company’s productions.

loans.use: to provide marketing and promotion tools needed to expose artists.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 56 years old. She is a widow and has three children between the ages of 28 and 32 years. She is a food vendor and has been selling food for 15 years.

Lucy is requesting this loan to connect piped water in her house. The piped water will be used at home and also to prepare the food she sells. She believes that her business will expand into a fast food joint in the year to come.

loans.use: to connect piped water into her house.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara is a maize farmer from Dan'asabe village. As a Babban Gona member, Hajara is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 MT/Ha, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hajara would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs. Hajara will use this loan to store the maize she harvests, enabling her to delay its sale until a later period in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37 percent higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Hajara no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Hajara hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ayuba is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ayuba will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season, when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Ayuba now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Fassoyiriwa Group

texts.fr: Moussa est celui qui tient le bélier .Il fait l’élevage d’ovin depuis 10 ans résidant au Mali. Il est marié et père de cinq (05) enfants qui sont âgés de 2 à 10 ans, dont un garçon  scolarisé.  Il sollicite le prêt dans le but d’acheter plus des animaux et aliments bétails pour son activité. Il fait ses achats et ventes  dans les foires hebdomadaires de sa zone. Son activité lui permet d’avoir un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000francs CFA pour couvrir les frais de scolarisation, la nourriture,  la santé et l’habillement  de ses enfants. Sa femme est une ménagère  et fait la culture d’arachide pour aider son mari. Moussa rêve d’avoir un jour la réussite dans sa famille. Les épidémies des animaux décourageaient Moussa, mais avec le prêt RMCR il arrive à faire les suivi vétérinaires.  Moussa aime l’élevage car c’est facile à pratiquer et la rentabilité est garantie.
texts.en:
Moussa is seen in the photo holding the goat. He lives in Mali and has been raising sheep and goats for ten years. He is married and has five children between the ages of two and ten years old. One of his sons attends school.

Moussa has requested this loan to buy more animals and feed for them. He buys and sells the goats at the local, weekly fair and earns 25,000 francs CFA profit each month. This pays for food, clothing, healthcare and schooling for his children. His wife looks after the family and home and grows peanuts to supplement her husband's income.

Moussa dreams of being successful so he can provide for his family. He has found it very discouraging to lose animals to disease but, thanks to loans from the field partner, RMCR, he can now pay for veterinary care. He enjoys raising livestock because it is easy and profits are guaranteed.

loans.use: to buy goats for resale.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Adjowa est une femme mariée avec quatre enfants à charge. Adjowa est âgée de 34 ans et vit à Tokoin où elle exerce son activité de restauratrice de riz et de la pâte bandée « Akpan ». Adjowa s’approvisionne du nécessaire servant à la préparation deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Adjowa sollicite ce crédit pour commander le sac de riz, des cartons de macaronis et des plateaux d’œufs en vue de bien vendre puis de gagner plus de bénéfices et de venir en aide à son mari aux besoins de la famille et d’améliorer les conditions de vie quotidiennes de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Adjowa is thirty-four years old, married and has four children in her care. She lives in Tokoin and prepares and sells rice and 'Akpan' (corn patties). She buys her supplies twice a month from the market and sells her food from the front of her home.

Adjowa has requested this loan to buy sacks of rice, boxes of macaroni and trays of eggs to make more food and increase her earnings. This will help her husband provide for the needs of their family and improve the living conditions of their children.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of rice, 2 boxes of macaroni and 4 trays of eggs.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Agée de 53 ans, Yawa est une femme mariée avec quatre enfants à charge. Yawa vit à Tokoin et est une revendeuse de balaies qu’elle achète deux fois par mois au marché et le revend de quartier en quartier et à domicile. Yawa sollicite ce crédit pour commander des unités de balaies à pied et ordinaire en vue de bien revendre puis avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants et à couvrir certaines charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Yawa is fifty-three years old, married and has four children in her care. She lives in Tokoin and sells brushes which she buys twice a month from the market. She sells the brushes on foot and from her home.

Yawa is requesting this loan to order various types of brush to increase her stock levels and allow her to sell more. Her increased earnings will help her husband provide for schooling for their children and enable Yawa to pay for certain day-to-day expenses for her family.

loans.use: to buy 250 units of assorted brushes.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi est une femme mariée dynamique qui vit à Tokoin  avec ses trois enfants  à charge. Ablavi est âgée de 39 ans et s’active parfaitement pour avoir une bonne situation financière. Ablavi est une revendeuse des chaussures qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend de quartier en quartier. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Ablavi  sollicite ce prêt pour commander des douzaines de chaussures en vue de bien revendre et de répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients et avoir une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Ablavi is thirty-nine years old, married and has three children in her care. She is a dynamic woman who lives in Tokoin and works hard to earn a good living. She sells shoes which she buys four times a month from the market and then sells on foot in the local area.

Ablavi is requesting this loan to order dozens of pairs of shoes to meet the demands of her customers and earn a good profit. This will help provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 4 dozen pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Ahoefa  Ablavi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Ahoefa est une femme âgée de 35 ans résidant à Tokoin. Ahoefa est une marchande  de produits d’alimentations générales et des céréales qui s’approvisionne de ses marchandises deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Ahoefa demande ce prêt pour commander des sacs de sucre et de riz puis des paniers de tomates fraîches en vue de mieux revendre et  d’en magasiné un grand nombre de stock puis maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari à promouvoir l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants et à subvenir aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées par sa famille.
texts.en:
Ahoefa is thirty-five years old, married and mother to two children. She lives in Tokoin and sells general food products and cereals. She buys her stock twice a month from the market and sells it from the front of her house.

Ahoefa is requesting this loan to order sacks of sugar and rice, and baskets of fresh tomatoes to increase her stock levels and maximise her profits. This will help her husband to provide for schooling for their children and pay for the day-to-day expenses of their family.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of sugar, 2 baskets of fresh tomatoes and 2 sacks of rice.

loans.name: Ayovi

texts.fr: Ayovi est une femme âgée de 35 ans résidant à Tokoin. Mariée, Ayovi vit avec ses trois enfants et son mari. Ayovi est une revendeuse  de chaussures qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et en circulant les quartiers environnant. Ayovi demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat des unités de chaussures fermées et des tapettes en vue de mieux revendre et de gagner des bénéfices afin de pouvoir aider son mari à bien prendre soin de leurs enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Ayovi is thirty-five years old, married and has three children. She lives with her family in Tokoin and sells shoes to earn a living. She buys her supplies twice a month from the market and sells them from her home and on foot in her local area.

Ayovi has requested this loan to buy more closed shoes and sandals to increase her profits. This will help her husband take care of their children and pay for schooling.

loans.use: to buy 25 pairs of sandals and 20 pairs of closed shoes.

loans.name: Meleane

texts.en: Meleane is a 68 year old mother with 3 children. She is still strong and fit to run her business of selling tuna sandwiches and toasted sandwiches in her community to earn a living, with the help of her children. Meleane requested for a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, boxes of canned tuna, plastic bags, containers, butter, to assist with the business. She will expand her business using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, box of fish canned(tuna), plastic bags, container, butter,

loans.name: Salomey

texts.en:
Salomey is 70 years old. She is married and has five children between the ages of 25 and 45 years old. She is a trader and has been selling for the past 25 years. Salomey also owns a house at La in the Greater Accra Region.

Her house lacks a basic toilet facility so she and her family use the commercial toilet in the community, which is not beneficial to them because of the distance and the queue they have to join before using it.

With this loan, she will be able to buy a biological toilet filter system and install it in her house. She is hopeful that this will enable her family to access the toilet at any time of the day without joining queues.

loans.use: To buy and install a biological toilet filter system in her house

loans.name: Juliette

texts.fr: Juliette est une femme mariée âgée de 32 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Mère de deux enfants, Juliette est une marchande des céréales qu’elle achète quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile pour gagner des revenus. Pour commander des bols de maïs et de farine de manioc, Juliette nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement en vue de bien revendre et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et mieux couvrir les frais scolaire de ses enfants dès cette rentrée.
texts.en:
Juliette is thirty-two years old, married and mother to two children. She lives in Tokoin and sells cereals. She buys her stock four times a month from the market and sells it from the front of her house.

Juliette is requesting this loan to buy bowls of maize and cassava flour to increase her sales and profits. This will help her provide for the needs of her family and pay for schooling costs for her children during this academic year.

loans.use: to buy 60 bowls of maize and 60 bowls of cassava flour.

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Dédé est une femme mariée dynamique qui vit à Tokoin  avec ses quatre enfants et son mari. Dédé est âgé de 47 ans et  s’active parfaitement  pour avoir une bonne situation financière. Dédé est une revendeuse de pagnes qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Dédé sollicite ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagnes de qualités moyenne et supérieure afin de répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière remarquable  pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Dédé is forty-seven years old, married and has four children. She is a dynamic woman who lives with her family in Tokoin. She earns a good living selling pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) and buys new supplies twice a month form the market. She sells the clothes on foot in her local area.

Dédé is requesting this loan to buy high-quality and medium-quality pagnes to meet the demands of her customers and increase her financial independence. This will help her to provide for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy 3 high quality pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) and 3 medium quality pagnes.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 27 years old, married and has two children, two of whom in school.

She is in the agricultural business  in the Philippines. Mary Joy requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mary Joy has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Jovie

texts.en:
Jovie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her buy and sell fish business.

Jovie has been in this business for 2 years. Jovie earns more income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Maria Gelisa

texts.en:
A single stick or even a bundle of ten sticks can easily be broken using one’s bare hands, but if it’s bundled like a broom as seen in the picture above, it cannot be broken. This is the main principle of people’s solidarity like in an organization or cooperative. “The people united will never be defeated” translates one famous Chilean song.  

This is the interesting parallelism of Maria Gelisa’s product – the broom or broomstick. She sells both soft brooms and hard brooms then she combines it with dustpans. Soft broom is usually made of dried rice hays while hard broom is made of dried palm leaves. She delivers it by order and also displays it outside their house located in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. 

Maria Gelisa’s husband, Nilo, works as a driver but his income doesn’t suffice for their daily needs. Hence she hopes to augment it by producing more brooms and expanding her market. She will buy more raw materials in making brooms with the aid of PHP 20,000 loan from kindhearted lenders like you. If her current business prospers as she plans, she will start another business, probably fish vending or hog fattening. She’s looking forward to fulfilling her dream of renovating their house and enjoying a better living condition someday.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            

She is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials in making brooms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Hamoudi Group

texts.en:
Ritam is the featured borrower of Hamoudi group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been close friends, and they work hard to develop their businesses and families living.

Ritam is a 39-year-old married mother of five children, who is employed in a tailoring factory for thirty years and at the same time she has her own tailoring business at home providing this services to near by ladies seeking their own type of clothes.
Her acquired loan will be invested in buying a specialized tailoring machine to update and develop her business properly, and in a faster way.

Ritam is the lady standing at the far right side of the picture with red top. As for the other group members, Fatima is at the center, whiles Zeinab is the lady at the far left side of the picture.

loans.use: to buy a specialized tailoring machine to update and develop her business properly.

loans.name: Habila

texts.en:
Habila is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Habila has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Habila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Habila can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Habila will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Habila is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Ma. Marichu

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Ma. Marichu works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Ma. Marichu is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Ma. Marichu has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is 53 years old. She is married and has a thirty two year old son. Vida is a hairdresser and a Landlady at La in the Greater Accra Region. She has done the hairdressing business for thirty years.

As a result of high cost of water in the community, Vida is requesting for this loan to connect a piped water to her house. The piped water will be beneficial for domestic use and will also help her to access water in her salon.This will help her to manage her home.

loans.use: to connect piped water to her house.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Direct selling business is common in the Philippines especially for housewives who want to be productive and are willing to supplement the lack of family resources. Working people who want to earn extra money usually engage in this business also. It’s easy to venture into direct selling business since it typically requires low capital to begin with. Then the entrepreneur or direct selling representative will just enhance the business by expanding her network of target consumers and proper rolling of capital.

Lilia, 58, from Davao City is a direct selling representative who sells personal care products such as food supplements, toiletries, intimate apparels, shoes and bags. While her husband, Demetrio, nurtures their small farm. Their children are already grown-up and starting their own families. Hence Lilia can focus her attention to improving her direct selling business. She wants to avail of PHP 29,000 loan to buy more supplies of personal care products. Hopefully it will lead to increased sale and profit that she can save for her retirement. In the Philippines, self-employed workers like her have no pension or medical insurance so they just rely on their own savings and assistance from their children.

She desires for a good future for her children and harmonious relationship among her family members. She prays that all of them will become believers of Christ. She regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business. There she can draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of personal care products such as food supplements, toiletries, intimate apparel, shoes and bags.

loans.name: Barau

texts.en:
Barau is maize farmer from Bawa Wambai village. As a member of Babban Gona, Barau is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. Before joining Babban Gona, Barau would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Barau can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Barau is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is 23 years old, married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like rice, sardines, soap, etc. to sell.

Aiza has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like rice, sardines, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Maria, está muy feliz de que su negocio ha prosperado enormemente gracias al crédito obtenido anteriormente de KIVA junto a MiCrédito. Poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante junto al apoyo de su hija.  Doña Maria está muy agradecida con el préstamo anterior es por esta razón que solicita un nuevo préstamo para que le ayude a abastecerse de nueva mercadería y comprar variedad de cosméticos. De esta manera lograra ofertar mayor cantidad a sus clientes y obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria is very happy that her business has prospered enormously thanks to the previously received loan from Kiva together with MiCredito. Little by little she has managed to get ahead with the support of her daughter. Maria is very grateful for the previous loan, and it is for this reason that she ask for a new loan, which will help her to stock up on new merchandise and to buy an assortment of cosmetics. In this way, she will be able to supply a larger amount to her clients and obtain a better income.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of cosmetics.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, una madre soltera de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, es madre soltera de 3 hijos  dos van a la escuela y uno tiene pocos meses de edad.

María, se dedica a cuidar los hijos de su hermana y le paga una cuota mensual; junto con su hermana han decidido cultivar una parte de terreno que tienen disponible, aprovechando la época lluviosa, involucrando a todos sus hijos en las actividades agrícolas, luego que salen de la escuela.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como, semilla, fertilizantes y productos fito-sanitarios, para controlar las malezas, plagas y enfermedades del cultivo.

María, quiere mejorar su vivienda, cultivar sus propios alimentos y encontrar un trabajo más estable.
texts.en:
Maria, 29, has a third grade education, is single and has three children; two attend school and the youngest is only a few months old.

Maria takes care of her sister's children for which she receives a monthly payment.  She and her sister have to decided to plant crops on part of the land they own, taking advantage of the rainy season and involving all their children in the farm activities after school.

The loan Maria is requesting is needed to buy farm supplies such as seed, fertilizers and plant protection products to control weeds, insects and crop disease.

Maria wants to improve her home, raise her own crops and find stable work.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and plant protection products to control weeds, insects and crop disease.

loans.name: Los Pagadores  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De  Crédito Los Pagadores, este es un grupo formado por 9 mujeres y 2 hombres los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, prestación de servicios entre otras actividades. Ellos decidieron unirse  para acceder a los créditos que brinda la  institución.
Uno de los socios de este grupo es don Sigifredo, tiene 56 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, una hija vive al lado de su casa pero ya es independiente. Su esposa es ama de casa.
El señor Sigifredo es un hombre muy trabajador que  ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, el tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de víveres, carnes, frutas, legumbres, aguas en bidón,  gaseosas, helados, entre otros productos  de primera necesidad. El siempre trata de comprar mayor variedad de productos y esto le ha ayudado a ganar más clientela en los 4 años que tiene su tienda, el espera ahora con la ayuda de los créditos aumentar la variedad de productos para así poco a poco mejorar su local y sus ganancias que le permitan ganarse la vida .
Este crédito es para comprar más variedad de víveres para así ganar más clientela. Este es su primer ciclo en el Grupo De  Crédito y espera seguir por muchos años contando con la ayuda del grupo y de las personas que les colaboran con los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
Every 15 days the members of the community bank Los Pagadores meet in the city of Portoviejo.  The group comprises nine women and two men who work in different business activities such as general commerce, services and others.  They decided to join together to have access to the loans offered by the institution.

One of the members of the group is Sigifredo, 56, who is married and has four adult children.  One of his daughters lives at home although she is independent.  His wife is a homemaker.

Sigifredo is a very hard working man who has been able to provide for his family.  He runs a grocery store at home where he sells all kinds of groceries, meats, fruits, legumes, bottled water, sodas, ice cream and other essential items.  He always tries to buy a wide variety of products which has helped him grow his customer base over the four years he has been in business.  Now he hopes that with the loan he can increase he stock even more so he can improve the store little by little and earn more income.

This loan will be used to buy a wider variety of groceries to attract more customers.  This is his first loan cycle in the community bank and he hopes to be have the support of the group and people making loans, for a long time.  His dream is to continue his work and improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosario is 43 years old and has three children who are in school.

Rosario has a broom-making business in the Philippines. Rosario requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed such as bamboo sticks, etc.

Rosario has been in this business for five years. In the future, Rosario would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed such as bamboo sticks, etc.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 68 years old and married with 15 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Nelly has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

Nelly has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Nelly would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is 44 years old and has seven children. Venus is married and three of her children are in school.

Venus is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Venus requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Venus has been in this business for four years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Venus would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Cherill

texts.en:
Cherill is 33 years old and married with three children. With all three children in school, Cherill works very hard to provide for them.

Cherill runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk food, home care products, and other groceries.

Cherill has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, biscuits, junk food, coffee and other groceries.

In the future, Cherill would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk food, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Ana Elida

texts.es:
Melida, de 32 años de edad, estudio solo primer grado, debido a la falta de un centro de estudio que estuviera cerca del lugar donde vive no pudo continuar sus estudios, está casada y su esposo se dedica a trabajar en la siembra de granos básicos como maíz frijol y maicillo, es madre de 4 hijos los cuales estudian y aún viven con ella en su hogar. 

Melida, desde que era joven ayudaba a sus padres a fertilizar que es la actividad que mas ayuda a realizar; aprendió esta actividad ya que siempre iba al campo con sus padres fue así como ella aprendió este trabajo, es la única actividad que tiene y de su casa a donde trabaja le queda a 15 minutos y se traslada a pie.

Melida, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para sus cultivos como fertilizantes, herbicidas y pagar mano de obra que ayude a su esposo a realizar los trabajos. 

Los sueños de ella son, que sus hijos salgan adelante academicamente.
texts.en:
Melida, 32, only has a first grade education because there was no school close to her home and she had to quit.  She is married and her husband grows basic grains such as corn, beans and millet.  She has four children who attend school and still live at home.

Melida used to help her parents fertilize when she was young so it is what she has most experience in.  She always accompanied her parents to the fields and learned about it this way.  It is the only thing she takes care of, walking 15 minutes to the cropland.

Melida needs a loan to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, herbicides and hire workers to help her husband with certain jobs.

Her dream is for her children to progress academically.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her crops, such as fertilizers, herbicides and hire workers.

loans.name: Angel Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 37 años de edad, esta soltera, se dedica a los oficios domesticos tiene 4 hijos, estudio hasta octavo grado de educacion basica; es madre soltera tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales tres viven con ella y dependen de ella y la otra hija ya esta acompañada nadie mas vive con ella, solamente sus hijos dependen de ella.

Maria, tiene un negocio de tamales; lo ha hecho por mas de quince años y lo aprendio trabajando para otra persona y decidio hacerlo para buscar un ingreso economico mejor par asustituir a sus hijos ya que ella es madre y padre, antes era empleada.

Maria, necesita el préstamo para comprar productos para la elaboracion de tamales, hace de elote de pollo y de frijoles, le mejorar mucho su ocndicion porque sera propio su negocio y no se limitara, porque tendra como cubrir la demanda.

Sus sueños son seguir trabjando lo mejor que pueda para poder darle estudio y un mejor futuro a sus hijos y ampliar su negocio de tamales.
texts.en:
Maria, 37, is a single homemaker with four children.  She has a basic 8th grade education.  Three of her children live are in her care at home while the other daughter lives with her partner.  Maria has no other dependents.

Her business is selling tamales which she has been doing for over 15 years.  She learned from someone else and decided to earn an income this way to help support her children, since she is both mother and father to them.  She used to work as a domestic employee.

Maria is in need of a loan to buy products to make chicken and bean tamales.  This will help her situation as it is her own business and she will have to meet the demand alone.

Her dream is to continue working and expanding her business so she can give her children a better future.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make tamales.

loans.name: Erlis Esmeralda

texts.es:
Erlis, tiene 31 años, esta acompañada, tiene un hijo, estudio hasta noveno grado de educacion basica esta acompañada su pareja trabaja como empleados de seguridad; su hijos vive con ellos; esta estudiando, nadie mas vive con ella, solamente dependen dos personas de ella.

Erlis, tiene un negocio de ganado bovino de repasto; lo a hecho por mas de siete años y lo aprendio de sus padres y decidio hacerlo para buscar un ingreso economico que le premitiera cubrir los gastos del hogar. También recibe remesas de Estados Unidos antes, solo se dedicaba a oficios domesticos.

Erlis, necesita el préstamo para comprar ganando de repasto bovino, le mejorara su negocio ya que podra tener mas ganado y esto permitira obtener mejores ganancias y tener mejor calidad de vida, y se siente satisfecha poruqe con el prestamo puede comprar lo que necesita par aseguir trabajando.

Sus useños son seguir trabajando lo mejro que se pueda para poder  darle un mejro futuro a su hijo y poder ayudarle a sus padres y elprestamo le ayduara a lograr sus sueños y con las ganancias invertirlas en un 50% para sui negocio y un 50% para ir pagando la deuda.
texts.en:
Erlis, 31, is married and has a son.  She completed a basic ninth grade education and her husband works in security.  Her son lives at home and is her only dependent.

Erlis raises cattle and has been in business for over seven years.  She learned the trade from her parents and decided to earn her own income this way to cover household expenses.  She also receives money from the United States.  Before she worked as a domestic employee.

The loan Erlis needs is to buy grazing cattle.  This will improve her business as she will have more cattle and be able to earn more income and improve her lilfestyle.  She is content because through the loan she can buy what she needs to continue working.

Her dream is to continue working so she can give her son a better future.  She also wants to help her parents.  The loan will help her reach her goals.  She will invest 50% of her earnings in the business and use the other 50% to pay back the loan.

loans.use: To buy grazing cattle.

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru: Молодая талантливая 26 летняя девушка Латофат. Она замужем и мать одного маленького сына. Муж занимается торговлей деятельности. Латофат из района Вахш. У нее золотые руки. Она печет вкусные печенье, торты и пироги. Латофат печет и продает их в магазине, у них еще имеется магазин. Ее муж продает ее печенье, торты и пироги. Латофат хочет приобрести бытовую технику для выпечки и изготовление тесто. Они стоят очень дорого, по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом, потому что у нее нет такая денежных средств. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет Латофат расширить деятельность.
texts.en:
This young and talented 26-year-old woman is Latofat. She is married and has one young son. Her husband has a retail business. Latofat is from the Vakhsh area. She is good with her hands. She bakes delicious pastries, cakes, and pies. Latofat bakes and sells her goods in a shop, and they have another shop. Her husband sells her pastries, cakes, and pies. 

Latofat wants to purchase household appliances for baking and producing dough. These appliances cost a lot of money, and thus she has applied for a loan because she does not have such funds. The requested loan will help Latofat to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy household appliances.

loans.name: Sarvinoz
