texts.ru: Эту женщину зовут Сарвиноз. Сарвиноз из района под названием Вахш. У нее имеется один сын и две дочери. Муж Сарвиноз занимается мастером по ремонту домов. Он трудолюбивый и заботливый человек. Сарвиноз тоже имеет работу и постоянный доход. Она на часть магазина продает продукт питания, а на другой части продает одежды. Сарвиноз хочет расширить свой магазин. Иметь больше продукт питания и одежды на продажу. Она решила взять кредит и за счет кредита собирается перевозить товар. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей достичь своих целей.
texts.en:
This woman is Sarvinoz. Sarvinoz is from the Vakhsh area. She has one son and two daughters. Sarvinoz's husband works as a home repairs expert. He is a hardworking and caring person. Sarvinoz also has a job and a steady income. She sells food products in part of a shop, and in the other part she sells clothes. 

Sarvinoz wants to expand her shop and have more food products and clothes for sale. She has decided to take a loan, and with the loan she intends to transport merchandise. The requested loan will help her to reach her goals.

loans.use: to transport food products and clothes for sale.

loans.name: Urinsa

texts.ru: Уринса успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива, использовав его по назначению. На сегодняшний день у нее есть 3 коровы, 10 овец. На 1,08 Га собственной земли выращивает кукурузу, пшеницу, чеснок. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет 14,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Urinsa has successfully repaid her loan, having used it as specified. She is thankful to Kiva. Today she has three cows and ten sheep. On her own 1.08-hectare plot of land, she cultivates corn, wheat, and garlic. Her monthly income is about 14,000 som (KGS). 

With the view of further developing her business, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) in order to buy two cows. She plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Kudratullo

texts.ru: Кудратулло начинающий бизнесмен. Он честный, веселый, заботливый и трудолюбивый отец. У него трое дочери. Жена домохозяйка. Кудратулло живет в районе Фархор. В районе многие жители занимаются сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Некоторые выращивает растение, а многие выращивает скота. Жители района Фархор трудолюбивые, они любят трудиться и зарабатывать честно нажитым трудом. Кудратулло хочет заниматься животноводством у себя во дворе. Он решил, построит коровник для скота, и потом сразу начать новый деятельность. За счет кредит он хочет купить скота и для купли стройматериалы. Он надеется на Вас.
texts.en:
Kudratullo is just starting out as a businessman. He is an honest, cheerful, caring, and hardworking father. He has three daughters. His wife is a homemaker. 

Kudratullo lives in the Farkhor area. There are many residents in the area who farm for a living. Some cultivate crops, and many rear livestock. The residents of Farkhor area and hardworking, and they love to work and earn an honest living. 

Kudratullo wants to breed livestock in his yard. He has decided to build a barn for the livestock, and then immediately start his new business. With the loan, he intends to buy livestock and building materials. He is relying on you.

loans.use: to buy livestock, and building materials (boards and slate) for a barn.

loans.name: Shaarkan

texts.ru: Шааркан, 54 года, вдова, мать 2 дочерей и 3 сыновей. Шааркан в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается сельским хозяйством. Стартовав в 1998 году, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Шааркан есть 4 коровы, 20 овец, лошадь. На участке мерою 0,86 Га Шааркан выращивает пшеницу, чеснок и кукурузу для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль- около 22,000 сомов (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойное содержание семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров для увеличения поголовья скота, что позволит улучшить благосостояние семьи. Доходы от кредита Шааркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Shaarkan is 54 years old, widowed, and has two daughters and three sons. Shaarkan is engaged in farming as the primary source of income for her family. Having started in 1998, today on her farm Shaarkan has four cows, twenty sheep, and a horse. On a land plot of 0.86 hectares Shaarkan cultivates wheat, garlic, and corn for sale. Her monthly income is about 22,000 som (KGS). This amount is not enough to adequately support her family. 

With the view of further developing her business, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) in order to buy two cows to increase her herd, which will enable her to improve the well-being of her family. Shaarkan plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy two cows in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Ernabeth

texts.en:
Ernabeth is 32 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ernabeth has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Ernabeth has been in this business for four years. In the future, Ernabeth would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 41 years old and married with three children who are in school. She works hard to provide for her family.

She has been running a general store in the Philippines for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Rosalinda has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, biscuits and shampoo to sell. She has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan.

She aspires to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, biscuits and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 58 years old and married with two children. With one of her children in school, Wilma works very hard to provide for them.

Wilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Wilma has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Wilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is 60 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Adelfa has been running a general store in the Philippines for eight years. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, milk, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, eggs and shampoo to sell.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items including canned goods, milk, noodles and spices to sell.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 57 years old, and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and has been in this business for three years. Salvacion requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

In the future, Salvacion would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Grazel

texts.en:
Grazel is 44 years old and married with five children, three of whom are currently in school. Grazel works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, milk, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, eggs and shampoo to sell.

In the future, Grazel would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items including canned goods, milk, noodles and spices to sell.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 52 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Nilda has been running a general store in the Philippines for three years, and also earns an income from selling food. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, home care products and and other groceries.

Nilda aspires to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Musa has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Musa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Musa can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Musa will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Musa is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. He is anticipating a good harvest this season, with yields of up to 8MT/ha, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Haruna can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Haruna will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. 

Haruna is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
This is Cristina’s small general store that sells snack items, coffee, bread, canned goods, rice, frozen foods, and beverages. Aside from these, she also sells cooked foods. She maximizes her cooking talent, and even the limited space in front of her store becomes useful. This is where she displays the cooked food, packed into individual servings for sale. This is more practical for her as she doesn’t need to maintain a big space for customers to eat, or eating utensils and equipment, or dishwashers or food servers. 

Her regular customers are her neighbors, the local community, students and working people. The profit derived from her business helps a lot in her family's daily expenditure but she still needs to save a lot for her children’s education. She’s planning to cook more meals and enhance the selection in her store. She prays for PHP 25,000 additional capital which she can use to buy raw ingredients for new recipes, additional snack items, frozen foods, and sacks of rice. She knocks at your compassionate heart - may you be a blessing to her.

Cristina is assisted by her husband and business partner, Romo. They aspire to someday be capable of helping others financially. 

She gains inspiration from her co-fellowship members at CCT who regularly meet every week to reflect of God’s Words and share stories about life and their businesses. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for new recipes, additional snack items, frozen foods, and sacks of rice.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Herminia works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by selling food. Herminia is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Herminia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Salisu

texts.en:
Salisu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Salisu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8MT/ha, 4 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. Traditionally, Salisu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Salisu will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize - up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/ha, Salisu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abdullashi

texts.en:
Abdullashi is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Abdullashi is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8MT/ha, four times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. Traditionally, Abdullashi would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdullashi will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize - up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/ha, Abdullashi now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her toy store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new screen printing machine.

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en: Amadu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Amadu is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. Traditionally, Amadu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Amadu will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Amadu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Hermie

texts.en:
Take a look at Hermie’s small internet cafe with adjacent store located in Polomolok, South Cotabato. She decided to put up this business to augment her husband Rosalino’s income as a common employee. Educational expenses of their three children in college and high school are bloating, therefore her profit is quite helpful in covering some of her family’s needs. She can also help internet users who cannot afford a monthly internet subscription. Many of them are students who need to do research on their school assignments, families with members abroad who long to see each other through Skype, and those bored individuals who want to play online games. She is shooting two birds with one stone because she sells commodities while watching over her internet café.

This time, she has an urgent need to buy some computer parts and pay for its maintenance. She seeks your generous assistance in the amount of PHP 20,000 for this purpose. Part of the loan will be used to procure additional groceries, drinks, and sacks of rice for her store. This will ensure a higher profit for her so she can continuously support their daily expenditures and the educational expenses of her children. She is doing all these efforts to give her children a brighter future. She gives importance to happiness and unity in her family.

She is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy some computer parts and pay for its maintenance; plus buy groceries, drinks, and sacks of rice for her store.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is glad that she can sustain her small store through the previous loan granted to her. She is thanking KIVA and its supporters for helping small businesswomen like her. Her earnings helps cover her family's daily sustenance.

She is again humbly asking for a 19,000 PHP loan to buy more grocery items like rice, canned goods, coffee, powdered milk, chocolate and instant noodles which she sells in her general store. It is best that her store has essential food items to attract more customers. She trusts that you will consider her request.

Miriam's simple dream is for her store to grow so she could help her children have a house of their own. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and beverages to sell at her store.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Mary Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling food. Mary Ann is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like coffee, milk and sardines to sell in her general store.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like coffee, milk and sardines to sell.

loans.name: Haladu

texts.en: Haladu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Haladu is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. Traditionally, Haladu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Haladu will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Haladu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Bedia

texts.en:
Bedia is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Bedia is 50 years old and three of her children are presently in school.

Bedia has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. Bedia requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts, gasoline and maintenance for her motorcycle.

Bedia has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, gasoline and maintanance for her motorcycle

loans.name: Srikandi 1 Group

texts.en:
Together with her husband, who is a farmer, Ni Nyoman has been raising piglets to supplement the family's income. After six months of raising piglets, Ni Nyoman sells them and makes a profit of 500,000 IDR per month. These profits are certainly very useful for families and can help them pay for their daily needs and repay loans. Although the price of pig’s feed is currently expensive, Ni Nyoman has a passion for developing her business with the group she leads.

After having successfully repaid the previous loan, the Srikandi 1 group decided to continue the loan, with each member getting 3,500,000 IDR. She is optimistic her business will run smoothly, and has the full support of her husband as it is considered beneficial to the family income.

Ni Nyoman will use this loan to buy two superior piglets for fattening and open a new business, a small kiosk in front of her house. She will sell snacks for kids and also daily necessities. Ni Nyoman is hoping to gain more profit with her two businesses.

One member of the Srikandi 1 group is not pictured because of illness.

loans.use: to buy two superior piglets and open a small kiosk.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 50 years old and married. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jessica has a business selling fish in the Philippines, and has been in this business for 12 years. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

In the future, Jessica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling frozen products business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like hotdogs, tocino, etc. to sell.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like hotdogs and tocino to sell.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 57 years old and widowed with seven children. With one of her children in school, Catalina works very hard to provide for them.

Catalina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Catalina has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Catalina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Carren Joy

texts.en:
Carren Joy is 37 years old and married with four children, three of whom are presently in school. Carren joy works very hard to provide for them.

Carren Joy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy item to sell like canned goods, milk, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, eggs, shampoo, detergent, etc.

Carren Joy has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Carren Joy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, eggs, shampoo, and detergent

loans.name: Elsa Luz

texts.es:
Elsa, tiene 31 años de edad esta casada, y tiene dos hijos, estudio hasta octavo grado de educacion basica, su esposo trabaja en venta de electrodomesticos, de sus dos hijos solo uno vive ocn ella y esta estudiando, el otro vive con el abuelo, nadie mas vive con ella, solamente dos personas dependen de ella.

Elsa, tiene negocio de venta de cosmeticos; lo a hecho por un año y lo aprendio de una hermana y decidio hacerlo para bucat un ingreso economico y no depender del esposo, tambien hace tamales y pupusas, el fin de semana antes era empleada, el negocio de las lociones se traslada a venderlas ella hasta los lugares donde ya tiene clientes.

Elsa, necesita el dinero para comprar mas prodcutos de belleza y si le alcanza tambien va invertir en la venta de tamales y pupusas, para generar mayor ganancia.

Sus useños son poder trabajar muy fuerte para poder darle una mejro vida y futuro a su familia y desea poder ampliar su negocio de cosmeticos y el prestamo le ayudara a lograr sus sueños, porque las ganancias las utilizara para ir pagando y asi responder a la deuda excelente y tener siempre buen record crediticio, pues no piensa quedarse hasta aqui, sino seguir sacando mas creditos para seguir aumentando el negocio.
texts.en:
Elsa is 31-years-old, is married, and has two children. She studied through the 8th grade of elementary school. Her husband works selling electronic appliances. Of her two children, only one lives with her and is studying, the other lives with grandpa. Nobody else lives with her, only two people depend on her.

Elsa has a cosmetics sales business. She built it in a year and learned it from her sister. She decided to do it in order to earn income and to not depend on her husband. Also she makes tamales and pupusas. The weekend before she was in business, the lotions business began selling through locations where she already has customers.

Elsa needs money to purchase more beauty products and, once accomplished, she also is going to invest in the sale of tamales and pupusas in order to improve her income.

Her dream is to work very hard in order to be able to give herself a better life and future for her family. She wants to be able to grow her cosmetics business. The loan will help her to achieve her dreams because her earnings will be used to pay, and thereby excellently service, the debt and to always maintain a good credit record. She does not intend to remain here, but to continue taking on more loans in order to continue growing the business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Nonovi  Damegou

texts.fr: Nonovi est âgée de 49 ans et est une femme mariée. Nonovi vit avec ses trois enfants à charge  à Tokoin où elle vend à la devanture de son domicile des produits d’alimentations générales à ses clients. Nonovi s’approvisionne huit fois par mois au marché et désire ce crédit pour commander le bidon d’huile et des sacs de sucre puis de riz en vue de bien revendre et de gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour ainsi promouvoir l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants et bien réorganiser son activité.
texts.en: Nonovi is a 49 year-old married woman. She lives with her three dependant children in Tokoin, where she sells groceries to her customers in front of her house. Nonovi gets her supplies eight times a month from the market and would like this loan to be able to order a container of oil and sacks of sugar and rice to resell, so she can make a good profit margin and thereby provide for her children's education and reorganise her business.

loans.use: to buy a container of oil, a sack of sugar and a sack of rice.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois enfants, Abla est une femme âgée de 40 ans habitant à Tonkoin. Abla est une revendeuse des pagnes qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois  au marché et le revend sous un hangar au bord de la route. Pour ce fait, Abla sollicite ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagne en vue de bien rendre et de gagner une marge bénéficiaire qui servira à venir en aide à son mari pour soutenir les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: Abla is a 40 year-old married woman who is mother to three children and lives in Tonkoin. She sells "pagnes" (typical West African brightly colored pieces of fabric) and gets her supplies twice a month from the market. She resells her pagnes from a shed on the side of the road. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy pagnes and resell them so she can earn a good profit. This profit will be used to help her husband with the family's daily outgoings.

loans.use: to buy 12 pieces of "pagne" fabric.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 20 years old with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Christine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Christine has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Christine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Darlene

texts.en:
Darlene is a single woman who is 19 years old with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Darlene has a buy and sell of gasoline business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 4,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more gallons of gasoline to sell.

Darlene has been in this business for one year. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Sepopo

texts.fr: Mère de quatre enfants, Sepopo est une femme mariée âgée de 28 ans résidant à Tokoin. Sepopo  est une marchande de produits d’alimentations générales qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend dans sa propre boutique à domicile pour gagner des revenus. Sepopo désire ce prêt pour commander des cartons de macaronis, de tomates et de savons. Avec le bénéfice qui en résultera suite à une bonne vente, Sepopo va pouvoir aider son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation scolaire à leurs enfants.
texts.en: Sepopo is a 28-year old married woman, who is mother to four children and lives in Tokoin. Sepopo sells groceries and gets her supplies three times a month from the market. She resells them in her own shop to generate some income. Sepopo would like this loan to be able to order cartons of macaroni, tomatoes and soaps. With the profit she makes from good sales, she will be able to help out her husband with the family's expenses and ensure a good education for their children.

loans.use: to buy six cartons of macaroni, nine cartons of tomatoes and nine cartons of soaps.

loans.name: Reyna De La Paz

texts.es:
Reyna, de 56 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos, esta compañada estudio hasta segundo grado de educacion basica, esta acompañado, su pareja trabaja la agricultura y con ganado bovino, tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales solamente uno vive con ella los otros estan acompañados y ya tienen su propia familia, nadie mas vive con ella solamente dos personas dependen de ella.

Reyna, trabaja la agricultura; lo ha hecho por mas de treinta años y lo aprendio de sus padres decidio hacerlo para obtener grandos basicos para la alimentacion de su familia, tambien trabaja con ganado y recibe remesas, nates solo trabjaba la agricultura.

Reyna, necesita el dinero para comprar insumos agricolas, le mejorar mucho ya que podra obtener granos basicos para su familia y se siente satisfecha porque con el prestamo pudo comprar lo que necesita para sus cultivos.

Sus sueños osn seguir trabjando lo mejor que se puede para tener mejro futuro y no depender delos hijos; el prestamo le ayudara mucho para lograr sus sueños y con as ganancias ira pagando el prestamo porque tambien es muy repsonsable poruqe de esta forma puede seguir trabajando con creditos.
texts.en:
Reyna is 56 years old. This borrower has 4 children. She went to school up to the second grade of primary school. She is married and her spouse works in agriculture and with cattle. She has four children and only one of them lives with her and the other ones are married and have their own families. Just two people live with her and depend on her.

Reyna works in agriculture. She has done this for thirty years and she learned it from her parents. She decided to do it to obtain basic grains to feed her family. She also works with cattle and receives remittances. Previously, she only worked in agriculture.

Reyna needs the money to buy agricultural materials. It will improve things for her a lot since she will be able to obtain basic grains for her family. She feels satisfied because with the loan she was able to buy what she needs for her crops.

Her dream is to keep working as best she can to have a better future and not depend on her children. The loan will help her a lot to achieve her dream. With the profits, she will pay off the loan because she is also very responsible, as this way she can continue working with the loans.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials.

loans.name: Kelvi Paul

texts.es:
Kelvi Paul con 25 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge, en casa familiar, en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú en una zona rural. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

kelvi Paul se dedica a las actividad de servicio de transporte (mototaxi), con más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio, presta este servicio en los alrededores de Cayalti. Solicita préstamo para el arreglo de su vehículo menor, dicha inversión le servirá para poder brindar un mejor servicio a los pasajeros.

Kelvi Paul es socio recurrente en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa ,con dos créditos anteriores los cuáles fueron cancelados de manera correcta. .
texts.en:
Kelvi Paul is 25 years old. He is in a common law marriage and lives with his spouse in the family home on the district of Cayaltí, province of Chiclayo, department of Lambayeque, in Peru, in a rural area. The residents of the area mostly work in agriculture, trade and livestock.

Kelvi Paul works in the activity of transportation service (motorcycle taxi). He has more than 3 years of experience in the business. He offers this in the areas around Cayalti. He is asking for this loan to fix his small vehicle. This activity will help him offer a better service to the passengers.

Kelvi Paul is a returning client of our institution, Edpyme Alternativa , with two previous loans which were properly paid off.

loans.use: to pay for repairs and maintenance of his vehicle, which is currently in poor condition.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa con 532 años de edad, de estado civil madre soltera, vive en casa de familiares, vive junto a su mamá e hija, en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia Chiclayo, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Teresa se dedica a la venta de alimentos preparados y golosinas en exterior de Colegio de varones de Cayaltí, desde hace más de 30 años. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como aptos y pollos.Se solicita préstamo para invertir en compra de golosinas para negocio, de esta manera crecerá su ingreso familiar, vivirá cómodamente y mejorará su calidad de vida de él y la de su entorno familiar.
texts.en:
Teresa is 52 years old. She is a single mother and lives in a relative's house. She lives with her mother and daughter in the district of Cayaltí, Chiclayo province, department of Cajamarca, in Peru. The residents of this locality mostly work in trade, agriculture and ranching.

Teresa has sold prepared food and snacks outside the Cayalti's boys' high school for more than 30 years. In addition, she raises and sells farmyard animals such as ducks and chickens. She is asking for the loan to buy snacks for her business. This way, her family income will grow, she will live comfortably, and improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in buying snacks for her business.

loans.name: Diana Marcela

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer con 18 años de edad, dedicada a la cría y  venta de ganado bovino, un negocio que  lo inicio por necesidad económica y del que obtiene muy buenos ingresos.
Trabaja todos los días durante 6 horas.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de ganado porcino y cuido de levante para los mismos.
La actividad que realiza esta mujer para sobrevivir con los suyos es digna de aplausos y la hacen merecedora la ayuda que solicita.
texts.en:
Diana is an 18 year old woman. She raises and sells cattle, a business she started out of financial necessity and with it she obtains very good income.

She works every day for 6 hours.

She is asking for a loan to invest in buying pigs and to raise them.

The activity this woman does to survive with her loved ones is worthy of applause, and it makes her worthy of the help she is asking for.

loans.use: to buy pigs and raise them.

loans.name: Yrianne

texts.en:
Yrianne is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Yrianne has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 32 years old and has two children. She is married and her two children are currently in school.

Emma is in the agricultural business, raising chicken in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her chickens.

Emma has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed one time.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her chickens.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a single woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 29 years old and has one child in school.

Emily has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Emily has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 48 years old and married with one child; she works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, eggs, shampoo, detergent, etc.

Jocelyn has been in this business for one year.

In the future, she would like to save money to provide and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, eggs, shampoo, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Srikandi 2 Group

texts.en:
Finally, the Srikandi 2 group has made their payment to MUK. We heard many stories from the field; most of them were successful in breeding the pigs. The pigs grew well and were disease-free. when they sold the pigs they were satisfied with the price, and the group earns some profit.

Ni Nengah also raised pigs for fattening. After five months, she sold the pigs. She says thank you to all the lenders, Kiva and MUK for the support. Now she can improve her income and support her husband. Ni Nengah has a dream to renew her house when the profit enough to do that. That’s why she saving from now.

After a successful paying off the last loans, they proceed to the next period with the purpose of improving their businesses.

Ni Nengah coordinates members in the purchase of piglets so that all members get good piglets.

With the loan, she bought local type of piglets for pig barbecue; they are sold every two months. From the results of this effort, she hopes to buy floors for her home, since they are still cement.

loans.use: to purchase a local type of piglets for pig barbeque.

loans.name: Maria Dora

texts.es:
Dora es una señora con 61 años de edad, dedicada a realizar actividades de campo desde hace 5 años, luego de que su esposo, quien era el sostén del hogar, se marchara.
Es dueña de un gran cultivo el cual le genera muy buenos ingresos.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas como insecticidas, fertilizantes y abonos.
Sus deseos de salir adelante son admirables, pese a su edad, los esfuerzos no disminuyen, quiere seguir luchando hasta cumplir el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su casa, ya que el estado actual de esta no es el mejor.
Con su aporte esta mujer podrá hacer realidad sus sueños, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Dora is a 61-year-old woman, who has worked doing rural jobs for 5 years, since her husband, who sustained the household, left.

She is the owner of a large cultivated area which generates very good income.

She is asking for a loan which she will invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies such as insecticides, fertilizers, and manure.

Her desire to get ahead are admirable. Despite her age, her efforts don't lessen. She wants to continue struggling until she realizes her dream of improving the condition of her house, since its current state is not the best.

With your contribution, this woman will be able to make her dreams come true. Come on, make a loan.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as insecticides, fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane, 39, is a married woman with three children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Mary Jane has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Mary Jane requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets, and other fishing supplies.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is a married woman, 44 years old, with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jenalyn has a buy and sell beverages business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Jenalyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more beverages to sell at her stall.

She would like to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more beverages to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ana works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from rice farming.

Ana is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Ana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Natali Del Carmen

texts.es:
Natali es una mujer con 32 años de edad, trabajadora y muy humilde, ella vende mercancía desde hace tres años, un negocio que lo inicio por necesidad económica y del cual se generan buenos ingresos.
Con el fin de aumentar su inventario, esta mujer solicita un préstamo para poder comprar mercancía como productos de aseo, perfumes, ropa, calzado y también una vitrina.
Sueña con poder brindarle a sus hijos una mejor estabilidad económica y excelente calidad de vida.
Anímese, usted poder ser parte de estos sueños, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Natali is a 31-year-old woman who is hard-working and very modest. She's been selling merchandise for 3 years now. She started this business out of finanacial need and it generates a good income.

In order to increase her inventory, this woman is requesting a loan so she can buy merchandise, such as personal hygiene products, perfumes, clothing, shoes and also a display case.

She dreams of being able to provide her children with greater financial stability and an excellent quality of life.

You can be a part of these dreams. Go ahead and make her a loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as personal hygiene products, perfumes, clothing, shoes and also a display case.

loans.name: Jonhy Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander es un hombre soltero con 20 años de edad, trabajador y muy humilde, dedicado a la cría y venta de ganado bovino, un negocio que le ha ayudado a superar la dura situación económica, la cual vivió luego de quedar sin empleo por varios meses.
Los obstáculos que se le han  presentado no han sido impedimento para querer salir adelante y cumplir sus proyectos.
Trabaja con un fin, el de tener algún día su casa propia y brindarle a sus padres una mejor estabilidad económica.
Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de terneras y cuido de engorde para las mismas.
Con esto espera aumentar sus ventas y de tal manera sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Alexander is a single man, 20 years old, hard-working and very humble, who works raising and selling cattle, a business that has helped him to overcome the very difficult economic situation which he experienced after being without work for several months.

The obstacles which have come up have not been an impediment to wanting to get ahead and achieve his plans.

He works with a goal of having his own house someday and offering his parents better economic stability.

Currently he is asking for a loan which he will invest in the purchase of calves and fattening feed for them.

With this, he expects to increase his sales and, in this way, his earnings.

loans.use: to purchase calves and fattening feed for them.

loans.name: Paola Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea es una mujer con 33 años de edad, humilde y muy trabajadora, dedicada a realizar labores de campo desde muy pequeña, actividad que aprendió gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre, quien se dedicaba a lo mismo.
Con esto ha tenido un gran avance, actualmente le pertenece un gran cultivo de café, el cual le genera muy buenos ingresos.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de insumos para su cultivo como lo es fertilizantes, insecticidas y funguicidas.
Su meta es continuar trabajando hasta cumplir el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda pero principalmente poder pagar la educación de sus hijos.
Para esto cuenta con la ayuda de Interactuar y los prestamistas del portal Kiva.
texts.en:
Andrea is a 33-year-old woman, humble and very hard-working who has worked doing rural jobs since she was very little. She learned this work thanks to her father's instruction, who did the same work.

With this, she has advanced a lot; currently she owns a large coffee crop which generates very good income.

She is asking for a loan which she will invest in the purchase of supplies for her crop such as fertilizers, insecticides and fungicides.

Her goal is to continue working until she realizes her dream of improving her house but primarily to be able to pay for her children's education. For this, she has the help of Interactuar and the lenders through the Kiva portal.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her crops such as fertilizers, insecticides and fungicides.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena, 31, is a married woman. She has six children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lorena has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Lorena requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

In the future, Lorena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Arlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a welding shop.

Arlyn is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Arlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, 50, is a married woman with seven children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jocelyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Nader Jose

texts.es:
Nader es un hombre con 28 años de edad, desde hace tres años monto su propio negocio, un taller de mecánica ubicado el municipio San Pedro de Urabá.
Con esto obtiene los ingresos necesarios para cubrir sus necesidades.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos para motos al por mayor y mejorara el aspecto físico del local.
Su sueño es formalizar su negocio y que en un futuro pertenezca a sus hijos.
Usted poder ser parte de los sueños de este hombre, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Nader is a 28-year-old man who three years ago established his own business, a mechanic shop located in the municipality of San Pedro de Urabá.

With this, he gets the needed income to cover his needs.

He is asking for a loan which he will invest in the purchase of motorcycle parts in bulk and will improve the physical appearance of the space.

His dream is to register his business and that in the future it will belong to his children.

You can be part of this man's dreams. Come on, make a loan.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle parts in bulk and to improve the physical appearance of the space.

loans.name: Paclibar

texts.en:
Paclibar is 34 years old and married. She has three children, and two children are currently in school. Paclibar works very hard to provide for them.

Paclibar runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Paclibar requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy item to sell like canned goods, milk, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, eggs, shampoo, detergent, etc.

In the future Paclibar would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, eggs, shampoo, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Yuris Paola

texts.es:
Yuris es una señora con 27 años de edad, dedicada a vender mercancía desde su casa, un negocio que lo inicio por necesidad económica y del que cual obtiene buenos ingresos.
Actualmente Yuris cuenta con muy poco surtido, esto hace que sus ventas no sean las mejores. Con el fin de aumentar su inventario, esta mujer solicita un préstamo para poder comprar mercancía como ropa, lociones cremas y otros.
Quiere seguir trabajando hasta cumplir el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda pero principalmente poder pagar la educación de sus hijos.
Para esto cuenta con la ayuda de Interactuar y los prestamistas del portal Kiva.
texts.en:
Yuris is a 27-year-old woman who sells merchandise from her home. She started this business out of financial necessity and gets a good income from it.

Currently, Yuris has a very limited selection, which means that her sales are not the best. With the goal of increasing her inventory, this woman is requesting a loan to be able to buy merchandise, such as clothing, lotions, creams and other products.

She wants to continue working until she can make the dream of improving her living conditions come true, but first and foremost, she wants to be able to pay for her children's education.

To do this, she is depending on the help of Interactuar and the lenders on the Kiva portal.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as clothing, lotions, creams and other products.

loans.name: Jhon Jairo

texts.es:
Jairo es un hombre soltero con 32 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos menores de edad y vive en el municipio San Pedro de Urabá.
Es un hombre trabajador y humilde dedicado a realizar labores de campo desde muy niño, una actividad que aprendió viendo a sus padres.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos como fertilizantes, insecticidas, abonos y otros.
Su meta es continuar trabajando hasta cumplir el sueño de pagar la educación de sus hijos, pues su bienestar le preocupa.
texts.en:
Jairo is a single man, 32 years old, who has four children who are minors and he lives in the municipality of San Pedro de Urabá.

He is a hard-working and humble man, who has worked doing the jobs of the countryside since he was a little boy, work that he learned by watching his parents.

He is asking for a loan to purchase supplies such as fertilizers, insecticides, manure, and more.

His goal is to continue working until he achieves his dream of paying for his children's education, since he is concerned for their well-being.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as fertilizers, insecticides, manure and more.

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en:
Gemalyn is encouraged that she accessed loans in the past and has never failed to pay on time. Those loans have certainly helped sustain her store and thus helped in their daily sustenance. She is thankful that two of her children are now working and one of them is now in college.

Once again she needs funds in the amount of 50,000 PHP to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, canned goods, instant noodles, soda, and toiletries, which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income for the last 27 years and has sustained her family's basic needs. Her earnings help a lot in sending her child to college. Although there are times she encounters difficulty collecting her receivables, she maintains her faith that better days are ahead.

Gemalyn's simple dream is to own a big grocery store someday. She prays for God to bless her children abundantly. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from her religion, which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie is 40 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Girlie works very hard to provide for them.

Girlie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like candies, canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, noodles, detergent soap, etc. to sell. Girlie has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Girlie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like candies, canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, noodles, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli is 50 years old, married, and has four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Arceli has been farming rice for four years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice grains.

Arceli is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille, 44, is a married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lucille has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Lucille requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Salome is 38 years old now.

Salome has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell. Salome has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Salome would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Ma. Jacquelen

texts.en:
Ma. Jacquelen is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Jacquelen is 40 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Ma. Jacquelen has a food processing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk and other materials for her food production. Ma. Jacquelen has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk and other materials for her food production

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 33 years old and married with four children, two children are still in school. Maribel works very hard to provide for them.

Maribel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy item to sell like canned goods, milk, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, eggs, shampoo, detergent, etc. Maribel has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future Maribel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, eggs, shampoo, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Shamelyn

texts.en:
Shamelyn is 27 years old and is a married woman with two children. One of her children is in school. For the past two years, Shamelyn has run a food vending business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Shamelyn is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as eggs and flour. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as eggs and flour

loans.name: Rosine

texts.en:
Rosine is a 41-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is still in school. For the past 10 years, she has run a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. Rosine is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rosine is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy beans, banana, squash, carrots, and other vegetables and fruits to sell. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy beans, banana, squash, carrots and other vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 46 years old and married with five children. For the past six years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal and rice. Nenita works hard to provide for her family.

Nenita is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy item to sell such as canned goods, milk, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, eggs, shampoo, detergent and other products. This will be her second loan from NWTF. Nenita aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, milk, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, eggs, shampoo, detergent and other products

loans.name: Jose Lubisney

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre con 47 años de edad, dedicado a la cría y venta de ganado porcino y bovino, un negocio que lo inicio por necesidad económica y del cual hoy en día se generan los mejores ingresos.
Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de cerdos, alimento y vacunas para los mismos.
Su meta es continuar trabajando hasta cumplir el sueño de tener su casa propia y brindarle  a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
Las actividades que realiza este hombre para sobrevivir con los suyos son dignas de aplausos y lo hacen merecedor de la ayuda que solicita.
texts.en:
Jose is a 47 year old man dedicated to raising and selling pigs and cattle, a business that he started due to economic need and which today generates the best income.

Currently he is requesting a loan which will be invested in the purchase of pigs and food and vaccines for the pigs.

His goal is to continue working until he achieves his dream of having his own house and providing his family with better economic stability.

The work this man performs to survive with his family is worthy of applause and makes him deserving of the help he is requesting.

loans.use: to buy pigs and food and vaccines for the pigs.

loans.name: Ever Jose

texts.es:
Ever es un señor con 38 años de edad, casado y con cinco hijos menores de edad. Se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado bovino, un negocio que lo inicio por necesidad económica y del cual se generan muy buenos ingresos.
Con el propósito de mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes e incrementar su utilidad, solicita un préstamo para la compra de cinco cerdos, alimento para los mismos y hará unas mejoras a las marraneras.
Su mayor sueño es poder pagar la educación de sus hijos, pues su bienestar le preocupa.
Con su aporte este hombre invertirá en un mejor futuro para su familia, anímese, preste hoy.
texts.en:
Ever is a 38 year old man. He is married with five young children. He is dedicated to raising and selling cattle, a business that he began out of economic need and from which he earns a very good income.

With the purpose of improving his sales, expanding his customer base and increasing his usefulness, he is requesting a loan to buy five pigs, food for the pigs and to make some improvements to the pigsties.

His biggest dream is to be able to pay for the education of his children for their wellbeing concerns him.

With your support, this man will invest in a better future for his family. Go ahead, lend today.

loans.use: to buy five pigs, food for the pigs and to make some improvements to the pigsties.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 45 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are presently in school. Rosalie works very hard to provide for them. For the past five years, she has run a general store in the Philippines.

Rosalie is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, milk, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, eggs, shampoo, detergent and other products. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, milk, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, eggs, shampoo, detergent and other products

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi est une femme mariée qui vit à Tokoin et ayant trois enfants à charge. Agée de 46 ans, Ablavi ²est une marchande de produits de beauté et de chaussures qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend dans sa boutique à domicile. Ablavi sollicite ce crédit pour commander des unités de mèches et de chaussures en vue de bien revendre puis tirer un maximum de profit afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et améliorer leur condition de vie quotidienne.
texts.en:
Ablavi is a married woman who lives in Tokoin, raising three children. Aged 46, Ablavi sells beauty products and shoes. She replenishes her inventory twice a month at the market and resells her goods in her little shop in her home.

Ablavi is requesting this loan to order some hair extensions and shoes so that she can resell them and make the maximum in profit so as to be able to cover the needs of her children and improve their day-to-day living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 40 hair extensions and 35 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: La

texts.en:
La is 21 years old, a single freshman who is from the Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. Currently, he is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in English literature at a university in the city. His family are the rice farmers and they totally depend on farming as revenue, which make it hard to pay for his tuition fees. La has decided to take out a loan because he is short of the money to cover his university fees from the first to the fourth year.

This loan will help him in earning a bachelor’s degree successfully. After graduation, he dreams of having a proper job with a reasonable salary and he also wants to save money to build his own house and if he gets children he wants his children to study to pursue bachelor's degrees

loans.use: to cover his university fees in English Literature from the first to the fourth year.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia es una señora con 40 años de edad, tiene tres hijos una de ellos ya mayor de edad. Su deseo es montar su primer negocio, quiere dedicarse a la venta de pollos y huevos, pero como no cuenta con un buen capital, aún no ha podido. Es por esto que solicita un crédito con el cual ajustara para el montaje de los galpones y la compra de pollo y cuido.
Su mayor anhelo es continuar trabajando hasta cumplir el sueño de tener su casa propia y brindarle a sus hijos una mejor estabilidad económica.
Sabe que con la ayuda de Interactuar y los prestamistas del portal Kiva sus sueños se cumplirán.
texts.en:
Patricia is a 40 year old woman. She has three children. One of them is an adult. Her wish is to start her first business. She wishes to dedicate herself to selling chicken and eggs but since she doesn't have enough capital she has not been able to do this yet. So, she is requesting a loan with which she will adjust for the assembly of the sheds and to pay for chicken and care.

Her biggest goal is to keep working until she achieves her dream of having her own house and to provide her children with better economic stability.

She knows that with the help of Interactuar and the lenders of the Kiva portal she will achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to adjust for the assembly of the sheds and to pay for chicken and care.

loans.name: Saudith Del Carmen

texts.es:
Saudith es una señora con 30 años de edad, dedicada a vender mercancía desde su casa, un negocio que le genera buenos ingresos y además le permite estar al pendiente de sus hijos.
Actualmente esta mujer tiene muchos pedidos, pero como no cuenta con mucho capital de trabajo no ha podido cumplir con ellos. Es por esto que solicita un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de mercancía como lo es ropa, calzado, lociones, cremas y otros.
Su mayor  sueño es formalizar su negocio y que en un futuro pertenezca  a sus hijos, pues son el motor que impulsan a esta mujer para seguir luchando.
Su actitud positiva y los deseos de salir adelante permiten ver en esta mujer unas ganas inmensas de superarse y por supuesto una respuesta favorable a su petición.
texts.en:
Saudith is a 30-year-old woman who sells merchandise from her home, a business that generates good income and also lets her be with her children.

Currently, this women has many orders, but since she doesn't have very much working capital, she has not been able to fulfill them. It is for this reason that she is requesting a loan which she will invest in the purchase of merchandise like clothes, shoes, lotions, creams and more.

Her greatest dream is to formalize her business, and that in the future it belong to her children since they are the motor that drives this woman to keep fighting.

Her positive attitude and hope to create a better life show this woman's immense desire to better herself, and of course, a favorable answer to her request.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like clothes, shoes, lotions, creams and more.

loans.name: Asmahan

texts.en:
Asmahan is a 44-year-old married mother of two children, who works hard supporting her husband to provide her family with a better living.
Asmahan works in providing cleaning services in a Dispensary for eleven years.
Since her income combined with her husband's are set for daily living expenses. Asmahan is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her son's university  tuition fees.
She hopes to stay in good health and improve her family's living.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition fees.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 25-year-old, single man from Dier Al-Balah city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Because the economic situation in Gaza is not good, A few years ago, Bilal started his own business. He manages a stall selling shoes.

This is the only source of income for the family. Bilal took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy a collection of men's shoes for his stall. This will increase his sales and also his income. Bilal appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a collection of men's shoes  for his stall.

loans.name: Reygen

texts.en:
Reygen is single and is a a graduating student. Her mother has owned and managed her grocery store for many years. But the income earned by her mother cannot fully support the needs of Reygen's school fees. Reygen is asking for financial support to pay for her tuition fee and decided to avail the loan. Recently, she took a loan for her purpose of paying her school fees in order to take the examination.

Reygen's plan for the future is to save more money and to finish her studies, so that she can help her mother in working for profit in order to improved their living condition.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee

loans.name: Sos Nema 2 Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le quatre juin 2010. C'est un groupe de femmes qui développent l'activité commerciale. Madame Maimouna qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de vingt neuf ans et mère de sept enfants dont quatre filles. Elle s'active dans la vente de légumes et de fruits depuis plus de trois ans. Elle compte, avec le montant sollicité, acheter une quantité importante de légumes( oignon, carotte, choux, bissap,etc.). Elle a une bonne connaissance du marché et elle arrive à sans sortir facilement. Les bénéfices vont servir à aider son mari dans l'éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois was inaugurated on June 4, 2010. It's a group of women who are developing their small businesses. Madame Maimouna, who is on the right in the photo raising her hand, is the group representative. She is married, aged 29 years old, and the mother of seven children, of whom four are daughters. She has been selling fruit and vegetables for over three years.

With the loan she requested, Madame Maimouna intends to buy a large quantity of vegetables (onions, carrots, cabbages, hibiscus flowers, etc.) She has a good understanding of the market and she is able to manage easily. The profits will allow her to help her husband with the education of their children.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Never Give Up - N06P12Đsơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Dục is 59 years old and she is married. She has had a retail business selling dry food and general things for 5 years. Dục lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
The main hardship that Dục faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase milk, cakes, candies... to resell.

Dục joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Since then, her income has been increased significantly. Dục has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

She is the group leader of "Never give up - N06P12ĐSơn", which consists of four members.
In the future, Dục hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase milk, cakes, candies and other food items to resell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 60 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell tobacco in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of tobacco to sell.

Cecilia has been in this business for 30 years.

In the future Cecilia would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of tobacco to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is married and has a buy and sell herbal medicine business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of herbal medicine to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of herbal medicine to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Carmelita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grain business in the Philippines. Carmelita is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grain to sell.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grain to sell.

loans.name: Hermes Francisco

texts.es:
Hermes es un hombre con 42 años de edad, desde hace poco monto su propio negocio, un pequeño restaurante en un local arrendado por un familiar, sus ventas siempre han sido muy buenas, pero últimamente debido al poco surtido y la competencia en el sector estas han bajado  mucho. Su propósito es ampliar el local y abastecer más su negocio, es por esto que solicita un préstamo, con el cual ajustara y hará la remodelación que quiere.
Su mayor sueño es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y brindarle a sus hijos un buen futuro.
Sabe que con la ayuda de Interactuar y los prestamistas de Kiva sus sueños se lograran.
texts.en:
Hermes, 42, has recently set up his own business, a little restaurant in a place rented by a family member. His sales have always been very good, but lately they've gone down a lot due to the few choices and the competition.

He intends to expand his place of business and stock it better. This is why he is requesting the loan, he will use it to do the adjustments and remodeling that he wants.

His greatest dream is to improve the conditions in his home and offer his children a good future. He knows that he can reach his dreams with the support of Interactuar and the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand his place of business and stock it better.

loans.name: Telmo Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso es un hombre casado con 65 años de edad, dedicado a la venta de pollo y huevos en el municipio de Támesis, con este negocio obtiene muy buenos ingresos, con los cuales logra cubrir las necesidades que su hogar amerita.
Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de pollos, alimento para los mismos y adecuara unos galpones que los tiene sin uso.
Su mayor sueño es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y brindarle a su esposa una mejor estabilidad económica.
Usted poder ser parte de los sueños de este hombre, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Alfonso is a married man who is 65 years old, dedicated to selling chicken and eggs in the town of Tamesis. With this business, he earns very good income with which he manages to pay for his home's needs.

Currently, he is requesting a loan which will be invested in the purchase of chicken, chicken feed and to adapt some sheds that are not being used.

His biggest dream is to improve his home's condition and to provide his wife with better economic stability.

You can be part of this man's dreams. Go ahead, make a loan.

loans.use: to buy chickens, chicken feed and to adapt some sheds that he has that are not being used.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is a maize farmer from Duna village. As a Babban Gona member, Timothy is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 MT/Ha, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Timothy would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs.

Timothy will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.
