Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Timothy no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Timothy hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ourocaal Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le vingt huit décembre 2011. Ce groupe est composé de six femmes qui exercent le commerce, se soutiennent solidairement et prennent des prêts  qu'elles remboursent à temps. Madame Rosalie qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est veuve, âgée de soixante années et mère de six enfants dont quatre filles. Elle s'active dans la pâtisserie et la couture. Elle compte acheter avec le prêt sollicité un sac de farine, un bidon d'huile de vingt litres, cinq kilogrammes de beurre, un paquet levure de cent sachets, un carton de dix sachets sucre glace, elle achète deux  rouleaux de tissus et les produits pour la teinture.  Les bénéfices vont servir à la réfection de sa maison.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois was inaugurated on December 28, 2011. This group is made up of six women who are all in business, who support each other in solidarity and take out loans that they reimburse on time.

Madame Rosalie who is on the right in the photo, raising her hand, is the group representative. She is a widow, aged 60, and the mother of six children, four of whom are daughters. She works at making pastries and sewing. With the loan she has requested, she intends to buy a sack of flour, a jerrycan of 20 liters if oil, five kilos of butter, a box of yeast containing 100 envelopes, and a carton of 10 bags of icing sugar. She will buy two rolls of cloth and products needed for dyeing. The profits will allow her to refurbish her home.

loans.use: to buy cloth and ingredients for making pastries.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is an industrious woman. She is married with six children and is from the rural town of Pilar, Bohol. Her oldest child is 21, while the youngest is 8 years old.

She engages in a sand and gravel business. Her husband earns a living by means of farming. He grows and sells rice.

For the past 15 years, Perla has been into the sand and gravel business and caters to locals in her place. She would like to improve her earnings by acquiring more supplies to cope with the demand.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP to purchase more stock of sand and gravel.

In the future, Perla is determined that through your support she could help improve the family's living conditions and be able to support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of  sand and gravel.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana is able to sustain her mini store through the loans granted to her by KIVA and its supporters. The income generated by her store covers their daily personal and household needs.

To compete with nearby stores she is requesting a 19000 PHP loan to buy and refill her store with essential items such as rice, coffee, powdered milk and chocolate, biscuits, cooking oil, eggs, soda, instant noodles, bread and household items. Having a more complete selection of food and household items is a plus factor for people to come and buy at her store. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income for the last five years.

Feliciana's simple dream is to have a bigger store and see her children finish college. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa is a single woman, 25 years old, with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Vanessa has a food vending business in the Philippines. Vanessa requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, cooking oil, bamboo sticks, charcoal and other materials for her food production.

Vanessa has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save money to provide a secure for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, cooking oil, bamboo sticks, charcoal and other materials for her food production.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Perla is 51 years old, and has one child still in school.

Perla has a buying and selling of vegetables business in the Philippines. Perla requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more food and vegetables like bananas, coconut, beans, spices, carrots, etc., to sell in her local market.

Perla has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more food and vegetables like bananas, coconuts, beans, spices, carrots, etc., to sell in her local market.

loans.name: Noverlyn

texts.en:
Noverlyn is 26 years old, married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of daily-use goods to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Noverlyn has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from fish vending.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of daily-use goods to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Perfecta

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Perfecta works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell tobacco business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Perfecta is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase additional tobacco to sell for her business.

Perfecta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional tobacco to sell

loans.name: Tsetsgee

texts.en:
Mrs. Tsetsgee, 37 years old, lives with her husband, son and mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling casual clothes to local people by renting a stall at a trade center. Her husband renders taxi service to local people. Her mother has a position as a bookkeeper at a hotel.

Before the clothes sales business, she and her husband had worked in Korea on an employment contract.

She is requesting a loan of $2,000 USD to buy clothes in a large quantity so that she can run her clothes sales business without worrying about inventory shortage.

loans.use: to buy clothes in a large quantity.

loans.name: Silvana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Silvana es una señora con 34 años de edad, junto a su ex esposo monto un negocio, una salsamentaría en un local arrendado por un familiar. Por diversas situaciones Silvana se separó de su esposo, es desde allí que el negocio no funciona igual, pues era el quien en su totalidad se encargaba de este.
Sus ventas han bajado mucho y su clientela es poca, con el fin de mejorar esto Silvana solicita un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, harina, aceite, snack, bebidas y con lo otro le dará un mejor aspecto físico a su local.
Su mayor sueño es mejorar las condiciones de su casa y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
Sabe que con la ayuda de Interactuar y los colaboradores del portal Kiva sus sueños se harán realidad.
texts.en:
Silvana is a 34 year old woman. Along with her ex husband, she started a business, a deli, from a shop rented from a family member. For different reasons, Silvana separated from her husband. From that point, the business did not function the same since it was he who was in charge of everything.

Her sales have diminished a lot and she has few customers. With the goal of improving this, Silvana is requesting a loan which will be invested in the purchase of maize, flour, oil, snacks, drinks and to make improvements to this shop.

Her biggest dream is to improve the conditions of her house and to have better economic stability.

She knows that with the help of Interactuar and the collaborators from the Kiva portal, she will make her dreams a reality.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of maize, flour, oil, snacks, drinks and with the rest make improvements to his shop.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 41 years old and married.

Roselyn is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Roselyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Roselyn has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Roselyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 58 years old and married with three children. With one child still in school, Thelma works very hard to provide for the family.

Thelma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods, etc.

Thelma has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Thelma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna works hard to support her family. Digna is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Digna requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Digna has been in this business for 16 years now.

Digna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Jessie works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.

Jessie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables and fruits like squash, potatoes, beans, radishes, eggplant, bananas, etc., to sell in her store.

Jessie has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables and fruits like squash, potatoes, beans, radishes, eggplant, bananas, etc., to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 41 years old and married with three children who are in school. Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, personal care products, etc.

Rowena has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 35 years old and married with five children, four of whom attend school. Roselyn works very hard to provide for them.

Roselyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, egg, noodles, etc.

Roselyn has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, egg, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Nak's Group

texts.en:
A farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Nak is 53 years old. She has two dependent children, one of whom is still in school.

Nak has been growing rice to earn the main source of income for 35 years. She sometimes works for others for a fee to earn supplemental income. She earns around USD17 and can save around USD10 each day. The challenge in her rice farming is to harvest lower outputs from the rice farm when it is threatened by drought.

She leads a group of three members to apply for a new loan, which will be her second time with VisionFund. The past loan has helped her improve her living standards and send her child to school.
As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to increase crop yields. Moreover, she will use some of her loan to buy organic pesticide, too.

She hopes that she can earn more income to buy an additional plot of farmland and support her child’s studies.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to increase crop yields so that she can support her children’s studies.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Saraswati Group

texts.en:
This group was formed in the year 2015 at Kanarla village of Bolangir district, Odisha, India. There are ten active, self-dependent women, with an objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihoods. All the members of this group have their own professions and businesses.

Jangyabati is one of them who has taken a great role in her development and the group members' source of revenue improvement. She is standing as the second person from the right with a raised hand in the photo. She is about 29 years old and living with her small family, consisting of her husband and two sons.

Jangyabati and her husband have been engaged with an animal trading business for the last six years. Through this business, they earn a monthly income of 6,000 INR. Jangyabati planned to improve her business in the course of the loan. It will be the first cycle loan for the group. With the loan, Jangyabati will purchase two cows and four goats for reselling. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for her future needs.

The other nine members of her group are also smart at their professions and are also actively engaged with different businesses like vegetable vending, a grocery shop, cosmetics and fancy store, and furniture work. With this loan, they hope to heighten their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and four goats.

loans.name: Davaadorj

texts.en: Mr. Davaadorj, 37 years old, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting goods since 2011. His wife works as a nurse at a hospital. Using his previous loan, he has joined two containers and made his house. Now he is requesting a loan of 2200 USD to install vacuum insulated windows into his house. By doing so will decrease the heat loss through windows and reduce coal usage for heating, meaning less pollutant in air.

loans.use: to install vacuum insulated windows

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 27-year-old married mother of two children. She is a Palestinian Refugee, who has been working as a hairdresser to support her family members. 
Rania started working to help her parents make their living and cover their expenses, since most Palestinian refugees have limited access to most working sectors in Lebanon.

In 2006, Rania opened her own beauty salon; her experience in this field attracted new customers and increased her income. She is good standing borrower, through her previously acquired loan, Rania developed her business, and she proved to be a good standing borrower.
Today, Rania  requesting a loan from Kiva's Field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her children school tuition fees, and buy some requested products for her salon. 

Rania is working hard to expand her enterprise in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her children school tuition fees.

loans.name: Ramadan

texts.en:
Ramadan is a 24-year-old single man from Rafah city, located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. However, he wants to improve his family standard of living help them live more comfortably.
 
Ramadan took a USD loan from FATEN in order to buy filter and solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Ramadan will be able heat water more efficiently, enable the family to take warm showers, while also decreasing the electricity expenses.
 
Ramadan appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy filter and solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 43 years old and has five children.  Miriam is married and has two children are still in school.

Miriam is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Miriam requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Miriam has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Miriam would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Mary Rose works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Mary Rose is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like pants, dresses, slippers, etc.

Mary Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like pants, dresses, slippers, etc.

loans.name: Maricon

texts.en:
Maricon is 36 years old and married with four children, three of whom in school, Maricon works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, noodles, eggs, personal care products, etc..

Maricon has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Maricon would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, noodles, eggs, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 35 years old and has five children.  Mildred is married and has three children are presently in school.

Mildred is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Mildred requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mildred has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mildred would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Dory

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Dory works hard to support her family.

Dory has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store and a buy-and-sell frozen foods business. Dory is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more fish and meat to sell from her food stall.

Dory has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and meat to sell from her food stall.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 61 years old and married with seven children. Felisa works very hard to provide for them.

Felisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Felisa has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, detergent soap, cereals, noodles, fabric conditioner, etc.

Felisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma works hard to support her family. Vilma is widow and has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines.

Vilma requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as shorts, shirts, pants, etc.

Vilma has been in this business for 38 years now.

In the future, Vilma would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as shorts, shirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Ardiana

texts.en:
Ardiana is 49 years old and is married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Ardiana has borrowed and repaid 6 previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns income from raising pigs.

Ardiana aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Nyomo Baa Fee Group

texts.en:
The borrower, Mary, has been working in retail for the past 23 years. She has been a member of this group for five years. She is 50 years old, and an experienced entrepreneur. She is also single with two children, all are going to school. Mary sells yams and plantain she displays her merchandise at her markets in Osu.

She is requesting a loan from ID Ghana in order to expand her business. She is going to buy yams and plantain which she will sell to customers at the market. She started her business with some money she saved on her own. In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land and build on it.

She thanks ID Ghana for its support of women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system, and for granting them loans without any collateral guarantee. She, together with her colleagues, who are selling pork, lining and foodstuff, need a total amount of GHS 4,900 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy yams and plantains which she will sell to customers at the market.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es una joven con 18 años de edad, junto a su madre desde hace poco montaron su primer negocio, se dedican a la preparación y venta de arepas, de allí obtiene los ingresos mínimos para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Actualmente tienen una dificultad, el fogón en el cual preparan estas no funciona muy bien, es por esto que solicita un préstamo, el cual lo invertirá en la compra de un fogón nuevo.
Espera aumentar su producción y de tal manera sus ventas.
Su mayor anhelo es comprar vivienda y brindare a su familia un mejor futuro.
Anímese  y haga parte de este sueño, preste hoy.
texts.en:
Manuela is an 18-year-old young woman. Not long ago, she and her mother started their first business. They prepare and sell arepas, obtaining the minimal income to cover the basic necessities of their home.

They currently have a problem: the stove on which they prepare them isn't working very well. This is why she is requesting a loan, which she will invest in the purchase of a new stove.

She hopes to increase her production, and subsequently, her sales.

Her greatest wish is to buy a home and provide a better future for her family.

Join us and be part of this dream; lend today.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a new stove.

loans.name: Neyla Luz

texts.es:
Neyla es una joven con 20 años de edad, humilde y muy emprendedora, luego de terminar sus estudios y no encontrar empleo, tomo la decisión de montar su propio negocio y empezar a generar ingresos con sus propios medios. Inicio con la cría y venta de ganado porcino, un negocio que hasta ahora le ha funcionado muy bien. Con el deseo de aumenta su ganado y obtener mejores ingresos esta mujer solicita un préstamo con el cual comprara cerdos y alimento para los mismos al por mayor.
Su mayor sueño es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y brindarle a sus padres una mejor estabilidad económica.
Esta esta mujer quiere desde ya asegurar un futuro completamente despejado y tranquilo y con su aporte lo lograra, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Neyla, 20, is a humble and very enterprising young woman. After finishing her studies and not finding employment, she made the decision to start her own business and generate income on her own. She raises and sells pigs, a business that is going very well. 

Neyla wants to increase the livestock and earn more income. She is requesting this loan to buy pigs and the feed for them at wholesale.

Her greatest dream is to improve the conditions in her home and offer her parents better economic stability. Neyla is already looking to ensure  a bright, tranquil future and she will be able to attain it with your support. Go ahead, make a loan.

loans.use: to buy pigs and the feed for them at wholesale.

loans.name: Cherryl

texts.en:
Cherryl is 42 years old and married with two children who both attend school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Cherryl has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Cherryl requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Cherryl has been in this business for six years. In the future, Cherryl would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: That's Group

texts.en:
That is a 39-year-old resident of the Kampong Thom province. She is married and is blessed with four dependent children, three of whom are still in school (the fourth is too young to attend school). She and her husband support their family by growing rice and working for others for a fee. Together, they earn approximately $11 (USD) per day and can save around $6 per day.

Drought, which lowers the output of her rice farming, is the main challenge to her farming business. This will be the first loan for That, who is the leader of this eight member group. She is going to use her loan to buy a water filter for her family to use. She hopes to see all of her family members live healthily and to be able to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy a water filter for her family to use to live healthily.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Prasat Balang district

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 43 years old, married, and has eight children, five of whom are currently in school.

Elma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Elma has been raising pigs for 1 year now, and she has previously taken two loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Elma would like to save enough to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 54 years old and is married with two children, one of whom is in school. Susana works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Susana has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, noodles, and other groceries.

In the future, Susana would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ernita

texts.en:
Ernita is 49 years old and is married with one child.

She earns a living by running a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Ernita is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed, and vitamins for her business.

Ernita has been in the pig fattening business for 5 years and also earns income from raising chickens.

She is working tirelessly to attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed, and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia is 56 years old, married and has four children, three of whom are in school.  She farms rice in the Philippines, which she has done for 10 years. Amelia requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Amelia would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en: Salvacion, 44, is a married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. For three years, Salvacion has operated a stall selling dried fish in the Philippines. Salvacion requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more assorted dried fish to sell. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more assorted dried fish to sell

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Chanthy, aged 35, resides in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She is married and has two dependent children, one of whom is in school.

To make a living, Chanthy grows rice and cassava, and she has been doing this for years. Earning about USD $17 per day, Chanthy can manage to save about USD $11 each day for future needs. The decline of cassava prices is the challenge to her farming business.

Chanthy is now a leading a group, which is comprised of two members, to request loans from VisionFund. Chanthy has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles already and past loans have helped her to buy household appliances for her family and send her children to school.

Chanthy is going to use her loan portion to purchase organic fertilizer, pay for labor fees, and to celebrate a traditional ceremony in her family.

She hopes to increase her yields to buy two hectares of land to grow cassava and cashew so that she can keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to support rice farming by purchasing organic fertilizer which will increase her yields and help her to buy a two-hectare area of farmland and keep her children in school.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 20-year-old single ambitious man. He has been employed in construction business, specialized in outer stone layer work for four years.
He had to work hard to support his family since early age. Husein is willing to improve his living, that's why he decided to start his own business to increase his income.
For this reason he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to start his own business through opening a cafe and purchasing an espresso machine.
Husein is working hard to succeed in his newly established work and has future expansion plans.

loans.use: to start his own business through opening a cafe and purchasing an espresso machine.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 36 years old and married with two children, two children are currently in school, Marivic works very hard to provide for them.

Marivic runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and etc .

Marivic has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future Marivic would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and etc

loans.name: Narcissa

texts.en:
Narcissa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 12000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs for her pig fattening business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is requesting this new loan to further build her business.

Narcissa has been in this business for 8 years and earns more income from selling dry goods and general store.

Narcissa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 54 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like eggs, bread, noodles, cooking oil, detergent soap, and coffee to sell in her store. Rowena has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Rowena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like eggs, bread, noodles, cooking oil, detergent soap, and coffee to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra is 54 years old, married and has six children. She has been a rice farmer in the Philippines for 20 years. Sandra requested a 6000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has borrowed eight times from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Sandra would like to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married mother with no children. She owns a house that neither  has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over ten years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Dolly Petrona

texts.es:
Dolly es una señora con 59 años de edad, se dedicó a la cría y venta de ganado porcino luego de pasar por una fuerte situación económica la cual vivió después de separarse de su esposo, quien era el sostén del hogar.
Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de cerdos y alimento para los mismo al por mayor.
Dolly sueña viendo su casa bonita, ya que esta lleva mucho tiempo de construida y su actual estado no es el mejor.
Los diversos factores que la han llevado al fracaso en situaciones anteriores no han sido inpedimento para querer salir adelante y cumplir con sus proyectos. Se le debe apoyar.
texts.en:
Dolly is a 59 year old woman who makes a living breeding and selling of pigs. She began doing this after going through a severe economic hardship, which she experienced after separating from her husband, who was the breadwinner.

She is currently requesting a loan which will be invested in the purchase of pigs and pig food in bulk.

Dolly dreams of seeing her nice house, which will take a long time to build, as its current state is not in the best shape.

The various factors that have led to failure in previous situations have not prevented Dolly from wanting to succeed and fulfill her goals. Please support her.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig food in bulk.

loans.name: Miguel Jacinto

texts.es:
Miguel es un señor soltero con 54 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de Sahagún, luego de quedar sin empleo y no contar con el apoyo de un familiar que lo ayude económicamente, este hombre decide montar un negocio y empezar a generar ingresos por sus propios medios, inicio con la cría y venta de ganado porcino, al principio sus ventas eran  muy buenas, al tiempo ya bajaron mucho debido a la competencia en el sector.
Es por esto que este hombre solicita un préstamo, con el fin de comprar pollos, cerdos y alimento al por mayor.
Su mayor anhelo es poder pagar la educación de sus hijos, pues su bienestar le preocupa.
Sabe que con la ayuda de Interactuar y los colaboradores del portal Kiva sus sueños se harán realidad.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 54 year old single man. He has 3 children and lives in the town of Sahagun. After being unemployed and without the support of a family member to help him financially, he decided to start a business and start generating income on his own, starting with the breeding and sale of pigs. At first his sales were very good, but with time they lowered substantially due to to competition in the sector.

That is why Miguel is asking for a loan in order to buy chickens, pigs and food wholesale.

His greatest wish is to pay for his children's education, as their well-being is his main concern. He knows that with the help of Interactuar and the Kiva collaborators his dreams can come true.

loans.use: buy chickens, pigs, and food in bulk.

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.en:
This group is called Shalom. The members of the group have a variety of businesses, and they have joined the micro-finance institution ID-Ghana in order to successfully carry out their trading activities. Their loan funds will be used in a number of ways. For example, one person will purchase grocery, drinks and hair product to provide hair dressing service to her customers; another will invest in pedicure and manicure accessories. All the members of the group live in traditional families in Chorkor, Accra. 
Gifty, pictured on the right, wigs, drinks and grocery, provide hair dressing service to her customers. She plans to use her loan to buy more drinks, grocery and hair products which she will sell to her customers. She is expecting to make a good profit as a result of this investment. Thanks to this profit, Gifty will be able to contribute more toward the daily expenses of her family, as well as to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy more drinks, grocery and hair products which she will sell to her customers.

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en:
Yusif is a maize farmer from Zanfarawa village. As a Babban Gona member, Yusif is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 MT/Ha, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yusif would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Yusif will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Yusif no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Yusif hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en: Sokheng is 60 years old, married mother with two children and lives in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. She has fattened pigs to sell since 2009. Her husband is a 59-year-old rice farmer who is joining her in the picture, her two children work in a factory. Sokheng would like to request a loan because she is short of the funds to buy pig feed for her pigs. This loan will help her have enough money to buy pig feed and improve her family’s finances from selling those pigs. In the future, she is going to buy more pigs and cows, build a new proper house for her children.

loans.use: to buy pig feed for her pigs

loans.name: Saman

texts.en:
Saman is a 35-year-old married factory worker with two children and she lives in a village in the province of Takeo province, Cambodia. For the past two years, she has worked in the factory. Her husband is a 37-year-old construction worker. One of her two children attends school and another is a factory worker as well. Together, they can make approximately USD 19 per day.

She is requesting a loan because she wants to buy cows to fatten and breed for calves to sell. With the loan, she will be able to improve the family’s finances. For her future plans, she is going to buy more cows, renovate a proper house and help her youngest child to earn a higher education.

loans.use: to buy cows to fatten and breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Khongorzul

texts.en: Khongorzul is 27 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband have been selling mattresses at the bazaar since 2007. They take turns in selling the mattresses. Their daughters are under age and someone has to stay at home with them. She is requesting a loan of 2200 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. By doing so her family will live in comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollutant into air.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Solidarity - N02K3Ttqlào Group

texts.en:
Mrs Huyền is 57 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture as a farmer for more than 10 years. Huyền lives in Yen Dinh district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. And the income from this business is unstable because the output of the crop belongs to the weather conditions.

The main hardship that Huyền faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for increasing the productivity.

In 2013, Huyền joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Huyền has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the group leader of "Solidarity - N02K3TTQLào", which consists of three members.
In the future, Huyền hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for increasing productivity.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 65 years old and widowed with five children.

Loreta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and etc .

Loreta has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Loreta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and etc

loans.name: Leda

texts.en:
Leda is 43 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

Leda is borrowing 18000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for 15 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Leda is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Yang's Group

texts.en:
Yang, 55, is a local farmer of Banteay Meanchey province. She is a widowed mother of seven children, one of whom (a son) is dependent and in school. To make a living, she has been raising pigs to earn main source of income for 30 years. High cost of pig feed and pigs getting ill are the challenges of pig-raising business.

This is the first cycle loan for her with VisionFund; as the leader of five members group, she will use her loan to buy piglets and feed to nourish them. She hopes to earn more income to expand her business and keep her son in school.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed to nourish them in order to expand the current business and keep her son in school. .

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Smile To Shine - N06Xtiêndlực Group

texts.en:
Huyền is 38 years old and she is married with 2 children. Mrs. Huyền has had a manufacturing business making wood furniture for 8 years.She lives in Dong Son district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. And this is a hard job because the carpenter must be clever and skillful.

The main hardship that Huyền faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase wood for woodworking.

In 2014, Huyền joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Huyền has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
Huyền is the group leader of "Smile to shine - N06XTiênDLực", which consists of 5 members.
In the future, Huyền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase wood for woodworking.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru: Нодира 37 летняя бизнес леди. Она уроженка района Руми. Нодира  сейчас замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Нодира занимается один видом бизнеса. Она продает женскую одежду. У нее дома есть точка продаже, и она еще один раз в недели продает свой товар на рынке. Но по ее словам ей удобна, заниматься торговлей у себя дома, потому что у нее есть маленький ребенок. Она ухаживает за ребенка и ведет домашнее хозяйство. Нодира очень заботливая и активная женщина. Путем торговлей деятельности она кормить ребенка. Нодира хочет расширить деятельность и увеличить доход. Она просит кредит для купли больше одежды на продажу.
texts.en:
Nodira is a 37 years old businesswoman. She is a native of the Rumy region. She is married and has one child. 

Nodira works with selling women's clothing. She has a sales point at her home, and once per week she also sells her goods at the market. To her it is more convenient to sell from her home because she has a small child. She looks after the child and runs the household.

Nodira is a loving and active woman. Through her retail business she feeds her child. Nodira would like to expand her business and increase her income. She requests a loan in purchase more clothing for selling.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for selling and expanding her retail business

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be obedient. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes,onions,carrots. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes,onions, carrots. Her business goal is to have a well stocked business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes,onions, carrots

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Filipinos are known to be resilient and tough. Comparable to bamboo trees, they are bent but not broken. They also gather strength through togetherness and camaraderie. This is the exact description of how Rosario, 59 years old, was able to recover and rehabilitate her variety store business. Not long ago, her husband got serious illness and subsequently passed away. She mourned and her business also suffered because she closed it for almost six months. With the unwavering support and concern of her children, she gradually restored it. Her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative in Polomolok, South Cotabato also contributed a lot through their inspiring stories and Bible reflections. 

As she continues to rehabilitate her business, she needs additional capital of PHP 50,000 to obtain more stocks of groceries, sacks of rice, and cases of softdrinks. Her business not only provides for their everyday expenditures but it also soothes away her loneliness due to her husband’s loss.  

She dreams of a successful life and career for her children and good health for the whole family. She continuously meets with her co-fellowship members every week to strengthen each other through sharing and Bible reflections. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to obtain more stocks of groceries, sacks of rice, and cases of softdrinks

loans.name: Davis

texts.en: Davis is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a butchery. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be meat spoilage. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a freezer for meat storage. His business goal is to be a supplier off meat to other retailers within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for meat storage
